loans.name: Riski

texts.en:
A. Riski is 46 years old and a widow with two children. She sells women’s shawls in the central market of Shahrituz and her business has been successful for 15 years. Riski’s sales are the main source of her income which allows her to improve the living conditions in her home and to provide her children with education. She requests $1000 to purchase more shawls in order to increase the range of goods she offers for sale. Riski would like to thank everyone for supporting her and promises to pay off the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase more women's shawls to sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice owns a farm. She cultivates pumpkin leaves (green vegetable leaves). Eunice has been in this farm business for the past eight years, after learning from her friend for a year. Eunice has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years. Eunice is 43 years old and married with three children. Eunice is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more pumpkin seeds (green vegetable seed) to plant on her farm. She is very happy with LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their financial support. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more pumpkin seeds to plant

loans.name: Amirbeg

texts.ru: Давлатов Амирбег житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 49 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Старший сын работает в Российской Федерации. Сам клиент вместе с женой работают в сельском хозяйстве , а так же  в сфере животноводства.Бизнесом по перепродаже крупно рогатого скота они работают уже 12 лет. Сейчас планируют купить еще пару молоденьких бычков для их откормки и дальнейшей перепродажи.
texts.en:
Amirbeg D. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 49 years old, is married and has four children. His older son works in the Russian Federation. The client himself together with his wife works in agriculture and raises livestock. They have had a business reselling large livestock for 12 years now. Now they plan to purchase two more young bulls in order to fatten them and resell them in the future.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increaese livestock count

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora A. is managing a small farm. She grows corn close by her house. She is 34 years old and has 3 children. Her husband, Mansueto A. is also a farmer. Aside from corn, both of them grow vegetables in their farm. The income that Nora gets from her corn farm has helped a lot to sustain the whole family.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers. She thinks that by doing so, she will increase her yield. Nora is also interested to venture to other possible income areas. She needs a loan not just to improve her farm but to start a new business as well.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. It provides not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and seeds

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is 45 years old and married with 2 children. Dorcas sells provisions. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Hồ Thị

texts.en:
N. Hồ Thị (129011933) is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, N. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling dried goods in the local community. N. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $277) a month from these activities.

In 1994, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. N. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be 129011933. The loan will be the 15th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Trong's Group

texts.en:
Trong T. N. was born in 1968. She breeds pigs and poultry. She has a monthly income of about 2,500,000 VND. She wants to borrow 2,204,000 VND (or 125 USD) for 25 weeks to buy food for her domestic animals.

 Mai T. N. was born in 1964. She sells pork in the market. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She wants to borrow 2,204,000 VND (or 125 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: To buy food for domestic animals

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife M. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Marife is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marife owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing transport services using their "habal-habal" or motorcycle vehicle to local community members. Marife and her husband have been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earn approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Marife joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marife is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for motorcycle maintenance. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marife from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save for future emergencies and for the children's school fees.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: the motorcycle maintenance or repair

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a business manager of her own enterprise. She is 36 years old and mother to four children: two girls and two boys. She is happily married to Noel, a rickshaw driver, who is 39 years old. She lives in Antipolo City, Rizal province in the Philippines.

She believes that it's not poverty that can hinder her way to success if she knows how to fight it. In 2008, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, with hope to have access to capital to finance her business, resale of rice.

Now on her 3rd loan, she proposes a loan of 15,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. Specifically to pay for 10 sacks of rice and for the transportation expenses. Since rice is the staple food for Filipinos, she is positive that her business will click and will always be in demand.

She is hopeful that she can save for the future of her children and aspires to building a house of her own.

loans.use: To pay for 10 sacks of rice and for the transportation expenses

loans.name: Norma Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Norma es socia del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales”, en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 01 hijo, ella pudo estudiar educación superior (educación primaria). Vive en el Barrio Porteño.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, su negocio es la venta de abarrotes.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir productos de belleza.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, ya que ahora también se dedica a elaborar artesanías.  Este préstamo le servirá para poder comprar lanas acrílica de colores, lana de alpaca para la elaboración de prendas de vestir chompas, chalecos y accesorios (artesanía).

Su deseo es ejercer su profesión y educar a su hijo.

A ella le gustan las charlas y las reuniones ya que aprende mucho de ellas.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Community Bank "Diana de Gales" located in the district and province of Puno. She is 30 years old and she lives with her partner and their son. She studied to be a primary school teacher. She lives in the district of Porteno. She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for 4 years. Her business is a grocery store business. Her first loan of S/.300 nuevos soles was used as capital funds to purchase beauty products. Currently she requires an additional loan in the amount of S/.1200 nuevos soles which will be used to make crafts. This loan will help her purchase acrylic yarns of different colors, and alpaca wool to make items of clothing such as jackets, vests and accessories. Her dream is to be able to work in her field of studies and to send her son to school. She loves sharing with others in the meetings because she learns so much from her colleagues.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase acrylic yarns of different colors and alpaca wool.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is now fifty-six years old and is married to Dionicio M., who runs their furniture business. They are presently residing in the village of Allinguigan 3rd, Ilagan, Isabela and they are blessed with four children who are in their adult ages. 

	Flora has a passenger tricycle which is being operated by her son. Aside from this, she is also indulged in livestock business where she manages a poultry business. She has been in this kind of business for already two years and she would like to further expand her poultry business to be more profitable. Flora is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP6, 000 to have funds in purchasing needed materials to be replaced in her passenger tricycle. She also plans to purchase another batch of chicks for her poultry to maintain her livestock business. She hopes to avail the loan because it is of big help to their family.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 23 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family where she also runs her business. She started selling secondhand clothes in 2007. She buys her merchandise in bulk from a large market and goes to sell in other local marketplaces and also to her neighbors. She requires Kshs 15,000 to boost her business.

loans.use: To give her business a boost.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.en:
TeofiL. is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres D. Fe (Women of Faith). Her story is representative of both her group members and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients. Her group is based in the community of Las Flores in the coastal city of Puerto Plata, where running water (which is not potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. She rents a simple structure of concrete walls and a tin roof where she lives with her husband. She is six months pregnant.

TeofiL. has become a successful Esperanza associate and has already successfully repaid three loans. With this loan she intends to purchase precious stones, Larimar (a locally mined precious stone) coconuts, shells, lanyards and metal wiring to use in her artisan work. She plans to market her goods both in her native City of Puerto Plata, but also hopes to market them in other islands in the Caribbean by sending them to her father who works in the Turks and Caicos. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Precious stones, Larimar, coconuts, shells, lanyards and metal wiring

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta G. is from the village of Barangay Uno. She is 60 years old and married with four grown children. To make a living, Loreta owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $100 a month from these activities.

In 2007, Loreta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loreta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica N. is a widow with seven children. She lives in Ntaghem- Nkwen- Cameroon.  Monica and her entire family are living in a house with three rooms. Monica had to overcome some challenges in life such as ill health, difficulties in paying her children's  school fees and the death of her husband. She has fire wood business and also sells food stuffs in order to earn a living.

This will be Monica sixth loan from GHAPE. She has been a member since 2003. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to the location of her business and her reasonable prices.  Also with her experience, Monica is now receiving good profits from her business. Part of her profits from this loan will be used to take care of her children and to buy necessities for the family and the remainder will be ploughed back part into  her business.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its client

loans.use: Buying of fire wood, yams, potatoes, tomatoes

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: A. Marguerite est née le 18 Juillet 1982 à Dangbo, non loin de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Marguerite réside au quartier Gankpodo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis près de 10 ans. Mariée à DASSI Fulbert, un menuisier, Marguerite est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Marguerite vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Seul Fulbert assure les charges de la famille. Marguerite n’a jamais été à l’école. Ainsi depuis douze ans, Marguerite vend des habits et des pommades corporelles de façon ambulante. Marguerite fait ses achats à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Afin d’augmenter la taille de son activité et de satisfaire davantage sa clientèle, Marguerite sollicite un sixième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Marguerite was born on July 18, 1982 in Dangbo, not far from Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin.  For nearly 10 years, she has been residing in the Gankpodo district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to DASSI Fulbert, a furniture maker, she is the mother of two children who are both in school.  Marguerite lives together with her husband and children.  Fulbert alone ensures that family expenses are met.  Marguerite has never been to school.  Thus, for a dozen years, she has been selling clothing and body ointments from door-to-door.  She acquires her merchandise in Lomé, Togo, a country neighboring Benin.  She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans.  To expand her business and to satisfy her customers further, she's requesting a sixth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en:
Titilayo sells crates of drinks in her house and has been in this business for four years. She is very happy about her business because she does not have to pay stall rent. The demand for her drinks is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers.

Titilayo is married with four children and she is 48 years old. She is a friendly woman and she uses her friendly skill to attract more customers to her business.

Titilayo is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. Titilayo is requesting a loan 100,000 NGN to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Buhbaatar

texts.en:
Buhbaatar B. is 44 years old and lives with his two teenage children in Gobi-Altai province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. Since his wife's death two years ago, he has been caring for his two children and running his small business, selling livestock raw materials. Buhbaatar buys the skin, hide and meat of cattle, sheep and goats from local families. He sells these materials at a higher price in the local market. 

Buhbaatar has been in this business since 2003.  He has many herders who like selling their livestock's raw materials and meat to him. Before his wife's death, he and his family moved from the countryside to the town where they currently live. He says that he bought the house that his family lives in with profits from his business.  In the future, he would like to replace the furniture in his home, as it is old, and some pieces are broken.  Buhbaatar adds that he is working hard to set aside some money to open a saving account for his children. He requests a loan to purchase skin, hide and meat for his small business.

loans.use: To purchase skin, hide and meat to resell

loans.name: Hila

texts.en:
Hila is a 47-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their seven children.

Hila has been working in agriculture since 2006, owning a small dairy farm. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to increase the number of her livestock. This is the first time that Hila has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

Hila is speciA. in her business because she produces good dairy products and is known in her region for her good production. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Hila decided on doing her business to supplement her husband’s income since they passed through some financiA. issues.

In the future, Hila plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To increase the number of her livestock

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria T., 27, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Mr. T., a family driver, they are blessed with one child. She helps her husband earn income so their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store for nine months.

Gloria has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for less than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow three times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy additional stock for her store.  She earns about PHP 4,400 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan which will be used to buy stock of instant noodles, snacks, and beverages for her store.  She prays that her life will continue to be peaceful and that God will be the center of their lives forever. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To stock her store with instant noodles, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Mukim

texts.ru: Сафаров Муким проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 34 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Сафаров Муким имеет среднее образование. Торговлей занимается более 6 лет. Он продает продукты питания. В этом ему помогает жена. Муким привозит продукты из города Душанбе. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Mukim S. lives in the Vahdat district. He is 34 years, old, married and has 4 children. Mukim has a secondary education. He has been involved in retail sales for over 6 years. He sells food products with the help of his wife. Mukim brings in the products from the city of Dushanbe. He is requesting the loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana María Z. se ha destacado por ser una dama muy trabajadora que se dedica a la elaboración de helados los que son ofertados por ella misma en el municipio de El Sauce siendo vendidos ambulantemente exponiéndose a la molestia del sol y el cansancio por caminar a diario.
Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de conos, miel  y sabores para la elaboración de helados y de esta manera continuar ofertándolos en las calles del municipio.
texts.en:
Ana María Z. stands out as a very hardworking woman. She sells ice cream, which she offers for sale in the town of El Sauce. Being a street vendor, she is exposed to the discomfort of working in the sun and exhaustion from walking each day. She is requesting a loan to buy cones, honey and flavors to make ice cream, so that she can continue to offer her products on the streets of the town.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cones, honey and flavors for the production of ice cream

loans.name: Mutinda

texts.en:
Mutinda is 30 years old and married to Monicah Wanjiru. He has been employed as a motorcycle taxi operator in Naivasha for the last two years. He now wants to buy his own motorbike which will give him a higher return.

Mutinda was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy another motorcycle in a year’s time and to employ someone else to run it for him. The purchase of another motorcycle will increase his income tremendously.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: A. Monique

texts.fr: O. A. Monique est née le 09 Décembre 1985 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a environs 10 ans que Monique s'est installée au quartier Gbowèlè à Allada dans le département de l'Atlantique. Mariée à BOKO Lazare un menuisier, Monique est mère de deux enfants dont un est scolarisé. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Monique a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a envions huit ans, afin de subvenir à ses besoins, Monique vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. De façon secondaire, Monique vend également du maïs. Monique achète ses produits à Allada, et les vend également dans la même ville. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Monique voudrait renforcer son activité et accroître sa clientèle, ce qui lui permettra de se faire plus de revenu. Pour réaliser son projet, Monique sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
A. Monique O. was born 9 December 1985 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Some ten years ago, she settled in the Gbowèlè borough of Allada in the Department of the Atlantic. Married to Lazare BOKO, a carpenter, Monique is the mother of two children of whom one attends school. The couple jointly shares family expenses. Monique interrupted school at the secondary level. To meet her needs over the past eight years, Monique has been selling phone recharge cards. As a secondary business, she also sells corn. She buys her products in Allada, and sells them in the same town. She is a regular client of ALIDé, having been granted three previous loans, all repaid in full. Monique wishes to reinforce her activity and expand her customer base, which will generate more income. To enable this to happen, she is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy phone recharge cards wholesale

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en:
Dulamsuren is 51 years old and lives with her husband and three children in an apartment in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her husband cannot work due to suffering from a brain hemorrhage and receives a pension from the government. Her family has been living together in their current home for 10 years. 

Dulamsuren operates a grocery store, and her business is her family's only source of income. She has been operating her business since 2005, and has a loyal customer base. Dulamsuren is an open-minded person who is working hard to improve her family's standard of living. She has been planning to support her oldest son in creating a household of his own. 

Dulamsuren is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more food products for her grocery store. Her profits tend to remain high as long as she maintains a wide product selection.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Jonna Mae

texts.en:
Jonna Mae is 24 years old and is engaged in farming for a living. She is married and has a seven-year-old child. She and her husband work hard to make their rice farm productive. Jonna Mae wants to save early for her child’s future. She also hopes to have a stable income.
Jonna Mae is a member of Kiva partner, CEVI. She is now applying for a loan of 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Gye Nyame Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Juliana is a women’s leader and a role model to most young women in her community. She is thirty-eight years, divorced, and the mother of three children from age 14-18 who are pursuing their education at high school level. She lives together with her children in a town close to MA..

Juliana is a food vendor who sells cooked rice and yams to customers in her community. Operating her trade for the past 16 years, Juliana has amassed good sales experience and made many loyal customers.  

Juliana is currently the leader of a trust bank group called "Gye Nyame," translated as "Except God" in the Twi language, made up of nine members. The other members are also engaged in trades such as food selling, hairdressing, grocery sales, used clothing sales etc. They are the major breadwinners of their respective families and are requesting a loan to support their businesses with the hopes of raising more income to support their families. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and to be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients like rice, oil and spices in bulk

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Sarah used to be a coconut seller, but 15 years ago she opened her grocery shop. She also sells firewood as an alternative source of income. From her shop, she primarily sells her goods to her neighbors, and she says the business is doing very well. She has requested this loan to restock her shop.

Sarah has a full house, with 8 children (evenly split between boys and girls, and all in school) in addition to herself and her husband, who works as a watchman.

She currently owns her house (with no electricity or piped water), and her plan for the future is to make enough to build a rental house that she can use as a second source of income.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, fish, cooking oil, and wheat flour

loans.name: Kyenjojo Bakyara Twekambe, Kyenjojo Group

texts.en:
Hardworking 40-year-old K. Laila has, over the last four years, been overseeing her growing spare parts business in Kyenjojo town.

With a weekly net profit of 100,000 Ugandan shillings, this married lady has enjoyed the good that has come with running this lucrative business. All her six children are in good schools around Kyenjojo. Consequently, she has made good progress in as far as educating her children is concerned.

Laila’s first step after acquiring this loan is to purchase more stock of car spare parts with an objective of turning her business into one of the biggest in Western Uganda.

Laila belongs to a group of members who hold each other accountable and insure one another in paying back the loan.

She has a dream of being able to import her own vehicles for sale and this will greatly improve her standard of living, to enable her take good care of her six children and three orphans.

loans.use: To purchase car spare parts for resale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan P. is in the business of selling food in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more food to sell.  Susan is 40 years-old and a widow.   She has five children and three of her children attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007,  BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To buy food to resell.

loans.name: Crispina Japus Group

texts.en:
Crispina J. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old and is the group leader of this two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. The official name of this borrowing group is Crispina J. Group.

Crispina is married and has five school-aged children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Crispina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Crispina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Jeneve

texts.en: Jeneve S. is from the village of Danao. She is 32 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Jeneve owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jeneve joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Jeneve is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia A. is currently in the business of selling local brew at home and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer to sell. Cecilia is 37 years old and is married with a husband that is a builder. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

loans.use: Stock crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo Y. lives in the village of Gen. Balao, Solana, Cagayan. He is 30 years old, married and has three school-aged children. He makes a living by raising livestock, principally pigs, which he fattens before selling. He has been in this line of work for more than two years and earns about 3,500 PHP each time he sells an animal. 

Earlier this year, Danilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He is applying for his first loan, for 4,000 PHP, to buy baby livestock to raise and sell when they are grown. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to supplement his family's income. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy young livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Ahtam

texts.ru: Чураев Ахтам проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст, 51 год. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Образование высшее, инженер. По профессии проработал 5 лет. Сейчас он вместе с женой занимается животноводством и птицеводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. В этой области более 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Ahtam C. lives in the Varzob district. He is 51 years old, married and has one child. He has a higher education, as an engineer. He worked in that field for 5 years. Currently, together with his wife, Ahtam is involved in animal husbandry and poultry farming. He breeds livestock at home. Ahtam primarily fattens and sells livestock. He has been in this business for over 6 years. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle in order to increase livestock quantity.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou N. est une coiffeuse qui gére son salon de coiffure à Thiadiaye un arrondissement dans le département de Mbour .Elle vend également des produits cosmétiques et d'autres articles de beauté .Aissatou a sollicité ce prêt pour renforcer son commmerce pour l'acquisition de nouveaux produits déstinés à sa clientèle ainsi elle pourra  faire avancer son activité et faire face à ses besoins sociaux
texts.en: Mrs. Aissatou N. is a hair-dresser who runs a hair salon in Thiadiaye, a neighborhood within the Mbour district.  She sells both cosmetics and other beauty products.  Aissatou requested this loan in order to strengthen her business in order to acquire new products for her clientele. By doing so, she will be able to improve her business and be able to meet her basic needs.

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel tiene la edad de 31 años, es casado, y tiene 4 hijos de 10, 8, 6 y 1 de edad que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar almacigo para sembra una área nueva de cafe. Cuenta con 1 hectárea y cuarta para la siembra. Ademas con el dinero que sobra comprara un terreno vacío para aumentar la cantidad de producción. Sus metas están cancelar el almacigo y comprado y generar mayores ganancias para el futuro de su familia. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibida de FUDECOSUR y esta contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
texts.en:
Miguel is 31 years old and married.  He has four children; ages 10, 8, 6, and 1.  His children are his greatest priority.

He wants to buy a seedbed to plant coffee in a new area.  He has one and a quarter hectares for planting.  With the money that is left over, he will buy a vacant field to increase his production.  

His goals are to pay for the seedbed and to generate greater earnings for his family’s future.  

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is happy with the services that have been provided.

loans.use: To plant coffee

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
Ángela de 25 años de edad, reside junto a su familia en Santa Elena, departamento de Usulután, vive con sus padres y 2 hermanos, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Esta familia se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y crianza de cerdos, Ángela trabaja junto a su madre en la crianza de cerdos pero en este momento quieren comprar más cerdos para aumentar su granja.
Ella solicita un préstamo para salir de esta situación ya que como comerciantes no quieren tener pocos cerdos pues viene el tiempo en que la gente le gusta comprar para la noche de navidad, esta época las ha motivado para invertir y tener la posibilidad de tener mejores ventas.
Ella quiere tener un buen negocio y administrarlo con su madre de la mejor manera, y que su familia se vea beneficiada de mejores ingresos y mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ángela is 25 years old and lives along with her family in Santa Elena, in the Usulután region.  She lives with her parents and 2 brothers.  She is single and has no children.  This family is dedicated to cattle breeding, agriculture and farming pigs.  Ángela works with her mother to raise the pigs.  At this time, they would like to buy more pigs in order to expand their farm.

She is soliciting a loan in order to have lots of pigs ready for the Christmas season when many people like to buy pork.  This season has motivated her to invest in order to have the possibility of greater sales.

She would like to have a good business and manage it with her mother in the best way.  Her family would benefit from the greater income and thus greater living condition.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: La señora Albina nacida en  Chuquisaca con 5 hijos que se encuentra en edad escolar, ella viene trabajando hace 4 años con Emprender, por que es la única entidad que le abrió las puertas es una persona muy trabajadora se dedica a la agricultura, siembra  maíz, yuca, maní y también se dedica a la ganadería. Tiene 10 hectáreas de tierras, sus productos va a vender en el mercado de la zona, sus hijos le ayudan en la siembra y cosecha, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de una Motosierra y también para la compra de semillas, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Albina was born in Chuquisaca and has five children who are of school age. She has worked with Emprender for the past four years because it was the only entity that opened its doors to her. Albina is a hardworking woman who engages in agriculture. She grows corn, cassava, and peanuts and also raises livestock. Albina owns ten hectares of land and sells her products at the local market. Her children help with the planting and harvesting.

The money from this loan will be used to purchase a chainsaw as well as seeds. Albina is extremely grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Purchase a chainsaw & seeds

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline M. is a 35-year-old married lady who has five children. She operates a retail shop in the Marereni area in Malindi town.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the company’s existing clients. She is now taking her second loan which amounts to Kshs 75,000.  She plans to expand her business with it by buying more stock of goods to sell during the festive season and to repair the business premise. 

Jackline hopes that by doing this, her business will grow and she will be able to use the anticipated profit to help support her family, as well as be able to own a flourishing business premise.

loans.use: To buy more stock, and repair business premise

loans.name: Dus Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Dus Maiya M., a resident of Thecho, lives with her husband and two children. Her daughter and son are studying in grades 7 and 4, respectively. 

Mrs. Dus Maiya M. and her husband, Mr. Nucha M., are both engaged in idol-making. They make different types of traditional gods' idols, according to the demands of their customers.  In their area, the demand for idols is increasing, and to meet the demand, they need to invest  in their business.  Due to lack of funds, they have been unable to meet the demands of their customers. Mrs. M. is requesting a loan of Rs 20000.00 to buy raw materials such as wax, silver and bronze for their business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Jessica Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz y Progreso.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Jessica, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una hermosa niña  de 3 años. Su marido es comerciante vende legumbres en el mercado Nº 1.

Se dedica a la venta productos por catálogos de Esika Y Lebel (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además de ropa por catalogo, trabaja tres días  a la semana desde las 8h30 hasta las 11h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y tiene muchos clientes que le realizan sus pedidos deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Su mercadería la entrega en su casa.

Este crédito lo va a compartir, una mitad para comprar ropa, cremas, perfumes y la otra parte para el negocio del esposo para que compre frutas y legumbres. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 2 ciclos y le gusta por la facilidad para obtener los créditos. Sus metas son tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de una hermana.
texts.en: Members of the Luz y Progreso (Light and Progress) Community Bank meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province that has long been known as the city with real tamarind. It is here we find Jessica, who is 23 years old, married and has a 3-year-old daughter. Her husband sells legumes at the local market. Jessica makes a living selling Esika and Lebel brand beauty products (cosmetics, perfumes, women's accessories) via catalog. She works three days a week from 8:30 to 11 a.m., selling items door to door, and she has a lot of customers who make orders on credit and have weekly payments. Her merchandise is delivered to her home. She plans to share the loan, with half going to buy clothing, lotions and perfumes, and the other half going to her husband to buy fruits and legumes for his business. This is her second loan with this community bank and she likes the simplicity in getting the loan. Her goal is to have her own home since she lives in her sister's house.

loans.use: Purchase lotions, perfumes, clothing, fruits and legumes

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz lives in Okara which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture and industry. She has been living there with her family in the area of Kirpa ram for past 9 years. 
She is a talented lady, expert in embroidery works. She collects orders from different clothes shops and fulfills the order on time to earn an income for the family. 
Her husband’s name is S. K. and he is a fruit seller by trade. He starts his work early in the morning and visits different streets of the city on his four-wheeled cart to sell his fruits. 
Shahnaz has given birth to 6 sons. She couldn’t provide them education facilities due to financial constraints.  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan he will buy fresh seasonal fruits in bulk to sell through his cart. He is operating this business for past 8 years and Shahnaz is very hopeful about his business growth. 
She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes that it will bring positive changes in her family’s living standard. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz”.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for fruit selling business

loans.name: Benjamin Waweru

texts.en:
Benjamin Waweru M., 28 years old, is married to Mary and they are blessed with two children.  He operates an electronics shop as a primary business and at the same time, he manages a motorcycle transport business locally known as ‘Boda boda‘ in the Kiserian market. This market is very busy, thus many customers.  He has been in this business for six months with a good income.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing member of KADET, and he is applying for his first loan of KES. 80,000, which he intends to use to add more tools to the electronics shop e.g. brakes, screws, pampers, etc. The extra income he will use to buy more bulbs and petrol engine oil.

In the future, he hopes to grow his business, open another branch, and ensure that his family’s basic needs are met.

loans.use: To add more electronic tools to the shop

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes B. is from the village of San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old, is married, and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Agnes owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, and toothpaste in the local community. Agnes also has a part-time tailoring service repairing curtains and bed sheets. She has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Agnes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI of 9000 PHP, which was used for working capital and to purchase additional inventory. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory such as canned goods and snack foods. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory such as canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward O. A. is widowed with two children who are in school.  

He makes and sells clothes to earn a living. He has engaged in the business for five years and he has employed four people. With the income from his business, he is able to educate his children.  

 He has requested 30,000 KES to buy fabric and sewing yarn.

He hopes to open a cloth manufacturing factory in the future.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing yarn

loans.name: 11Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Hồng Lê Thị (59) is a 40-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Hồng is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 11-Đông Vệ (08.01.11-Đông Vệ).

Hồng is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Hồng owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Hồng has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hồng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hồng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Loan (57) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Lê Thị Nga (58) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  N. Thị Hương (60) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  N. Thị Huyền (61) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hồng Lê Thị (59) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Hồng là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 11-Đông Vệ (08.01.11-Đông Vệ ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Hồng thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hồng kiếm được khoảng 2,500,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Hồng đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hồng đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,253,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,159,600 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Loan (57) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Lê Thị Nga (58) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  N. Thị Hương (60) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  N. Thị Huyền (61) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ivania Group

texts.es:
El grupo de Ivania se compone de tres mujeres trabajadoras, dedicadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es Ana Julia S. de 54 años. En el 2005, comenzó su pequeño taller de costura y un restaurante. Ella invertirá el crédito en telas, hilo, botones etc.

Los otros miembros son Petrona García, de 51 años quien vende frutas como la sandía, piña, papaya, etc. y  Irene S. tiene una pulperia.
texts.en:
The Ivania group is made up of three hard-working, committed and enterprising women.  The coordinator of this group is 54 year-old Ana Julia S..  In 2005 Ana set up her small sewing workshop and a restaurant.  She will invest her loan in buying fabric, thread, buttons, etc.

The other members of this group are 51 year-old Petrona García who sells fruit such as watermelon, pineapple, papaya, etc. and Irene S. who owns a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Sor Miriam

texts.es:
Las necesidades económicas por las que atravesaba la familia de Sor Miriam conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijos fueron el impulso para que esta emprendedora empezara a hacer de la tradicional arepa su propio negocio, una entrada familiar que aunque como ella misma lo afirma no son muchas las ganancias por lo menos se equilibran los gastos del hogar. 

Actualmente Sor necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones locativas, pues para poder continuar vendiendo su producto deberá cumplir con unas normas básicas de sanidad.
texts.en:
The economic needs faced by the family of Sor Miriam -- made up of her husband and their two children -- were the impetus for this entrepreneur to start her own business making traditional arepas [corn cakes]. Although she admits that the profits from this source of family income are not large, at least the household expenses are covered.

Currently, Sor needs a loan to carry out some improvements to her work area, since in order to continue selling her product, she will have to comply with some basic health standards.

loans.use: to improve her work area in order to meet basic health standards

loans.name: Loretta

texts.en:
Loretta is 28 years old and lives in Logan Town. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have three children between the ages of two and seven, two of whom attend school.
Loretta has been operating a general store for the past five years; she sells soap, toothpaste, rice, oil and other products. She says sometimes she experiences losses, but not always.
She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, and soap for her business. She hopes to expand her business and send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, and soap for her business.

loans.name: Luz Marleni

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer emprendedora de 43 años de edad, el producto de su esfuerzo le permitió tener una casa propia en la zona urbana marginal (clase muy baja)  de José Leonardo Ortiz en Chiclayo.

Desde hace 2 años Luz cuenta con un  puesto de ropa para niños, ubicado en los exteriores del mercado de su distrito. Tiene buena cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos y ella cuenta con una experiencia ineludible. Desde muy joven Luz se ha dedicado a las ventas y es por ello que conoce este rubro a la perfección.

Luz cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.

Ella solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de mercadería, prendas de vestir, para expandir sus ventas. 

Luz es un cliente recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, cumplió con puntualidad su crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Luz is an enterprising woman who is 43 years of age. As a result of her efforts, she was able to acquire her own home in the lower-class urban area of José Leonardo Ortiz in Chiclayo.

For the past two years, Luz has managed a vending post located outside of the district market where she sells children’s clothing. She has a good number of customers who seek out her products and has gained valuable experience. Luz has been in retail since she was a young woman and has perfected her knowledge of the trade. She presents excellent references, both personal and work-related.

Luz is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 PEN. She will invest the funds in the purchase of merchandise, specifically clothing, so that she can increase her sales.

Luz is a returning client of Edpyme Alternativa. She repaid her previous loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Trenzas de Oro” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Tiene educación secundaria.
La señora  trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, su préstamo  inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales domésticos.  Actualmente se dedica a la venta de combustibles como petróleo y gasolina.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles comprará ocho latas de gasolina.  Nos cuenta, que junto a su esposo, se dedica a la chacra como papa, quinua, habas y cebada, a veces también su esposo trabaja en construcción civil.
Su sueño es crecer  y  seguir con el negocio para así conseguir mayores ingresos.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones  y las charlas.
texts.en:
Dominga, 35, is a member of the Las Trenzas de Oro community bank in Ilave in the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno.  She is married and has 2 children.  She has a high school education.
Dominga has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year.  She invested her first loan, for S/.500.00 new soles, in her animal sales business.  Now she's started a new business selling gasoline and other fuel products.  She will use this loan, also for S/.500.00 new soles, to buy eight cans of gasoline.  
Dominga tells us that she and her husband grow potatoes, quinoa, beans and barley.  Her husband also earns extra money doing construction work..
Dominga's goal is to grow her business and increase her income.
Dominga's favorite things about the community bank are the meetings and chatting with the other members.

loans.use: to buy bulk supplies of gasoline for her fuel sales business.

loans.name: Hanifaan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifaan, 51, is a mother of three. Her two sons are drivers by profession while her daughter makes thread from used clothes. 

Hanifaan is very supportive in nature. She also makes thread from clothes on order. Besides her work, she carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. 

Her husband deals in scrap. He receives orders from different factories and other scrap dealers and earns profits. 

Hanifaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy a donkey cart for her husband. It will help him delivering scrap such as used papers and plastic bottles to his client. Hanifaan is very confident that an investment will help her husband improve his business which will help her family to enjoy a better standard of living. 

She is a new loan user and this is her first application to Asasah. 

Note: "In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Hanifaan ".

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart for a scrap business

loans.name: Santalat's Group

texts.en:
Santalat, 55 years old, is the treasurer of this group. The entrepreneur resides in Aravan, a small but cozy southern town situated on Silk Road. The town is a melting pot of people of various occupations such as farmers, cattle breeders, carpenters and ceramic masters. Santalat was born, got married and raised three children in this blessed place. It is a Kyrgyz wedding tradition for gifts to be made to both a bride and a groom. Santalat, according to custom, received a young colt. Over time, by re-selling already grown horses, she was able to generate capital to purchase her very first sheep and a dairy cow. She increased the number of cattle to four sheep and two cows. Every morning Santalat yields several liters of milk, which she uses to make various milk products. Her cattle breeding business was started with initial capital in the amount of 3 000 soms, while a monthly profit is typically 2 500 soms. Meanwhile, her husband’s monthly income from driving a cab is 3 000 soms. Santalat believes that  a constant flow of income into her family's budget will allow her to repay the loan, which she requests so that she can purchase a refrigerator. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Norma Piedad

texts.es:
Norma Piedad tiene 25 años, Es divorsiada vive con dos hijos de 3 y 6 años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Norma se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz tradicion de su padre. Compra sus productos en Comercial Procan y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos, fertilizantes y semillas   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. No enfrenta desafios muy importantes. Su sueño es incrementar la produccion.

Le gusta reunirse con la familia a cocinar.
texts.en:
Norma Piedad is 25 years old.  She is divorced and lives with her two children aged 3 and 6 in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The 'Ciudadela Los Ángeles' community bank is located in Los Ángeles, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this bank grow crops such as corn and rice.

Norma is a farmer who grows corn and rice, a tradition passed down from her father.  She buys her products in Comercial Procan and makes sells her products in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Norma is requesting this loan to grown corn and rice.  She will buy supplies, fertilizers and seeds.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She does not face very important challenges in her business.  Her dream is to increase her production.

Norma enjoys getting together and cooking with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Abigail

texts.es: La señorita Abigail oriunda de Santa Cruz, es estudiante universitaria, vive en el domicilio de su tío se encuentra ubicado en la zona villa olímpica, ella recibe diario renta de su vehículo que lo hace trabajar con un chofer y con esto mantiene sus estudios, ya  hace dos años, el destino del crédito es para la refacción y mantenimiento de su vehículo, el deseo de la señorita Abigail es terminar sus estudios y ser una buena profesional, se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: Abigail is a native of Santa Cruz. She is a university student and lives in her uncle's home in the Villa Olímpica zone. She receives daily income from her vehicle, which she rents out to a driver. This is how she has paid for her studies for two years now. This loan will be used for repairs and maintenance of her vehicle. Abigail hopes to finish her studies and to be a good professional. She feels grateful for the support she is being offered.

loans.use: to perform repairs and maintenance on her vehicle

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 37 years old and married with five children.

Marlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Marlene has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 8 years.  She also earns income from raising pigs.

Marlene aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Foreya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 12 juin 2008. Il est composé de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Mama qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de poissons frais. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, pour l'avoir pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités de vente de poissons frais.

Les profits générés par son petit commerce de poissons frais lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…).
texts.en:
The Foreya solidarity group was created on June 12, 2008. It consists of 15 women from the same neighborhood who mainly conduct small trade.

Mrs Mama, standing on the right-hand side of the photo and raising her hand, chairs the group. She is 36 years old, married and the mother of six children. She sells fresh fish. She has a lot of experience in this activity after having been a fish seller for several years. She will use her loan to increase her working capital, develop her business and buy fresh fish for resale. The profit from her activity will enable her to improve the living standard of her family (healthcare, food, clothing, etc.).

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Lozi

texts.en:
Lozi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fess.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also sells fruits of mangoes and green vegetables which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 32-year-old married man with three children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Peter's dream is to build a family house and also educate his children. He is a taxi driver and has been in service for the last fifteen years. He started by first working as a casual laborer, and with the wages earned he bought a taxi. His challenge is high fuel prices, and his dream is to own at least three taxis. Peter needs the loan facility to service his taxi.

loans.use: To service his taxi.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with seven children. 

Gina has a shop that sells used clothing or "ukay-ukay". She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy used clothing to sell.

Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing or "ukay-ukay" to sell.

loans.name: Anagina

texts.en:
This is Anagina, 30, resident of Pasay, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Anagina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also sells direct-selling products to her customers. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Anagina hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of opening a restaurant someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, José se dedica al destazo de ganado, lo realiza dos veces por semana, los lunes y jueves, pero acostumbra ir al tiangue en busca de buen ganado para el destazo.
Por el momento José necesita a la compra de ganado (dos vacas), por eso solicita el préstamo, para tener los fondos  y se le facilite la obtención de las reces, esto le ayudara para atender su negocio y para continuar con las ventas en el negocio.
La aspiración de José es crecer en el negocio, administrar una carnicería que ofrezca las mejores carnes.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and their small son.  José butchers cattle.  He does this twice a week on Mondays and Thursdays.  He usually goes to the market looking for good cattle to butcher.

José now needs to buy two cows.  That is why he is requesting the loan in order to have the funds that will facilitate getting the cows.  This will help him tend to his business and to continue sales in the business.

José’s aspiration is to grow in the business and to run a butcher shop that offers the best meats.

loans.use: to buy two cows to butcher.

loans.name: Eloy Irineo

texts.es:
Eloy Irineo tiene 62 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijos, vive con la familia y con los hijos de 24 y 21 años de edad en el Cantón ventanas Provincia de los ríos.
LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.
Eloy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el cantón Ventanas.
 Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque se podrá comprar los abonos, insumos y  semillas sin ningún tipo de problema.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: las plagas de langosta en el maíz. El sueño es que nunca le falte el trabajo para poder sobrevivir.
En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Eloy Irineo is 62 years old, single, and has two children. He lives with his family and children (ages 24 and 21) in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “Dulce Sentimiento” (Sweet Feeling) is located in the Caimito II neighborhood in the parish of Puerto Pechiche in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This Communal Bank consists of farmers who grow short-cycle crops such as corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Eloy engages in farming by growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas. His purchases and sales are conducted in the canton of Ventanas. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and farming supplies such as urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killer so that he can keep his crops in good condition. This loan will be of great help because he can buy compost, supplies, and seeds without any type of problem.

The challenges he must face on a frequent basis include plagues of locusts that attack his corn crop. His dream is to lack nothing in his work so that he can survive.

In his free time, Eloy enjoys practicing sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killer.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda is 25 years old and married, with two children. both in school. She has operated a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for four years. Roda has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “WARMICUNA LLANQNCHIS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucy; ella tiene 23 años de edad y es conviviente; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos, la socia lleva a diferentes lugares como ferias de Inquilpata que queda en el distrito de Anta, ella también trabaja en chacras donde ayuda en los cultivos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chanchos y alimentos para los chanchos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lucy is a member of the “WARMICUNA LLANQNCHIS” communal bank, located in the Anta district, within the Anta province and Cusco department.

Lucy is 23 years old and lives with her husband.  She raises pigs and takes them to various fairs in Inquilpata, located within the Anta district.
