She also works in the fields where she helps with the harvests.  She would like to expand her animal business and is asking for this loan in order to buy pigs and feed.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Digna Cristina

texts.es:
Digna de 58 años, empezó con la venta de comida hace 1 año 6 meses atrás, entregaba comida a una compañía.

Realiza su trabajo junto a su hija todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. La dificultad de su trabajo es la delincuencia que se vive en el sector. 

No está casada pero tiene 2 hijos de 33 y 32 años. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos por eso quiere comprar con el prestamo carnes, bebidas, granos. Su meta es hacer que su negocio de comida crezca mas.
texts.en: Digna, 58, started selling food a year and six months ago; she used to deliver meals to a firm.  She works with her daughter every day from 6am until 6pm.  The difficulty she has with her work is the delinquency that’s rife in her sector.  She’s not married but has two children who are 33 and 32 years old.  She has many hopes with her business because it’s her main source of income which is why she wants to use the loan to buy meat, beverages and grains.  Her goal is to make her food selling business grow even more.

loans.use: to buy meat, beverages and grains.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
Adelina, vive con sus tres hijos de 14,11 y 9 años de edad, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado hace cinco años debido a la necesidad de crecer a sus hijos inicio este oficio todos los días.
El préstamo lo utilizara para el complemento en la compra de un terreno, el cual le ayudara para contar con un inmueble a su nombre, en el cual construira su vivienda y podra tener el ganado.
El sueño de Adelina es ayudarles a sus hijos a estudiar y contribuir con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Adelina lives with her three children, ages 14, 11, and 9.  She’s been buying and selling livestock for five years because of the need to care for her children.  She does this every day.

She will use the money from this loan to help buy some land, which will help her have a building in her name where she can set up her home and also keep her livestock.

Adelina’s dream is to be able to help her children with their studies and contribute toward the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга сама воспитывает 9-летнего сына. Ее муж живет и работает в России, поэтому все насущные вопросы ей приходится решать самостоятельно. Она привыкла сама заботиться о средствах к существованию, почему и начала заниматься бизнесом год назад. Мама помогла Ольге, дав ей денег на приобретение торгового павильона. На товар Ольга сама насобирала средства. Теперь Ольга торгует париками, кошельками, женскими сумками на одном из местных рынков Никополя, где она живет. 

Ольге нужен кредит КИВА в размере 8 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить партию женских сумок для реализации в преддверии Рождественских и новогодних праздников. Ольга тщательно занималась поиском поставщика такого типа товара, который предложил бы ей качественный сумки по сходной цене. Она смогла найти стоящий товар и к тому же в большом ассортименте, что дает ей завидное преимущество перед конкурентами. Ольга – молодой предприниматель, очень деятельная и стремящаяся к постоянному развитию. Она всегда говорит, что, если бизнес потребует расширения, она сделает все возможное, чтобы добиться этого. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Olga is raising a nine-year-old son on her own. Her husband lives and works in Russia, so she has to decide all the pressing issues. She was accustomed to care for the family's livelihood on her own, and that's why she began to engage in business a year ago. Her mother helped Olga, giving her money for the purchase of a trade pavilion. Olga gathered enough money on her own for the product itself. Now Olga sells wigs, purses, and handbags in one of the local markets of Nikopol, where she lives. 

Olga needs a Kiva loan of 8,000 hryvnia to buy a batch of handbags for sale in anticipation of the Christmas and New Year holidays. Olga carefully sought a provider of this type of product that would offer her quality bags at a reasonable price. She was able to find a good trade and also a large assortment, which gives her an enviable advantage over competitors. Olga is a young entrepreneur, very active and strives for constant development. She always says that, if the business will require an expansion, she will do its utmost to achieve this.

loans.use: to purchase a batch of handbags for sale in anticipation of the Christmas and New Year's holidays

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé le 24 août 2010 est composé de femmes qui sont issues de la même localité. Elles ont solidairement composé leur groupe par affinité et par voisinage. Leur activité principal est le petit commerce.

Mame Bousso est une femme âgée de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est responsable du groupe. Elle est debout à gauche de la photo.

Mame bousso fait du commerce d habits prêt à porter depuis longtemps  c'est pour quoi elle dispose d une bonne expérience.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter des habits de bébé qu'elle va revendre au niveau de son quartier.

Son objectif est d'aider son mari (qui ne travaille plus) dans la gestion de la famille.( achat riz huile sucre lait ...)
texts.en:
This group was established on August 24, 2010, and is made up of women who come from the same neighborhood. They created their solidarity group based on their personal affinities and neighborhood. Their main business is retail.

Mrs. Bousso, age 56, is married and the mother of three children. She's responsible for the group, and is standing on the left in the photograph.

She's been selling ready-to-wear clothing for a long time, which is why she has a very good experience in this field.

With her new loan, she will buy baby clothing to resell in her neighborhood. Her goal is to help her husband (who doesn't work anymore) in supporting the family.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es: La señora Yesica  es nacida en la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra vive actualmente  con su conyugue y su hijo en la zona San Pedro. Su negocio es en el mismo domicilio. Ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir (mandiles, polleras y otros) hace mas de 9 años esta en su segunda secuencia con la institución,  La señora Yesica demostró ser responsable en su crédito anterior ya que cancelo sus cuotas sin ningún retraso, ahora el crédito otorgado a la señora es para la compra de insumos (tela, hilo, cierres y otros) para así confeccionar mas prendas de vestir  y poder tener mas variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y también ya que tiene muchos pedidos que entregar, la Sra. Yesica ase siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que le permiten crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Yesica was born in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra, where she currently lives with her husband and child in the San Pedro zone. She runs her business out of her home. She has made clothing (aprons, skirts and other items) for over nine years. This is her second loan cycle with the institution, and she has proven herself to be responsible with her loans. She payed off her previous loan without even one late payment.
The loan that she has now been authorized is for the purchase of supplies (fabric, thread, clasps and other items) so that she can make more items of clothing and thus have more variety to offer her customers. She has many orders to fill.
Yesica is grateful for this opportunity because it will allow her and her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy thread, clasps and other items.

loans.name: Sara Magdalena

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer de 29 años que vive junto a sus hijos y su esposo Jaime en "Santo Domingo" que es cantón y ciudad de la nueva Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, que era parroquia rural de Quito la capital del Ecuador;  Santo Domingo está entre la costa y la sierra del país, punto de enlace entre Quito, Guayaquil, Portoviejo,  y otras ciudades importantes. Es la zona de mayor pluviosidad del país. Tiene una gran riqueza hidrológica. Es una zona climática lluviosa subtropical, posee una temperatura promedio de 22 °C. "Santo Domingo" es en sí una ciudad colorida y pintoresca.

Mientras Jaime trabaja como chofer Sara es dueña de una tienda de barrio desde hace dos años; negocio que lo emprendió por consejo de unos familiares. Trabaja de 10 a 12 horas al día con ayuda de sus hijos y en ocasiones de su esposo. Poco a poco ha ido creciendo sin embargo es difícil no tener un capital para invertir por lo que ha decidido realizar un crédito con el cual comprará mercadería y con ello, al tener mayor surtido podrá vender más y tener mayores ingresos. Ella invertirá en víveres de primera necesidad e incrementará algunas líneas como son pañales y artículos de aseo diferentes a los básicos. A pesar de que este es su primer crédito, en la evaluación crediticia que se le realizó se determinó que esta emprendedora tiene bajo riesgo de incurrir en mora por lo que se espera que Sara realice a tiempo sus pagos.

Su sueño es tener su micromercado, moderno y con variedad de productos. De esta manera ella podrá tener un mejor estilo de vida y seguir educando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sara is a twenty-nine year old woman who lives with her two children and her husband Jaime. They live in Santo Domingo, which is both a city and canton of the new province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, which used to be a rural parish of Quito, the capital of Ecuador. Santo Domingo is between the country's coast and mountain range and serves as a crossroads and point of intersection between Quito, Guayaquil, Portoviejo, and other important cities. It has the highest regional rainfall in the country and has great hydrological wealth. It is a rainy, subtropical climate zone with an average temperature of 22 degrees Celsius. Santo Domingo is a colorful and picturesque city.

While Jaime works as a chauffeur, Sara has been the owner of a neighborhood store for the past two years, a business that she began on the advice of family members. She works between ten and twelve hours a day with the help of her children and sometimes her husband. Little by little the business is growing, but it is difficult not having capital to invest in it. This is why she has decided to request this loan, which she will use to buy merchandise. Once she has her store better stocked she will be able to sell more and to have a higher income. In spite of the fact that this is her first loan, her credit evaluation showed her to be an enterprising woman with a low risk of defaulting, so it is expected that Sara will make her payments on time.

Sara's dream is to have a modern mini market with a variety of products. In this way she will be able to have a better quality of life and to continue to educate her children.

loans.use: to invest in her grocery store

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 55 years old and has five children who are in school. He is hardworking and does livestock farming to earn a living. He has engaged himself in this business for two years and has employed one person. 

Through Faulu Kenya, he knows the importance of saving because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of opening a butcher shop to sell goat meat in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more goats and sheep.

loans.use: To buy more goats and sheep.

loans.name: Wendpouire Silgo Group

texts.fr:
Mr Samuel est le représentant du groupe WENDPOUIRE SILGO. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 05 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. Personne ne va à l’école. 
Monsieur est  vendeur de carburant et pratique l’élevage depuis 02 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés  environnants. 
Il  veut s’acheter 04 bidons d’essence ; 03 moutons ; 01 chèvre.
Mr Samuel veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour aider à l'épanouissement de la famille.Il ambitionne avoir sa propre station d'essence.
texts.en:
Mr. Samuel represents the Wendpouire Silgo group, and is doing very well. He is the married father of two children. The oldest is five and the youngest is under two years old. Neither of them attend school.

He sells fuel and has been raising livestock for the past two years. He restocks in surrounding markets, and wants to buy four cans of gasoline, three sheep and one goat.

Mr. Samuel wants to use his profits to ensure his family's well-being. His ambition is to have his own gas station.

loans.use: buy four cans of gasoline, three sheep, one goat.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Nancy a young farmer from Chuka area in Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. Nancy is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 5 years. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and some variety of crops she plants. From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income and she attributes all this success to hardwork and determination. Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business. 

She is seeking a loan to buy cereals. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Chuka and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals and be able to satisfy the demand in her village and local market. With your loan, Nancy will improve her living conditions through increased profits from selling cereals. There is no doubt that through your loan Nancy's life is permanently going to change and she will assure her school-going child of a secure future.
You can be part of Nancy's story. Kindly lend now.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Afi

texts.en:
Mrs. Afi S. was born in 1972 in Gapé. She was abandoned by her husband and left with one (01) child. In order to deal with her needs, as well as her child’s, she started selling knives, spoons, and forks. Dynamic and perseverant, she received an initial loan of $150 which allowed her to begin and succeed, in one way or another, in taking charge of her life. She runs a traveling business, going from area to area and from house to house, which seriously tires her out during the day.

To reduce the difficulty of her business activities, Mrs. S. is asking today for a loan of $800 which will let her rent a location or small place to create a store and to stock it with kitchen utensils in addition to knives and such. Financing this woman is contributing not only to the improvement of her living conditions, but also keeping her from prostitution and all of its sexually transmitted diseases, including AIDS.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Afi est née en 1972 à Gapé. Elle est abandonnée par son mari avec un (01) enfant. Afin de faire face à ses besoins ainsi que celui de son enfant, elle se lance dans le commerce de vente des couteaux, cuillères et fourchettes. Dynamique et persévérante, elle avait bénéficié d’un premier crédit de $150 qui lui a permis de se lancer et d’arriver, tant que mal, à se prendre en charge. Elle fait le commerce ambulant, allant de quartier en quartier et de maison en maison. Ce qui l’a fatigue très sérieusement au cours de la journée.

Pour réduire la pénibilité de ses activités, Madame S. sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $800 qui va lui servir à louer un local ou petit emplacement pour en faire une boutique et de s’approvisionner en ustensiles de cuisine en plus des couteaux et autres. Financer cette femme c’est contribuer, non seulement à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie, mais plutôt lui éviter la prostitution avec tout ce que cela comporte comme les maladies sexuellement transmissibles dont le SIDA.

loans.use: To rent a space for a store and to obtain kitchen utensils

loans.name: José Luis

texts.en:
Mr. P. has plans to grow his business. He aims to improve his business and establish a strong reputation in his neighborhood. His dream is to someday grow from a general store to a mini grocery store. He says, "My objective is to progress in the business and in the future, transform this general store into something greater. I am asking for A $1000 loan to buy merchandise in bulk."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. P. tiene planes para la ampliación de su negocio su inquietud es cada vez mejorar sus ventas y lograr cierto reconocimiento dentro del sector donde habita, su ilusión es algún día convertir su tienda de abarrotes en un mini súper. "Mi objetivo es progresar en el negocio y a futuro transformar mis abarrotes en algo mayor mi petición es por $1,000.00 dlls. para comprar mercancía en abundancia.

loans.use: To buy merchandise in bulk.

loans.name: Atlaz

texts.en:
Atlaz is an  Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Kurdmakhmudlu village. 
Atlaz is 58 years old, married, has 2 children.
She entered into this business 6 years ago.
She needs a loan of $725 to buy 15 sheep in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Gulbag

texts.en: Gulbag has run his orchard for five years. He is 51 years old,  married, has 2 children and lives in Khachmaz town. Now this man applies for a loan of $725 to buy fertilizer, pest control and other products for his orchard

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pest control

loans.name: Naya Garcia

texts.en: Naya is an example of a hardworking woman that makes the impossible happen when it’s about taking care of her family and ensuring their survival.  Naya is  34 years old, is a single mother and is living with four children.  She has to work hard to provide them with food and pay for their education.  After working for a long time for other people, she recently decided to start her own business.  Actually, she’s running a small store where she sells casual clothes, baby clothes and perfume.  Furthermore, early in the morning, she prepares foods and converts her store into a little cafeteria.  She purchases the clothes every two weeks from a salesman that brings them to her house.Her  plan is to keep investing the profit in the business.  She also wants to set aside money for any emergency or the needs of her children.  She has applied to borrow US $375.00 that she’ll repay in six months.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell in the township and to save money for her children's needs.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sra. Sonia belongs to the "Madres Coraje" (Mothers of Courage) community bank in the Peruvian region or "departamento" of Ucayali. She's 41 years old, married and the mother of two children. She started a bakery business 7 years ago that she's built with her husband's help. She now makes 1 batch of bread a day for 20 regular customers ("bodegas" or neighborhood shops). She's also acquired a "motokar" (a three-wheeled motorized rickshaw-like vehicle) that she uses to deliver orders to her customers.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,200 (1,200 Peruvian soles or about US$400), to be repaid in 4 months, Sonia will be able to buy flour, sugar, butter and yeast.

Sonia is currently taking a course offered by the Manuela Ramos Movement to help businesses like hers learn more about the making of bread and bakery products so that she can improve the quality of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Sonia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Madres Coraje” del Distrito de Yarinacocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años, está casada y es madre de dos hijos. Se inició hace 7 años en el negocio de la panadería y desde entonces cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Actualmente prepara 1 saco de pan diario y cuenta con 20 clientes fijos (bodegas). Además de haber adquirido un motokar (movilidad) para la distribución de su producto a los clientes.

Con el préstamo recientemente recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,200.00 ($400 aprox.) que será cancelado en 4 meses, podrá comprar 4 sacos de harina, 2 sacos de azúcar, 5 sacos de manteca y 5 Kg. de levadura.

Sonia, se siente muy contenta ya que actualmente esta ampliando sus conocimientos acerca de la elaboración de panes y panetones en el curso de panaderos que viene realizando el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, esto le permitirá ser más competente y mejorar la calidad de sus productos.

loans.use: Buy supplies for bakery business.

loans.name: Cruz Adilia

texts.es:
Ms. Cruz is married, the mother of two, and sells clothing, footwear and natural beverages in her home. She currently needs to improve the roof over her house so that her children can live without the risk of getting sick from the dampness.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Doña Cruz, casada, con 2 hijos es una pequeña comerciante de venta de ropa y zapatos y de refrescos naturales en su casa de habitación. Actualmente necesita mejorar el techo de su casa para que sus hijos habiten sin riesgos de enfermedades por la humedad.

loans.use:
Change her kitchen roof

Cambiar techo de su cocina

loans.name: Adzoto

texts.fr:
Adzoto W. has been in the restaurant business for almost two years. She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of four. Her main source of income is the profits from her sales. She would like to buy 3 sacks of rice and 2 drums of oil to minimize costs in order to clear a profit. This would enable her to meet her daily needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Adzoto W. opère dans la restauration depuis bientôt 02 ans. Elle est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Sa principale source de revenu est les bénéfices réalisés sur ses ventes. Elle souhaite acheter 03 sacs de riz et 02 bidons d’huiles pour minimiser les charges afin de dégager un excédent lui permettant de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.

loans.use: To buy 3 sacks of rice and 2 drums of oil for cooking and selling

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina is forty-two years old. She is a widow and has four children between the ages of twelve and twenty-four. Albina is a member of the “Aleli” community bank . She has belonged to that bank for seven years. In that time, she has learned the importance of punctuality and responsibility.

Albina sells candies and small trinkets, as well as firewood, from a cart that she moves all around the city. She has been running this business for the past six years.

Albina needs a loan of 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy more products such as candy, gum, stickers, and juice.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Albina plans to use her savings to build a house. Her dream is to eventually own a home and be able to give her children a better life.

loans.use: Albina needs a loan of 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy more products, such as candy, gum, stickers, and juice.

loans.name: Namayemba East D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Grace A.. She is currently in the business of buying and selling produce and is requesting a loan to increase her purchases. Grace is 32 years old and is married. She has 2 children aged 4 and 7, and both of her children go to school. Each week, Grace makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy building materials. Grace has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Grace is joined in her small group by Veronica N., Zaria Biribawa, Ali K., and Grace A.. Veronica N. has a business selling fish and wants to re-invest in her business. Zaria Biribawa is currently operating a business selling matooke and wants a loan to expand to bulk selling. Ali K. operates a restaurant business and wants to purchase more utensils and raw food. Grace A. is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To add working capital to produce business

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana K. sells corn. She is married to a farmer and has five dependents. Her husband’s income is not enough to be relied upon. She is working very hard to contribute to the family’s finances. She wishes to increase sales but lacks enough fund to buy more goods.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more corn to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more corn for sale.

loans.name: Altiplano Group

texts.es:
Every 15 days the Altiplano association meets in the Pro-Mujer center. With much responsibility they have completed their 4th year working with Pro-Mujer. The majority of members are married with families. For example, Mrs. Domi has 8 children in her care and even when she is ill, with her family’s help, she sells cakes, cookies, desserts and other products in order to obtain a little money in order to meet her family’s daily needs. The primary activity of this group is selling food. They offer breakfast, lunch, dinner, and as we have mentioned, various baked goods. They need capital to purchase supplies and be able to rent adequate space to sell their exquisite dishes, with the hope of generating greater income for the well-being of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Cada quince días la asociación Altiplano se reúne en el centro focal de villa exaltación, que pertenece a Pro-Mujer. Con mucha responsabilidad ya cumplen su cuarto año de trabajar junto a esta entidad. La mayoría casadas con familias numerosas tal es el caso de doña Domi con 8 hijos a su cargo y aun encontrándose enferma, con la ayuda de su familia se dedica a la venta pasteles, galletas, bizcochos y otros, para poder obtener un poco de dinero que pueda sustentar a su familia diariamente. La actividad central en la asociación es la venta de comida, ofrecen desde desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, además como ya habíamos mencionados de variadas reposterías. Ellas necesitan mayor capital para proveerse de insumos y poder alquilar lugares adecuados para vender sus exquisitos platillos, con la esperanza de generar mayores ingresos para el bien de sus familias.

loans.use: They need capital to purchase supplies and be able to rent adequate space to offer their products.

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr:
Anani K. is 43 years old, married, and the father of two. To provide for his family, he buys poultry that he resells – hens, roosters, Guinea hens, and ducks. With this loan, his third from FECECAV, Mr. K. hopes to bolster his commerce with a large purchase of hens for resale. With the profits he is going to earn, he can improve his family's living conditions in Adéta, Togo.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Anani K. est âgé de 43 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille il achète les volailles qu’il revend– des poules, des coqs, des pintades et des canards. Avec ce crédit, son troisième de FECECAV, Monsieur K. espère renforcer son commerce d’un grand achat des poules pour la revente. Avec les profits qu’il va dégager, il peut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille à Adéta, Togo.

loans.use: To bolster his commerce with a large purchase of hens

loans.name: Emiliana De

texts.es:
Emiliana is a woman with four children, of whom only one is a girl. The eldest is approximately 17 years old, and the youngest is 6 years old. She has a nuclear family that is very stable and close. They have rented for several years in the same neighborhood. Emiliana and her husband have a sound system. Her husband also works in a factory sewing pants. They have a lot of experience in both of these businesses—they have been working in sewing for approximately 12 years. The competition in the business is moderate. They have been offered the opportunity to buy a moderately-used television for Bs. 1,200.00. The client has a good history with the institution. Her average is zero after 5 repaid loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Emiliana es una señora que tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales solo una es mujer (la mayor) aproximadamente de 17 años y el pequeño tiene unos 6 años. Tiene un nucleo familiar muy estable y una familia muy unida. Viven en alquiler ya muchos años en la misma zona. Emiliana junto con su esposo tienen una amplificacion, además su esposo trabaja en una fabrica de pantalones como costurero. Tienen bastante experiencia en sus 2 actividades, la costura es donde son mas antiguos con aproximadamente 12 años. La competencia en el medio es relativa y moderada. Le ofrecieron de oportunidad un televisor a medio uso en Bs. 1,200.-. Cliente de la institución con muy buen comportamiento, su promedio es de cero tras 5 creditos cancelados.

loans.use: To buy a television   CONSUMO, COMPRA DE TELEVISOR

loans.name: Alejandro José

texts.es:
Alejandro Jose, 38, is married and has 2 school-aged children. He lives in the Ticuantepe municipality and works alongside his wife in the agricultural industry. Six years ago he decided to begin to cultivate land that he owned. He did so to generate more income that would enable him to support his family. Alejandro, like the majority of farmers in Ticuantepe, grows pineapple, which he must give the proper care so that he can produce a full, healthy harvest. He will use the loan money to buy inputs that will enable him to improve production yield. He has discovered over the years that he enjoys doing this job, and that's why he will continue to use loans in order to improve his farm and become a better farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandro José tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos estudiantes. Habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, y se dedica junto a su esposa a la agricultura. Hace 6 años decidió empezar a cultivar unas tierras que tenía, esto en busca de generar ingresos que le permitieran la manutención de su familia. Alejandro como la mayoría de agricultores de Ticuantepe, tiene sembrado piñas, a las cuales le debe de dar el mantenimiento necesario para que pueda salir una cosecha completa y sana. El uso del préstamo será para la compra de insumos que le permitan mejorar el rendimiento de la producción. Descubrió a través de estos años que ésta es la actividad que le gusta y es por eso que seguirá trabajando con créditos para así poder mejorar su finca y convertirse en un mayor agricultor.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs in order to improve production yield

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María, socia del Banco Comunal “LAS FLORCITAS DEL PROGRESO II”, es natural del departamento y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de comida tipo menú. El negocio está ubicado en su domicilio en Jr. Colón sector Atumpampa.

Se inicia en el negocio porque le gusta trabajar y apoyar en los gastos de la educación de sus hijos. Le va muy bien, ya tiene muchos clientes quienes la esperan para comprar su rico menú.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará arroz en saco, aceite en galón, saco de azúcar, condimentos y los insumos que a diario compra en el mercado como carnes, verduras, etc. Quiere satisfacer las exigencias de los clientes que a diario la visitan. 

María tiene 44 años y 4  hijos varones,  pero ahora sólo uno está a su cargo. Se siente feliz porque tiene el apoyo de su esposo y el de su hijo, quienes la ayudan en la preparación de los alimentos a pesar de la edad que tiene. Su meta es implementar y mejorar su domicilio donde pueda dar una buena atención a los clientes y ellos puedan disfrutar de sus ricos preparados.
texts.en:
Señora María, member of the community bank "Las Florcitas del Progreso II," is from the state and province of San Martín, district of Tarapoto. She sells food restaurant-style from her house in the sector of Atumpampa. She started the business because she likes to work and contribute to pay her children's educational expenses. She is doing well; she already has many clients that always buy from her delicious menu. With the $ 175 loan, to be paid in four months, she will buy rice in sacks, oil by the gallon, sacks of sugar, herbs and spices and the daily ingredients such as meat, vegetables, etc. She wants to satisfy what her daily clients expect. María is 44 years old with four boys, and is still taking care of one of the boys. She is content because she has the support of her husband and her son, who help her in the preparation of food despite his age. Her goal is to improve the space in her house so that she can provide better service to her clients and they can enjoy her great food.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan Paluck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy rice, oil, sugar, spices and other ingredients.

loans.name: Mork

texts.en:
Mrs. Mork S. E. is a farmer in BoE. Krum Kraom Village in Kandal Province. On her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile, which has a bad affect on her crop. In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizers to enrich her field and make her crop more productive. With the remaining money, she would buy fuel for her pump to water her crop.

Mrs. Mork S. E. is a 49-year-old widow with six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while another one is a driver. The remaining children are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to enrich her field and make her crop more productive

loans.name: Doan Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đoàn Thị Cúc năm nay 47 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó 2 con đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 2002 chị Cúc tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện tại ngoài nguồn thu từ chăn nuôi, gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu nhập ổn định từ công việc làm thuê của chồng. Với thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng việc hoàn trả vốn vay của gia đình chị Cúc rất thuận lợi, ngoài ra gia đình chị còn có điều kiện đầu tư cho các con ăn học đầy đủ. Vòng vốn tới chị Cúc mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại và mua thêm lợn nái về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs Đoàn Thị Cúc is 47 years old. She has 3 children, 2 are still in school. In 2002, she became a TYM fund member to borrow capital for her pig raising business. Her husband is employed. His salary and the revenue form the pig business provide them with a stable income. Together they gain 3.500.000 VND a month so they have no problem making the weekly payment. They are able to provide good education for their children. This time she is requesting 12.000.000 VND to repair the pig pen and to buy breeding pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 43 años, vive con sus hijos. Ella es agricultora desde que tiene uso de razón, sus padres le enseñaron todos los conocimientos sobre esta labor que le sirven actualmente para desempeñarse en la agricultura, por ello está constante actividad, siembra trigo, papa y quinua. Una vez que termina de cosechar lleva sus productos para venderlos en el mercado principal de su ciudad, aunque los costos de transporte son elevados, Elizabeth consigue obtener las ganancias que le permiten sostener a su familia. Es la quinta vez que solicita un préstamo a MFP, los que le han ayudado bastante para mejorar su economía. Esta vez invertirá en la compra de abono, y también con una parte quiere reparar parte de su casa.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 43 years old, and lives with her children. She has been a farmer for as long as she can remember. Her parents taught her everything they knew about farming, and their knowledge helps her carry out her work. Elizabeth works constantly, planting wheat, potato, and quinua grains. As soon as she finishes the harvest Elizabeth brings her products to sell in the main market of the city, though transportation costs have increased. Elizabeth earns enough to sustain her family. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and her experiences have helped her significantly, enabling her to improve her economic situation. This time Elizabeth will invest in fertilizer, and also repair part of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for her fields.

loans.name: Musuq Wasi Group

texts.en:
The Musuq Wasi (“New House” in Quechua) Village Bank is a group loan maD. up of 18 members who have just begun their 14th loan cycle. All the group members are from the Muyurina community, a small town located in a valley 30 minutes outsiD. of the city of Ayacucho. Most members of the community are farmers or raise small animals. Many grow a variety of vegetables, which they then sell in the Abastos Market in the city of Ayacucho.

The group members are requesting different loan amounts, like 300 (US$ 100), 450 (US$ 150), 600 (US$ 200) or 900 (US$ 300) soles. Musuq Wasi is requesting a total of 11,550 soles in loans. The loans will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer, medicines, sugar, rice, noodles, and to pay farmhands. Some of the group members’ dreams are for their businesses to prosper, to produce mO., for their children to graduate from college with professional degrees, and to own homes of their own.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

El Banco Comunal Musuq Wasi que en Quechua quiere decir Casa Nueva, es un Banco Comunal que inicia el ciclo 14 con 18 socias. Todas las socias son D. la comunidad D. Muyurina que es un pequeño valle ubicado a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, la actividad principal D. la zona es la agricultura y la crianza D. animales menores, producen verduras variadas, que luego venden en el mercado D. abasto D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Las socias realizan diferentes negocios, en mayor parte son agricultoras D. verduras, venta D. combustibles, crianza D. animales, venta D. abarrotes. Sus ventas los realizan en algunas oportunidades en la misma comunidad y también en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles y 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 11,550 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. semillas, abono, remedios, azúcar, arroz, fideo y pago D. peones. Los sueños D. las socias es que sus negocios sean prósperos, producir en mayor cantidad, sus hijos sean profesionales y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Buy seeds, fertilizer, medicines, sugar, rice, noodles, and pay farmhands

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha O. is 29 years old and married with 4 children. All her children are schooling and she is very happy about this. She sells foodstuffs such as plantains, cocoyams, etc. She plans to increase her stock so that she can make more profit. She is requesting the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Olagunju

texts.en: Olagunju sells drinks. She hopes to expand this business. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She is 45 years old and married with 2 children. She says, "Thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Eng S., 49, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband and five children. She work as a rice farmer and a recycler, making around US$5 a day. Her husband makes around US$3 a day selling utensils. Inflation has caused prices to soar in Cambodia and recent hikes in oil and rice prices have caused financial struggles for many Cambodians. Looking for ways to increase her income and combat rising expenses, Eng S. has asked CREDIT for a loan of US$700 to purchase a motorbike and utensils.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and utensils

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience has a machine that she uses to grind maize and beans, etc. She has one grinding machine and she is not able to meet the demands of her customers. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase another grinding machine to enable her to meet the demands of her customers. She is 60 years old and she is a widow with 6 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase one grinding machine

loans.name: Paula

texts.fr: Mme Paula K. est née le 13/01/1965 à Vogan. Elle est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants avec deux autres personnes en charge. N’ayant pas eu la chance de faire de brillantes études par faute de moyens financiers, elle s’est très tôt lancée dans l’apprentissage de la fabrication du pain (boulangerie) avec l’aide de ses parents. A la fin de sa formation, grâce à son savoir faire, elle a très vite conquit la confiance de sa clientèle par la qualité de son produit. Actuellement, la demande dépasse l’offre, mais Mme Paula K. n’a pas les moyens nécessaires pour répondre aux besoins de ses clients. Elle sollicite donc un financement pour s’installer convenablement, s’approvisionner en farines de blé et sucre et s’équiper en outils de travail. Les revenus tirés de cette activité lui permettront de mieux contribuer aux charges de sa famille et à la bonne éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Paula K. was born on January 1, 1965 in Vogan. She is married and the mother of three, plus she has two other people to support. Having lacked the chance to excel in school due to a lack of financial means, she soon got started in an apprenticeship for making bread (baking) with the help of her parents. At the end of her training, thanks to her know-how, she quickly won over the trust of her customers through the quality of her product. Right now, the demand exceeds the supply, but Ms. K. doesn’t have the means necessary to respond to the need. She’s therefore requesting financing to get situated appropriately, to get supplies of flour and sugar, and to equip herself with tools of the trade. The revenues derived from this work will enable her to do better in helping to cover family expenses and to provide the right education for her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell bread

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sriati

texts.en:
Ni Ketut Sriati is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Tukadaya, Melaya. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ni Ketut Sriati owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products to the local community. Ni Ketut Sriati has been engaged in this business for more than three years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ni Ketut Sriati joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Ketut Sriati has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.

Ni Ketut Sriati is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. Ni Ketut Sriati plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Ketut Sriati - (DNR.M-0651) merupakan 32 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Tukadaya - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Ketut Sriati memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor ritel. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membuka toko umum. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual produk makanan & barang kebutuhan sehari-hari di tengah masyarakat setempat. Ni Ketut Sriati sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 3 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut Sriati menghasilkan sekitar 500,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2008, Ni Ketut Sriati bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut Sriati meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk berinvestasi dengan merenovasi bisnis. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli produk tambahan untuk dijual. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Ketut Sriati berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for three women who are living in Battambang Province, Cambodia. Khun V., 53, has been selected to be group leader by the other members. Khun V. is a widowed mother who has given birth to six children: three are married and have ready started their own family, whilst the others are still single. Three of her children are employed at different jobs.

Khun V. and her husband currently earn their daily income by sewing clothes. Most of their clients are neighbors who live near their house. Khun V. is applying for a loan in order to purchase more tailoring tools to support their investment.

The other two borrowers are:

S., 46, is a grocery seller who is looking for a loan to expand her business selling groceries.

R., 59, is a fish seller who is requesting a loan in order to increase her quantity of dried-fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring tools to support her business

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana M. is forty-two years old, married, and has given birth to three children: two sons and a daughter. According to her, all are still in school: one is in the junior high while the others are in the primary school. Christiana lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer.

Christiana is a trader and runs a provisions store in her community. Her shop is by the road side. She buys the groceries from Accra and other big shops in her community. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk so that she can increase her stock. She is hopeful to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: astou D. est parent beneficiaire demeurant acamberene.elle s'exerce dans le domaine de la vente de produits cosmetiques.a cause de developpement progressif de son activite elle sollicite un credit de cinquante mille frs pour elargir ses operations.
texts.en:
Astou D. is a client parent staying in Camberene. She works in the field of selling cosmetics. Due to the progressive development of her business, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 francs to expand her operations.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe D. C. is a rolling vendor in the village of Barangay Research Minante 1 (Cauayan City). She is a 56-year-old widow and is blessed with six children. Two of her younger children are presently studying, thus she strives to provide for their daily needs. 

With the help of her motorcycle, Fe is able more easily to move about their village to sell her different products such vegetables, fruits, meats, fish and breads. She earns around PHP500 net income weekly in the business. Since she serves as the bread winner of her family, Fe is requesting the assistance of Kiva lenders for her to borrow a loan amounting to PHP40,000, as additional working capital for her business. 

She hopes that the amount will enable her develop a vending stall in their village and eventually sell cooked foods to further increase her daily income.

loans.use: To develop a vending stall to sell cooked foods

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda’s extensive legal knowledge and passion for helping people from El Salvador have provided her with the perfect recipe for starting her own business.

A licensed attorney in her home country of El Salvador, Amanda has been working for years at an office that specializes in providing legal advice to Salvadorians living in the U.S. However, she realized she could provide more help to the Salvadorian community by opening her own office and providing additional services.

Servicios Internacionales Salvadoreños will provide legal document preparation, legal consultation, and attorney locator services for clients seeking assistance with legal matters in or pertaining to El Salvador. Amanda hopes that her expertise in El Salvador law will provide much-needed advice to individuals with property or business in El Salvador, as well as the Salvadorian community of the Bay Area.

Amanda will continue to work at her existing job at a money-transfer company and run her business in the afternoon and evening. With deep connections to the Salvadorian community, she is confident that her network will provide a steady client base. 

A $2,000 loan will help Amanda with many of the start-up costs for her business including rent, marketing, licenses, and supplies.

loans.use: Business start-up costs

loans.name: Bernarda Eulalia

texts.es:
La señora BERNARDA EULALIA C. V., tiene 38 años, vive en el distrito de La Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Jerusalén.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta sexto de primaria  y no pudo continuar sus estudios porque tuvo que trabajar en el campo para ayudar a sus padres y hermanos, tiene 4 hijos de 19, 16, 13 y 2 años de edad,  quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
BERNARDA  se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios en la tienda de su casa, como: arroz, azucar, fideos, leche, golosinas, aceite, gaseosas, jugos, etc. 
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de productos alimenticios para vender en la tienda que tiene instalada en su casa.
Este crédito de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos alimenticios para la tienda de su casa y también para comprar dos vitrinas.
 BERNARDA sueña con ampliar su negocio vendiendo carne de res, pollo, pato, pavo y otros, para poder obtener mayores ganancias y poder tener solvencia económica para comprar los medicamentos y atenderlo adecuadamente a su hijo de 2 años, quien padece de una enfermedad congénita.
texts.en:
Bernarda Eulalia C. V., 38, lives in the La Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertad, department, Perú. She belongs to the Jerusalén bank. She has a sixth grade education. She could not continue her education because she had to work in the field to help her parents and siblings. She has four dependent children ages 19, 16, 13, and 2. Bernarda sells food products like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, sweets, oil, soft drinks, and juice, etc. in the store in her house. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought food products to sell in the store that she has set up in her house. She will use this loan for 1,000 PEN to buy more food products for the store in her house. She will also buy two display cases. Bernarda dreams of expanding her business by selling beef, chicken, duck, turkey and other items. She will do this to be able to get greater earnings and to be able to buy medicines to adequately take care of her two year old son. He suffers from a congenital disease.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food products and two display cases

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y madre de 8 hijos, ella estudio primaria incompleta (transición), y  vive  en la parcialidad de Jamachi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de ovinos.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra de ovejas, que  luego de mejorarlos los vende  en las ferias semanales de su zona.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Jesús de Nazareth Community Bank, which is located in the López town center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 48, married, and has eight children. She did not complete elementary school (transition). She lives in the Jamachi region. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six months. With her first loan for 500 PEN she bought sheep. She currently needs a new loan. That is why she is asking for 600 PEN to buy sheep. After fattening them she will sell them in the weekly regional fairs. Her wish is to continue working. She likes the simplicity of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is a 21-year-old married mother of one child. She lives in Nyamasaria where she also has a charcoal-selling business. She travels frequently to buy bags of charcoal and then supplies them to other retail outlets. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 KES to improve her stock levels.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk

loans.name: Lidia Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia C. se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas las que son comercializadas por ella misma en su establecimiento en el mercado Ivan Montenegro donde a diario ofrece las tortillas de maíz siendo preparadas por ella misma. 

La razón por la cuál ha solicitado el crédito en Ceprodel es para invertirlo en la compra del maíz y de la leña para continuar elaborando las tortillas y así llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Compra de maíz y leña

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 27-year-old married woman with three children between 4 and 6 years of age. She also takes care of additional family members. She rents a one-room house where she lives with five people. The family has access to electricity but has no piped water.

She owns a stall where she sells second hand clothing. She doesn’t pay for transportation costs to and from shopping because she works at the same market where she does her shopping. She works in the outskirts of Kampala, where on average she receives 20 customers a day. Harriet has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for five years, now servicing her tenth loan, and working with the same group mates.

Harriet uses public transport to and from home to work. Her challenges include defaulters and the ever-increasing prices of second hand clothes. Harriet wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second hand clothing. She is hopeful of seeing her business grow stronger and wants to start selling only on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothing

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon M. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur.  He is married with four children who go to school.  He runs a poultry farm in the Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. He has 2,000 layers in his poultry cages and he collects 20 trays of eggs per day. Over the years, with the money he has generated from his business, he has been able to build his own house and send his children to school. He has already expanded to three poultry cages, but needs another loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to construct more cages and buy more poultry chicks.

loans.use: To buy more cages and chicks

loans.name: La Trinidad 1&2 Group

texts.en:
Hilaria is the group coordinator of L. Trinidad and is currently looking forward to taking out her first loan with Esperanza International. She lives in hot, crowded Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic.

She currently owns a business where she sells sandals and purses. Her sandals are very popular in the community since they fit in with the current popular style. With the loan she will buy 10 pairs of sandals and a dozen purses for her customers to buy.

She looks forward to using the earnings to reinvest in her business and to fix up her house. It is her dream to live with less economic limitations and greatly appreciates the low interest rates that Esperanza offers along with their business advice. She thanks you all for being part of this dream!

loans.use: To buy 10 pairs of sandals and 12 purses

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is Mariatu K.. She is 27 years old, married, and is from So-so Town Lane in Waterloo. She has four children: one boy and three girls; three are in primary school and one is still a baby.

Mariatu has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken three previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Mariatu works from home selling such staple goods as rice, palm oil, vegetable oil and sugar. With her previous loans she expanded the inventory of her shop, keeping the same goods for sale. With her new loan she hopes to expand her business again in the same manner.

loans.use: To buy more rice, palm oil, vegetable oil, and sugar

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Ms. A. sells a variety of fabrics used for clothing. She began her business in 2006 in the Assiyéyé market. She is single and has no children. This will be her first loan with WAGES. She will use the entire loan to replenish her supply of fabrics and maintain a variety of options for her clientele.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: N. Joyce, 28 years old, is a widow with five children all in school. She owns a retail shop business. She has operated this business for over two years. She is a permanent resident of Baggala zone. She is using the loan to acquire items (drinks, rice, maize flour, beans, bread, soap, salt, sugar, and so forth) in order to expand her business. Her dream is seeing her children finish their education and getting good jobs.

loans.use: To acquire retail items for her store

loans.name: Marites' Group

texts.en:
Marites T. is from the village of San Bonifacio, Burgos, Isabela. She is 30 years old. Marites is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marites is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a general store. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marites is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her range of products offered. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve and expand the business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her range of products.

loans.name: Or

texts.en: Mrs. Or C. is 60 years old and a villager from Roluos village in Takeo province. She is a mother of three children, all of whom are employed in a garment factory. Or C. is a farmer who owns 2.5 hectares of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chan Me, is shown on the right of the picture. The family has a problem because their field is ready to plow, but they do not have enough oxen to do the job. Therefore, Mrs. Or C. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox to plow the field.

loans.use: To buy a ox for plowing the field

loans.name: Nohemi Yolanda

texts.es:
la sra. Nohemi Yolanda Z. se dedica al comercio desde hace tres años y su actividad principal es una pulpería y un molino para moler Maíz, negocios que operan bajo el nombre de pulpería y molino “LA BENDICION”.
Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la calle principal de la zona de el Pozo Bendito y sus clientes son los vecinos de la misma comunidad donde reside, y las personas que viajan a diferentes zonas del valle de Jamastran,  muchos de los viajeros se estacionan para comprar algunas golosinas y seguir el camino. 
En la actualidad, ella no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir mas su negocio, ya que construyo una vivienda y esto la dejo un poco descapitalizada; es por esta razón que ella esta solicitando el credito para poder surtir mas su negocio y asi tener muchas ventas.
texts.en:
Nohemi Yolanda Z. has been in commerce for three years; her main activity consists of a grocery store and corn mill. The business is called: "La Bendicion." It is located on Pozo Bendito's main street and her customers are neighbors from the same vicinity where she lives and people that travel to various areas of Jamastran Valley; many of the travelers park to buy a snack and then continue along their way. Currently, she lacks sufficient funds to better stock her store because she built a house and this left her decapitalized. For this reason, she is asking for funding to stock her store better and so that she can sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs, lard, cooking oil, beans, tortillas, bread, coffee, rice, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, sardines, sauces, pastas.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 29-year-old single man. He has been running a cafeteria for three years and has one employee. He was previously involved in the transport business.

Charles appreciates Faulu Kenya for training him in record keeping. He previously took out two loans which he used to improve his business.

Charles has requested Kes 35,000 from Faulu Kenya so as to add to his stock of food products like wheat flour, maize flour, rice, cooking fat and other products for cooking in his cafeteria.

Charles hopes to expand his cafeteria in the future.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for his cafeteria

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a mother of 5 sons. Four of them work in different professions and help take care of the household expenses while their father is a contractor. Susana has plenty of free time which she wants to use in doing something she likes.

Susana applied for a loan from FATEN as she is in the process of opening her own clothes store in Ramallah city.  She will use the loan to pay a part of the down payment to rent the store.

Susana hopes that her store will prosper soon and she'll be able to have her own source of income. Susana is in the picture above.

loans.use: Opening a clothes store

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 50-year-old married lady. She runs a tailoring shop, where she styles men's and women's clothes, and also sells utensils to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years and has two employees. She also practices farming on her farm to earn extra income.  

She belongs to a group called Ujamaa in Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner. The group members save their money and guarantee each other's loans. She hopes to open outlets and improve her living standards in the future. She is unable to meet her many customers' demands and therefore, she has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to add stock of fabric and utensils.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and utensils for sale

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya D. is from the village of Dioyo, Sapang Dalaga. She is 39 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Ligaya owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes from selling household items and making food to sell in her local community. Ligaya has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month from these activities. Her husband is a motorcycle driver and has his own motorbike.
In 2001, Ligaya joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to acquire a motorcycle. Ligaya is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital. This loan will be her twentieth from PMPC.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal EMPRENDEDORES, en su ciclo 8, está formado por 10 clientes, 9 mujeres y 1 varón, la mayoría D. las socias pertenecen a la Zona D. Villa Copacabana y Villa San Antonio, que están ubicados por el cruce D. villas. Las socias se dedican a la venta D. diversos productos como ser, ropa interior, cosméticos, venta en tienda D. abarrotes. En la secuencia anterior todas cancelaron a excepción D. dos socias que tuvieron problemas y pagaron con sus ahorros las cuales fueron retiradas del banco. 

La Sra. Mery  Es la líder D. la Banca, actualmente toma el cargo D. presidenta  se dedica a la venta y distribución D. víveres y otros productos alimenticios y D. consumo masivo, cuenta con esta actividad hace 10 años, el préstamo será destinado a los pedidos D. víveres por mayor.  Casada con el señor Eduardo, que trabaja como chofer, vive en casa propia. En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos, también  dirige D. manera ordenada a su banca pidiendo a sus compañeras responsabilidad con el crédito y puntualidad en los pagos.

La Sra. Zenobia Socia que asume el cargo D. tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta y distribución D. víveres en diferentes lugares ya sea en instituciones o pedidos a domicilios se dedica a esta actividad hace 5 años, el préstamo esta destinado a la incremento D. capital. La socia es soltera tiene 3 hijos, asume el cargo por su  responsabilidad que ha demostrado dentro del banco como garante y como compañera D. grupo.
 
La Sra. Narda  es elegida como secretaria, por su juventud y es muy alegre en las reuniones se dedica a la venta D. ropa a pedidos y a veces hasta a crédito  El préstamo esta destinado para incrementar su capital. Casada con el señor Milton, vive en la casa D. sus suegros. Su meta es abrir una tienda D. vestidos en una galería comercial en el centro D. la ciudad.

Todas las socias estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Emprendedores” (Entrepreneurs) is starting its eighth loan cycle with ten clients, nine women and one man. Most of the members are from the districts of Villa Copacabana and Villa San Antonio, which are located at the town crossroads. The members sell different products such as undergarments, cosmetics, and groceries. In the previous loan cycle, all with the exception of two members had problems, so they had to repay their loans using their savings and were then asked to leave the bank.

Sra. Mery is the leader and currently holds the position of President. She sells and distributes provisions and other food products for mass consumption. Mery has been in business for ten years. Her loan will be used to fulfill her wholesale grocery orders. She is married to Sr. Eduardo, who works as a chauffeur, and they live in their own home. Within the Communal Bank, Mery is known as a responsible person who is prompt with her payments. She directs the meetings in an orderly manner and asks her fellow group members to be responsible with their loans and submit their payments on time.

Sra. Zenobia holds the position of Treasurer. She sells and distributes provisions to different places by request, including institutions and individual homes. Zenobia has been in business for five years. Her loan will be used to increase her operating capital. She is single and has three dependent children. In her position of responsibility, she has demonstrated herself as a guarantor and valuable partner of the group.

Sra. Narda was elected to the position of Secretary because of her youth and the cheerfulness she brings to all the meetings. She sells clothing upon order and sometimes extends credit to her customers. Her loan will be used to increase her operating capital. She is married to Sr. Milton and they live in the house of her in-laws. Her goal is to open a clothing store at a shopping center in the central part of the city.

All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in them by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase provisions & food products

loans.name: Luz Cerito (Grupos 1, 2) Group

texts.en:
C. is the coordinator of her group Lucerito (Bright Star), and her story is representative both of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Los Arcarizos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital where free trade zones are common and running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

C. is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, after having fully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her jewelry and general supplies store and will put the additional profits towards the purchase of a small plot of land, with the hope of constructing a house on it sometime in the future. C. thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy jewelry, cleaning products and other supplies for sale

loans.name: Korotimi

texts.fr:
Madame Korotimi H. est âgée de 48 ans, veuve et mère de 2 enfants. Elle vit dans sa famille paternelle avec ses enfants et  d’autres ménages à  Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Elle n’a pas eu à fréquenter l’école pour des raisons sociales. Alors elle commença dès sa plus jeune enfance à faire le commerce auprès de ses 2 parents. Sa mère  vendait des condiments alimentaires et son père avait une boutique de vente de céréales. 
Riche de cette expérience empirique, elle évolua seule dans le commerce d’articles divers avec l’achat vente d’atiéké, de pomme de terre, de condiments alimentaires etc. Elle mener cette activité depuis 22 ans et jouit d’une grande notoriété et clientèle. Elle est très sollicitée au marché château. 
Dans le souci de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation  cette dernière depuis 42 mois, après 3 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels bien remboursés. 
Elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 660kg de pommes de terre et 1 tonne d’atiéké. Elle s’approvisionnera à Sikasso, Bamako (capitale du Mali) et en république de Côte d’Ivoire.
Madame Korotimi H. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser ses prêts et de participer à des tontines au marché en raison de 1000 FCFA par jour.
 Son ambition est de construire des maisons pour les louer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Korotimi Haidara is 48 years old, a widow and the mother of two children. She lives in her parents' household together with her children and others family members in Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). For social reasons, she never attended school. And so she started to be engaged in business activities early on, learning from her parents. Her mother used to sell food condiments, and her father kept a store selling cereals. With plenty of practical experience, she launched her own business selling various articles, such as “atieke” [a manioc-based food], potatoes, food condiments etc. She has been in business for 22 years now and is well known and appreciated by her customers. Her products are very much in demand at the Château market. In an effort to meet the customer demand, she decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. She has been a client with Soro Yriwaso for 42 months and obtained three solidarity (group) loans and two individuals loans, all duly repaid. She is now on her third individual loan, which she plans to use to purchase 660 kg [1452 lbs] of potatoes and 1 ton [2200 lbs] of atieke. She stocks up in Sikasso, in Bamako (the capital of Mali) and in the Republic of Côte d’Ivoire. Mrs. Korotimi Haidara sells for cash and on credit to a customer base composed primarily of women. With this loan she plans to achieve a monthly income of 150,000 West African Francs. This revenue will allow her to repay her loans and to contribute to her market’s tontine (a savings group) at the rate of 1,000 West African Francs per day.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various items for resale

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Valeriana es comerciante vendedora de ají; su esposo es chofer. 
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de ají al por mayor para su venta al por menor.
Es cliente antigua desde julio de 2006, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito ya que se gano la confianza financiera.
texts.en:
Valeriana works as a merchant selling chili peppers, and her husband is a taxi driver. She lives in the Irpavi II area of the city of La Paz. She plans to use the loan to purchase chili peppers at wholesale to sell at retail. She has been a client since July 2006, and her history classifies her as a top-tier client who has fulfilled her previous payments, which grants her access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chili peppers at wholesale

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand P. is from the village of North Poblacion, Medina, Misamis Oriental. He is 39 years old and married with three school-aged children. Ferdinand has had a bakery for over two years and earns approximately 8500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Ferdinand joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase baking equipment. Ferdinand is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Ferdinand from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites S. is from the village of Lawis. She is 32 years old and is married with seven school-aged children. Marites owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Marites joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marites is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.
