About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Phoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoeun N., 40, is the village bank president selected by the six members of this group loan, who are located in Krang Cheu Neang village in Kandal province. All members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.
Mrs. Phoeun N. and her husband, Mr. Sok On, are farmers who own a 1.20 hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. Mrs. Phoeun N. will use the loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for farming laborers to cultivate rice.  Aside from being a farmer, Mrs. Phoeun N. is also chicken seller in the local market. Both these occupations combined, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. The couple has three children, all of whom are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for farming laborers to cultivate rice

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is from the village of Barangay Lactawan, a part of the municipality of Solano in Nueva Vizcaya province of the Luzon islands. She is 47 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns a retail store from which she sells home products such as glasses and watches to the local community. Josephine has been in business for over eight years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Josephine successfully repaid her previous loan of 19,000 PHP from ASKI which she used to purchase additional products to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, her tenth loan, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her line of products. She plans to use all additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Anayat's Group

texts.en:
Anayat is a resident of Lahore, which is the second largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She moved here after her marriage. She is a 57-year-old widow who lost her husband few years ago. She lives with her family in a 3-room brick house.  

She is the mother of three sons and a daughter, all of whom work. They couldn’t get an education due to financial constraints and the death of their father, and they had to start work at an early age. Anayat’s eldest son is a rickshaw driver while her two younger sons are daily wage laborers. Her daughter does embroidery work. 

Anayat supports her family by selling clothes. She started this business after the death of her husband. She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her elder son. With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw because its engine is creating a problem and won’t allow him to work with it for longer periods of time. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her 4th loan cycle. In the previous loan years she has always paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Anayat.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Atyrkul's Group

texts.en:
Atyrkul O., 39, is the group leader. She is married and has three children. The oldest two are in school and the third is a toddler. Atyrkul and her husband breed cattle. Fourteen years ago, they borrowed potato seeds and learned how to cultivate land. This is now the main source of their income. They have managed to increase their cattle stock. They will use 12,000 soms of this loan to purchase cattle and 5,000 soms for their crops. 

Azat T., 38, is married. He has two sons, the elder one is a schoolboy. The family earns their living by cultivating different sorts of plants. Seven years ago, Azat was a builder, but then decided to start his own business. He grew wheat and potato,  and the harvest made a good profit for him. Since then, he has been developing this business. The loan purpose is to purchase solar oil for harvesting and to order tractor service. In the future, Azat wants to build a house. 

Nurhamida M., 35, is the treasurer of the group. She and her husband, who is a taxi-driver, have two children (the elder daughter is a schoolgirl). They have their own business where they sell pears and apples. Previously, they raised and sold cattle and used the profits to start their business., which they have had for seven years. Their earnings made it possible to buy a car. Nurhamida wants a loan so she can buy one young animal (10,000 soms) and two sheep (5,000 soms). In the future, the family is planning to build a house.

Dinara D., 32, is married and has three children. Her husband is an electric welder in Bishkek. He makes 10,000 soms a month. The family runs their own business: they have land, which has been cultivated for three years. Out of the profits, they have managed to buy household appliances. The loan purpose is to purchase coal for winter (1,5 tons). In the future, Dinara’s family hopes to build a new house and to increase cattle stock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line:
• People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), 
• Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) 
• Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members receive special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Engine for motorcycle

loans.name: Las Divinas De San Mateo Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama las Divinas de San Mateo y es una colonia ubicada en la comunidad de Tepeji del Rio de Ocampo en el estado de Hidalgo esta colonia es conocida por llevar el nombre de uno de los personajes biblicos San Mateo, el grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes y es la primera vez que realiza un credito con credicomun. La señora Ma del Carmen H. V. es parte del grupo y se dedica al negocio de papeleria e internet, negocio que inicio hace 8 años, solicitó el prestamo para la compra de mercancía por temporada, tiene 49 años estudio hasta la primaria es de clase media y tiene un hijo de 18 años, sus clientes son de todo tipo al encontrarse ubicada en una de las calles centricas y sobre todo de paso a escolares, al momento de solicitar el prestamo ella se sintio feliz y agradecida por el apoyo brindado, quiere este credito para aprovechar la temporada y comprar mercancia de temporada de fiestas tradicionales.
texts.en:
This group is called 'las Divinas de San Mateo' (The Divine Women of Saint Matthew).  San Mateo is a neighborhood located in the community of Tepeji del Rio de Ocampo in the state of Hidalgo.  This neighborhood is known for having the name of a biblical character, San Mateo (Saint Matthew).

The group has 11 members and this is the first time that they have requested a loan from Credicomun.  Maria del Carmen H. V. is a member of the group.  She is in the stationery store and Internet business.  She started her business 8 years ago.  She is requesting a loan to buy seasonal merchandise.  She is 49 years old and studied to elementary school level.  She is middle class and has an 18 year-old son.  Her customers are all kinds of people as her store is located in one of the central streets of town.  Above all, a lot of school children pass by.  As she requests this loan she is feeling happy and grateful for the support which she is being offered.  She wants to use this loan to take advantage of the season and buy seasonal merchandise for the traditional holiday period.

loans.use: To buy seasonal merchandise

loans.name: G.s. Santa Isabel Group

texts.es: Celia Cruz tiene 31 años, su actividad es la venta de comida. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio. Celia es una persona luchadora que disfruta de su actividad de interactuar con sus clientes a pesar de ser una actividad humilde obtiene lo necesario para mantener a su familia como es su hijo. Ella tiene ubicado su negocio es las afueras de su vivienda. Otra integrante del grupo es Sabina que se dedica a la venta de comida, ambas saben cocinar muy bien, ya que venden tajaditas de plátanos, gallo pinto, maduro y enchiladas entre otras cosas. Por lo que juntas han decidido realizar este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Celia Cruz is 31 years old, and her activity is selling food.  She has been in this business for more than 10 years.  Celia is a fighter, who enjoys the aspect of her business involving interaction with customers.  Despite it being a humble activity, she obtains what is necessary to support her family and son.  She has situated her business just outside of her home.  

Another member of the group is Sabina, who dedicates herself to selling food.  Both are good cooks, and sell fried sweet plantains, gallo pinto (rice and beans), ripe plantains, enchiladas, and other items.  Together, they have decided to take out this loan in order to buy ingredients for their businesses.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Joseph Nandokha

texts.en:
Joseph Nandokha M. is 64 years old and married to Mary Nanjala. Together they have four children, ages 25, 20, 18 and 10 years old respectively. He is a businessman who operates posho (corn) mill in Kitale-Kenya. He has been running this business for the last two years, where he has been making a profit of Kshs.30,000 per month.

He learned about KADET from a friend who is already registered as a client. This will be his third loan of Kshs.60,000. He is increasing the loan to buy a new posho mill machine. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to build a permanent house to use for maize storage. 

In his future, Joseph hopes to grow his busines, build a rental house, and to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: To buy a new posho (corn) mill machine.

loans.name: Las Talentosas Group

texts.es: El señor Rómulo de 63 años de edad es presidente de la alcancía comunal “Las Talentosas.”  Es casado y tiene 8 hijos, todos son mayores de edad pero 3 de ellos viven con él.  Se dedica a la crianza de abejas (apicultura) desde hace 20 años, dichas abejas producen 25 litros de miel y pueden producir hasta el doble de esta cantidad en un año.  La miel es vendida a sus clientes fijos, él solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar materiales (madera, clavos, rejillas, etc.) para construir una trampa caza polen también desea comprar un par de reinas más (abejas)para aumentar la producción de miel.
texts.en: Mr. Romulo is 63-years-old and is president of the communal group "The Talented.".  He is married and has 8 children who all are adults, but 3 of them live with him. He is dedicated to beekeeping (apiculture) for the past 20 years.  The bees produce 25 liters of honey and can produce up to twice that amount in one year. The honey is sold to regular customers.  He sought a loan from EDAPROSPO  to buy materials (wood, nails, vents, etc.) to build a pollen trap and also wants to buy another pair of queens (bees) to increase honey production.

loans.use: Materials to raise honey bees

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel S. is from the village of Gata Daku Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 46 years old. Angel is married with two adult-aged children. To make a living, Angel owns and operates a tricycle transport service. Angel has been engaged in this business for a year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Angel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Angel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be his fourth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 60 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de helados, ella tiene una heladería y también es cesante de educación, la socia tiene una pequeña tienda de helados donde atiende desde las 8.00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de helados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer los helados.       

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Señor de Torrechayoc communal bank. The bank is located in the Urubamba district, belonging to the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Rosa. She is 60, married, and has 3 children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her ice cream business. She has an ice cream store, and she is also a retired teacher. She has a small ice cream store where she works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She wants to expand her ice cream sales business. She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for making ice cream.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of the quotas.

loans.use: the member is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients for making ice cream.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 60 años, vive sola en su casa propia. Hace más de 2 años se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de cuidado de niños, actividad que lo realiza en su misma casa, desde entonces brinda educación y protección a los niños cuyas madres son solteras y trabajan. De esta manera logra tener algo de ingresos económicos, actualmente la gente de su zona la conocen y sabe de su oficio por el cual ha ganado la confianza de cada uno de ellos. Considera que este trabajo es muy bueno y digno, por el cual le agrada ejercerlo y por tal desea mejorar la instalación de su casa para que los niños se sientan más acogedores. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de algunos artículos para niños como juguetes y muebles.
texts.en: Bertha is 60 years old and lives by herself in her own home. For more than two years she has made a living offering child care services out of her home. Since that time she has provided education and protection to children whose mothers are single and working. In this way she has been able to earn some income. Now, the people in her area know her and her work because she has gained their confidence. She considers this work very good and respectable, so she enjoys doing it. She wishes to make improvements to her home so the children fell more comfortable. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is very content in knowing she has financial support. Furthermore, she enjoys being part of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very united. She is grateful to those people who will be funding the loan she is requesting, which will be very useful to the progress of her business. With the loan, she plans to purchase some children's articles, such as toys and furniture.

loans.use: Purchase educational items, toys and furniture

loans.name: Ningome

texts.en:
Ningome is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Ningome has been operating a soft drinks business for the past year, selling from home to her neighbours and school-going children.  Ningome's main challenge in her business is seasonality. During the rainy season, the demand for natural cold juice is lower compared to the hot summer season. She hopes to be self-reliant in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 60,000, she wants to purchase a deep freezer, fruits and drink flavours. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer, fruits and drink flavours

loans.name: Modibo

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modibo D. est homme marié de 26 ans et père de 3 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Niebala de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas pu continuer les études pour des raisons sociales, Monsieur Modibo D. s’intéressa tôt aux activités génératrices de revenus. Il a tenté pendant des années différentes activités  telles la vente de boisson non alcoolisée, mais sans succès. Alors il finit par apprendre auprès de son ami la vente d’habits, de chaussures; de radios, de cosmétiques, de tissus etc.
Avec une expérience de plus de 8 ans, il maîtrise son activité.
Pour renforcer son activité, il décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son  premier prêt, afin  d’acheter des tissus; des chemises, pantalons, parfums et pommades. Il s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et vend à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Modibo D. is married, 26 years old, and the father of three children. He lives with his wife and children in a nuclear family in the district of Niebala in Bougouni.

Unable to continue schooling because of social circumstances, Mr. Modibo D. became interested in earning money at an early age.  Over the years he tried different types of work such as selling non-alcoholic drinks, but without much success. Then he learned from a friend to trade in clothing, shoes, radios, cosmetics, fabric, etc. 

With over eight years of experience, he has mastered this business.  To strengthen his business, he has decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and he is now on his first loan.  He plans to buy fabric, shirts, pants, perfumes and hair products.  He gets his supplies in Burkina Faso and sells them to a diverse clientele. 

He plans to make an average monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA which will be used to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy various items

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by farming and selling vegetables. Her husband Jose, who is 57 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children who are between 15 and 32 years old. Norma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Norma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,600, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000 to buy fertilizers and to use as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Norma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Hjhalmar Gonzalo

texts.es: El señor Hjhalmar Gonzalo I. es un joven de 18 años, soltero, con estudios de educacion secundaria que no quiere estudiar una carrera universitaria.  Su papá le ha hecho cargo de una pequeña empresa de confeccion de jeans, trabaja ocho horas confeccionando pantalones de jean en diferentes tallas y gana por costura, quiere tener su propia empresa y por tal motivo necesita capital de inversión para la tela e hilos y así poder vender cada prenda  y no sólo confeccionar.  Así con los pedidos de prendas de tiendas comerciales, poco a poco se comprará las máquinas necesarias para el trabajo, al momento sólo las alquilará y se hará de un capital para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Mr. Hjhalmar Gonzalo I. is 18 years old, single, with a middle school education and has no intentions of going to a university. His father has put him in charge of a small jean factory where he spends 8 hours making jeans in different sizes and gets payed for sewing. He wants to have his own business which is why he is requesting the loan to buy fabrics and thread. Then he will be able to sell the jeans and not just sew. With the profits he makes from selling to commercial businesses he will save up to buy the machinery needed for the job. At the moment he wants to rent the machinery and that way can make money and improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: to buy machinery to make jeans

loans.name: Dionisio Eduardo

texts.es: Dionisio Eduardo su actividad económica es la pesca artesanal. Hace más de 22 años que se dedica a este negocio. Lo inicio con mucho esfuerzo pues necesitaba brindarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, ya que diariamente trabaja fuertemente ya que todos los días tiene que salir a vender los diferentes productos que ofrece. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de redes, entre otros equipos de trabajo necesario para su negocio.
texts.en:
Dionisio Eduardo has worked as an artisan fisherman for over 22 years.  He began his business with much effort because in order to provide a much needed income for his family.

He works out of his home and must go out and sell his products every day.  He needs the loan to buy nets and other work supplies for his business.

loans.use: To buy nets and other work supplies

loans.name: Ibady Antonio

texts.es: Ibady Antonio se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de comida. Desde hace más de 34 años, inicio este trabajo buscando un medio para sobrevivir ella tiene un hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Su mama le había enseñado a cocinar diferentes tipos de platillos, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre llegan a disfrutar de la calidad de comida que Ibady realiza, todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano para iniciar las compras y comenzar con la elaboración de sus comidas. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, refrescos, bolsas, platos desechables entre otras.
texts.en: Ibady Antonio dedicates himself to offering food services.  He started the business more than 34 years ago, searching for a means by which to survive.  He has a young child in his care.  His mother had shown him how to cook different types of dishes, and his customers always come by to enjoy the quality of food that Ibady prepares.  He gets up early every day to shop and start making his foods.  The loan he is requesting is to buy basic staples such as refreshments, bags, disposable plates, and other items.

loans.use: buy staples such as refreshments, bags, and disposable plates, among other items.

loans.name: Evelyn Hortencia

texts.es: Evelyn: es D. 36 años D. edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos ella es dueña D. una tinda donD. venD. productos D. cosmeticos,como perfumeria cremas para damas etc. que esta ubicada en la aldea donD. ella vive desD. hace 17 años ademas hace trabajos D. belleza a domicilio ella nos cuenta que nececita este credito para la compra D. cosmeticos y asi agrandar su negocio su deseo es sacar adelante s sus hijos que estan estudiando.
texts.en: Evelyn, 36, is married and has two children.  She owns a store where she sells cosmetics such as perfumes and ladies' creams.  It is located in the village where she has lived for 17 years.  She also provides door-to-door beauty services and says she needs a loan to buy cosmetics so she can expand her business.  Her goal is to help her children get ahead.  They are now in school.

loans.use: To buy a variety of cosmetics.

loans.name: Nasser

texts.en:
Nasser is a 32 year old married man, father of three children. Nasser works in transporting water, agriculture, sand and stone. He has been doing this business for 13 years. Nasser  works hard to fulfill all his family's needs and desires. He works different jobs and strives to be accurate in every profession he takes.

Nasser is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua, in order to change his tractor's wheels and to pay in advance for the people who are going to harvest the tobacco season. He doesn't get paid directly after selling the tobacco, depending on the government's rules of paying.

Nasser hopes to be an owner of developed farming machines that can make planting and harvesting easier.

loans.use: to change the tractor's wheels in addition to paying the tobacco harvesters in advance.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna  is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 
Luna  has a shop that sells wood charcoal. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy wood for charcoal making.
Luna  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Luna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy wood for charcoal making

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, aged 61, is married to Susan and they are blessed with three children. Samuel practices dairy farming as his main business but has also run a hotel alongside it for fifteen years. He gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 from the businesses.

This is Samuel's fifth loan term with KADET LTD and he has successfully managed to repay his previous loans. Samuel will use the loan funds to buy a dairy cow and new seats and tables for the hotel. He hopes to operate a large scale farm in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and to renovate his hotel

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 48 años y 6 hijos.
Sus préstamos íntegramente los invierte en la compra de materiales seguir mejorando la infraestructura de su casa, la misma que ofrece servicio de hospedaje, Rosario alquila habitaciones personales y por ello necesita dar mantenimiento a su casa constantemente y poder brindar todas las comodidades a sus huéspedes.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos comprará: 3 metro de arena para enlucir dos cuartos, 6 baldes de pintura,  2 ventanas de aluminio.
Todos sus préstamos los ha sabido invertir en su negocio, gracias a las ganancias puede solventar los gastos de cas y pagar las cuotas mensuales a Manuela Ramos. 
"Gracias a Manuela Ramos por darme tanta facilidad para los préstamos que solicito todos los ciclos.
texts.en:
Rosario is a member of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) Communal Bank in Yarinacocha district, Ucayali department. She is 48 years old and has 6 children.

Rosario's loans were invested entirely in buying materials to continue improving the infrastructure of her house, which offers hospitality services. Rosario rents out personal rooms and for that reason, she constantly needs to maintain her house and offer all the conveniences to her guests.

With this new loan of 2,000 new sols, Rosario will buy 3 meters of sand to plaster 2 rooms, 6 buckets of paint, and 2 aluminum windows.

All Rosario's loans have been invested in her business, and thanks to her earnings, she can cover household costs and make her monthly payments to Manuela Ramos.

Rosario says “Thanks to Manuela Ramos for facilitating the loans I requested during all the loan cycles.”

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and windows for her house.

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire 13 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en:
This is a group composed of five members who live in Pire, a village located 100 kilometers from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. Their main business activity involves trading with farm products, such as cassava tubers. The group members are experienced in this field and have a strong customer base. The workday starts at 8 a.m. and ends around 8 p.m.

With this financing, the group members intend to buy 100 sacks of cassava that they will resell at the market. The income earned from the sale of cassava will enable them to strengthen their business and provide for their children (school fees, healthcare and household expenses).

loans.use: to buy cassava, groundnuts and millet.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 24 years old and has one child. Nila is married and her child is in school.

Nila is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Nila requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for six years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nila would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Meraha

texts.en:
Meraha is a married woman with four children, two of whom go to school, while the other two are yet too young to attend. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years Meraha has operated a sewing business, selling from the shop to her neighbours and passersby. Her major business challenge is seasonality, and she dreams of expanding her enterprise in the future to meet customer demand. Having decided to join Yehu to access business loans, Meraha wishes to borrow Kshs 25,000 in order to purchase more cloth materials for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Baasanpurev

texts.en:
Baasanpurev is a 37-year-old father of two children. He is married to Enkhmunkh. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife works as an assistant teacher in the local kindergarten. Their son attends secondary school and their daughter will attend a primary school this autumn.  

Baasanpurev finished secondary school in 1992. Since 2008, he has been working as a seller in a local Korean market. He faces some risks in his work currently, such as thievery.  

Baasanpurev is requesting a 1.700.000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase necessary construction materials to finish his housing project, which is 80% done. In order to complete the project, he needs to buy materials for the interior structure as well. He is a responsible and ambitious man who is willing to provide a good quality of life for his family. He is very thankful to the lenders who are giving him an opportunity to finish the housing project.

loans.use: to buy necessary construction materials to finish his housing project.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has four children one of whom works.

Ahmad has been an owner of a food market since 2007, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

Ahmad decided to apply for $3000 loan in order to buy a generator and a fridge and to make a sliding door for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a generator and a fridge and to make a sliding door for his market.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 32 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. She has a business selling tomatoes and onions in Buluk branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Lilian requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the profits from this loan will help her build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, a 41-year-old married woman with six children, owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in second-hand clothes for 12 years, having  gotten her initial capital from farming. Her hardships are inflation and high taxes, and her goals are to open a boutique and educate her children. Mary is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité fue formado gracias a la intervención D. una miembro D. otro comité, el cual les comento a las integrantes sobre el programa D. mujeres emprendedoras. El comité se denomina “Mujeres Vencedoras”, están en el Segundo Ciclo con 13 integrantes. Es un grupo conformado por personas muy unidas, solidarias y responsables, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, por lo que se comprometen en cumplir con cabalidad con los compromisos.
Una D. las miembros es la señora María, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropas, comenta que hace tiempo que se dedica a esto, por lo que le trae muy buenos ingresos, además D. eso dice que tiene muchos pedidos con los que le gustaría poder cumplir, es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra D. ropas, con las cuales podrá cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The commission was formed thanks to the intervention of a member of another commission, which spoke to its members about this program of women entrepreneurs.  The commission is called "Mujeres Vencedoras" and it is in its second loan cycle with 13 members.  It is a group consisting of unified, socially conscious and responsible people, whose members possess a great enterprising spirit, and so they have pledged to fully satisfy their commitments.  

One of the members is Maria, who makes a living selling clothes.  She indicated that she has been making a living in this way for quite some time, and that it has brought her very good earnings.  She also says that she has many requests that she would like to be able to satisfy, and therefore she is asking for a loan to buy clothes, with which she will be able to take on those new customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in order to resell.

loans.name: Hugo Amado

texts.es:
Hugo de 56 años, es un hombre trabajador  que tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento de su negocio.
El negocio de él es la venta de legumbres, empezó esta actividad hace 2 años.
La esposa lo ayuda a diario con la venta en el local, trabaja desde las 4:00am hasta las 14:00pm, de lunes a domingos.
Está casado, su esposa la ayuda en las ventas.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de legumbres como: papas, choclos, tomate, etc.
Su sueño es incrementar su negocio y que su familia tenga un buen bienestar.
texts.en: Hugo is 56, he is a hard working man with hopes to grow his business.  His business is the sale of vegetables, he started two years ago.  He is married and his wife helps him every day at the stand, he works from 4 am to 2 pm, from Monday to Sunday.  He requests a loan to buy potato, corn, tomato, etc  His dream is to grow the business and the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as potato, corn, tomato, etc.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. Luzviminda has operated a shop selling canned goods, snacks and beverages for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Luzviminda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Martha 	Miriam

texts.es: la señora Martha es cliente antigua de la institución trabajo siempre en grupo comunales y fue una buena cliente ya que no tuvo ningún problema con el pago de sus cuotas, la señora se dedica a la artesanía en manualidades,  entre sus trabajos que realiza son carteras, cubre mesas y canastas, la señora tiene excelentes trabajos y de muy buena calidad, la señora tiene dos hijos que ya son mayores ellos trabajan y estudian a la vez, su esposo es mayor de edad,  esta ya jubilado,  la señora trabaja duro y se actualiza constantemente realizar y para vender sus productos, el crédito será invertido en la compra de material para realizar adornos navideños para las  fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en: Martha is a long-term customer of this microfinance institution. She always works with this community group. She is a good customer and has never had a problem paying her payments. She makes crafts by hand. Among the many things she makes are purses, tablecloths and baskets. She does good work that is of high quality. She has two grown children. She is retired. She works hard and always finishes her products so that she can sell them. This loan will be used to buy the materials she needs to make Christmas decorations for end of the year parties.

loans.use: to buy the materials she needs to make Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Washington

texts.es:
Washington de 33 años, empezó su trabajo desde muy joven como ayudante, con el tiempo fue aprendiendo el oficio y decidió independizarse y con la ayuda de Dios pudo tener su propio local con su negocio.

Una de sus dificultades es el clima ya que le afecta mucho al local donde trabaja. Está casado y su esposa ayuda con los gastos del hogar vendiendo productos de catalogo, tiene 1 hijo de 1 año.

El quiere construir mejor su negocio por eso quiere comprar madera, cemento, bloques. Su meta es poder ampliar su negocio ya que este es muy pequeño.
texts.en:
33-year old Washington began working as an assistant furniture-maker when he was a young man. Eventually he learned how to do the job and decided to set up on his own. With God’s help he managed to obtain a place from which to run his business. One of the difficulties he faces is the climate as it greatly affects his premises.

Washington is married. His wife helps him with household expenses as she sells products from a catalog. They have a one-year old son.

He now wishes to improve his premises so plans to buy wood, cement, and blocks to achieve this. His goal is to expand his business since it is still small.

loans.use: to buy wood, cement, and blocks

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es:
Rosa, nuevamente se ha decidido a obtener otro crédito, porque lo necesita para la recolección de la cosecha puesto que son varias manzanas de tierra cultivadas de granos básicos, esta siembra le ayudado a poder vender la cosecha y dejar para su familia.
Ella está muy contenta por los créditos anteriores ya que le han ayudado mucho para su familia y de esa forma ha podido apoyar a su familia y tener lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Rosa, has once again decided to obtain another loan because she needs to collect the harvest because there are several plots of cultivated land with basic grains. This planting helped her to be able to sell the crops leaving some for her family.

She is very happy with her previous loans because they have helped her family very much as in this way she was able to support her family and to have what it takes to live.

loans.use: to gather the harvest

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Angel Miguel

texts.es: Angel con su anterior credikiva compró insumos, materias primas con los que preparo, panes pudines y postres,  los vendió muy bien y así mismo le fue. Desde que recibió el credikiva,  su liquidez ha mejorado, permitiéndole comprar mayor cantidad de materiales de contado y por ello recibió muchos descuentos. En la actualidad se encuentra tramitando la compra de su vivienda lo cual lo hace muy feliz, porque esto dará estabilidad a su familia. Su meta es lograr una mayor ampliación de su mercado, para lograr ventas  superiores a las actuales.  Con su nuevo credikiva, al que está aplicando, comprará materias primas e insumos de panadería como harina de trigo, azúcar, grasas entre otros. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Que sigan apoyando a los pequeños negocios y amplíen el monto de los créditos.”
texts.en:
Ángel used his previous Kiva loan to buy ingredients and raw materials to prepare bread, pudding and desserts.  He sold very well and he did very well too.  Since receiving his Kiva loan liquidity has improved allowing him to buy larger amounts of materials for cash which qualified him for many discounts.  

He is currently negotiating the purchase of his house which makes him very happy because this will provide stability for his family.  His goal is to attain a larger expansion of his market to reach higher sales than currently.  

With the new Kiva loan he’s applying for he will buy raw materials and baking supplies like wheat flour, sugar and fats, among others.  His message for Kiva lenders is the following: “Continue helping small businesses and increase loan amounts.”

loans.use: to buy bakery supplies like wheat flour, sugar and fats, among others.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is a young farmer from the village of Akhaldaba, East Georgia. He married couple of months ago and lives in the village with his wife Mariam and his mother. The only source of the income for the family is their agricultural business. In particular, the family owns a small dairy farm with two milk cows. Roman’s mother produces cheese, which is sold locally in the village. Also the family owns 0.8 hectare of land, where cabbage, haricots, beets and carrots are grown. Roman sells harvested vegetables on the local market as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 300 Laris. 

Roman requested credit for cultivation of the land and purchasing wheat for sowing. After proper cultivation of the land the family will get a good harvest of wheat next year and sell it for a reasonable price. They will get planned income, which will be used for financing family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to hire a tractor for land cultivation and purchase wheat for sowing.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, age 45, is married and has five children. They own a house that has electricity  but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a business renting tents and chairs. She operates at the market, and her customers include town dwellers and those who have functions. She faces a challenge of misplacement of chairs, which leads to losses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

With the 15,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase more tents and chairs for her business. She joined Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase more tents and chairs for her rental business.

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en: Marusya is 55 years old and she lives with her husband in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Marusya has two sons and both of them are married and with their families they live in Russian Federation. Marusya works at the canteen of the city’s hospital. Her husband is also employed and he works at the private workshop. Maruysa asks this loan as her husband has serious health problems. With this loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams Marusya will cover the expenses of her husband’s surgery and then the course of treatment at the hospital. Her greetings and great thanks beforehand for Kiva support.

loans.use: to cover the expenses of her husband’s surgery and then the course of treatment at the hospital

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Mr. Komi T. is a young moped and motorcycle mechanic. He is 30 years old and a married father of one child. As he does not have the means to rent a shop, Komi runs his business from the side of the road and is very restricted by the local municipality. The young man\'s business is developing, with a growing number of motorcycles that he cannot all repair because of his workshop\'s small size.

In order to meet the needs of his customers and to be free from the threats of municipal authorities, Mr. T. is requesting a loan of $850, which will allow him to rent and set up a shop to open his garage and attract more customers. The success of this project will bring him more business, thus increasing his income and allowing him to contribute to an improvement in his living conditions and those of his family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur T. Komi est un jeune mécanicien à 2 roues. Agé de 30 ans, il est marié et père d’un (01) enfant. N’ayant pas de moyen pour louer un atelier, Monsieur Komi exerce son activité au bord de la rue et est très gêné par la municipalité. L’activité du jeune homme se développe avec le nombre de plus en plus croissant de motos qu’il n’arrive pas à contenir à cause de la petitesse de son atelier.

Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et d’être à l’abri des menaces des autorités municipales, Monsieur T. sollicite un crédit de $850 qui va lui permettre louer et aménager un local pour ouvrir son garage pour attirer davantage de clientèle. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et de facto ses revenus qui contribueront à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loans.use: To rent and set up a shop to open a garage

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
My name is Florentina Maria M., and I am a native of Bela-Vista in the district of Matutuine. I am 41 years old, a married mother of two, and a daughter of a polygamous father. I grew up in a large family with nearly 22 siblings; thus, obtaining an education was difficult. For survival, I learned how to fish at a young age, and, because of my talent for sewing, my father decided to enroll me in a sewing school at the age of 18. To purchase sewing materials, I would sell horticultures. At the end of my sewing courses I worked as a waitress in a tavern because of my lack of experience. After a year, I acquired a sewing machine and began to work from home. Right now I have 4 sewing machines, one machine to make buttonholes, a tailor’s workshop, and 3 employees (two women and one man). With the current loan I intend to increase the volume of my business and transform the tailor’s workshop into a sales boutique where we would sell appropriate materials and diverse fabrics—right now I only work with fabrics provided by my clients.

Florentina’s business’ impact on the community is great; currently there exists no dressmaker with the same quality of service who also offers greatly reduced costs to visitors to Maputo seeking a dressmaker. Florentina’s services are thus in great demand.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Florentina Maria M., natural de Bela-Vista distrito de Matutuine, de 41 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 2 filhos, filha de pai polígamo, cresceu numa família numerosa com cerca de 22 filhos, dai as dificuldades em ter uma educação condigna, para a sua sobrevivência dedicava desde criança a pesca artesanal e dada a sua vocação de corte e costura o pai decidiu aos 18 idade matricular-lhe na escola de costura. Para a compra de material de costura sempre vendeu hortícolas, e no fim do curso trabalhou numa botequim como servente pois não possuía nenhuma experiência prática. Passado um ano adquiriu uma máquina de costura e tendo desde ai começado a fazer trabalhos em casa. Actualmente conta 4 maquinas de costura e uma de furar botões, uma alfaiataria e 3 empregados sendo duas mulheres e um homem. Com o presente crédito pretende ampliar o volume de negocio e transformar a alfaiataria em boutique pela compra de todo material próprio e diversos tecidos pois actualmente tem trabalhado com tecidos trazidos pelos clientes. A sua actividade tem um impacto bastante grande pois no local onde desenvolve a actividade não existe modistas com a mesma qualidade dos serviços que oferece reduzido assim em grande escala os custo de deslocação aos utentes à cidade de Maputo a procura dos mesmo serviço, resultando deste modo numa maior procura dos seus serviços.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Mrs. Benita is 56 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter and she started this business 10 years ago with a stand in the municipal market.

Although her business has grown, one of her children is still studying and this takes a larger portion of her income. With her business, she has enabled her other children to study as well, and they are now working.

This is not the only work she does. She also does door to door sales of clothing. She selects the place where she sells based on the different harvest times of the agrarian production in the country.

She plans to use the loan to buy more merchandise, especially since there is more demand for seasonal clothing. She innovates her business buying merchandise that in fashion. This way she can ensure that her son can finish highschool and enroll in university.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Benita tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos; su marido es carpintero y ella empezó con este trabajo hace 10 años atrás con un puesto de venta en el Mercado Municipal.

Su negocio fue creciendo, uno de sus hijos estudia todavía y le absorbe gran parte de sus ingresos, así también con su trabajo ya ha hecho estudiar a sus otros hijos que ya son todos profesionales.

Ella no sólo se dedica a esta actividad, sino que también se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropas. Elige la zona de venta de acuerdo a las diferentes temporadas de cosechas de producción agraria del país.

Planea utilizar el crédito para comprar más mercaderías puesto que por ahora hay muchos pedidos de ropas de temporada, así también tiene que innovar sus negocio, comprando las mercaderías que están de moda de manera a asegurar la terminación de los estudios secundarios del hijo y por que no incursionar en la universidad.

loans.use: To buy winter clothing

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 39 years old and is separated from her husband. She has three children. She works selling healthfood, as well as cosmetics which she sells to the people in her community both by request as well as offering them door to door. She belongs to a group 10 of April 8, together with Micaela Moshan Gomez, an artist who makes makes special embroidered blouses and table clothes, and also Yesenia Vianey Lopez Roman, who sells cosmetics. With the loan, they all would like to invest in their businesses - Maria and Yesenia will buy more products to build their sales, and Micaela will buy silk and cloth to make more blouses, and be able to bring them to artists markets to sell.

MARIA, tiene 39 años, separada, tiene 3 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos Alimenticios energéticos y también a la venta de cosméticos distribuyéndolos entre las personas de su comunidad, algunas veces a pedido y también ofreciéndolas casa por casa. Ella pertenece al grupo 10 de Abril 8.junto con doña MICAELA MOSHAN GOMEZ (artesana que confecciona blusas y servilletas de manta y luego las borda) Y doña YESENIA VIANEY LOPEZ ROMAN (vende cosméticos) Todas esperan con el préstamo invertir en sus negocios, doña Maria y doña Yesenia compraran mas productos para aumentar de esta forma sus ventas , en cambio doña Micaela comprará hilos de seda y manta para tener mayor cantidad de blusas que vender y poder llevarlas al mercado de artesanías a ofrecerlas.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Selling food products

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: Shahnoza R. is 22 years old. She is single, and has some professional education. After she graduated, she entered a college. She graduated later after successful completion, and started work in a barbershop. Step by step, she began increasing her hair cutting skills and consequently decided to open her own business. Currently, she rents a room in a district center, and provides her services there. The prices for her service is much lower than the other barbershops in the surrounding area. Her work there serves as her main source of income. Shahnoza would like a loan to increase the number of rooms in her business, and also renew the equipment she has. Shahnoza plans to return her loan within 12 months.

loans.use: for barbershop repair and buying necessary equipment for hair cutting and hair-dye

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda has a small cafe where she sells lunches. She started out by working as a cook in a cafe, but her earnings were not sufficient, so she started her own business with the help of some money given to her by the godfather of one of her children. Now she has a solid clientele and is very well-known in the area for her good cooking.

Glenda used her first loan with Mifex and Kiva to invest in the purchase of bigger pots, an industrial stove, and benches for her business. With this investment her sales increased and she had enough income to enroll her 3 children in school. For that, her children are very grateful. The second loan Glenda is requesting will be used to make improvements to her home and business. She wants all of her customers to feel welcome and comfortable in her café.

Glenda is 37 years old single mother. She depends completely on this business to support her family. The father of her children abandoned her when the youngest daughter was just three years old. She is very concerned about the education of her children. She is an enterprising woman and she knows that her business will grow and will provide the financial security she needs.

loans.use: Make improvements to her home and business

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
Cleofe is 49 years old. Since she was very young, she was always a hardworking and optimist woman. She works selling drinks and gifts, merchandise she offers at all the weddings in her hometown, Macari. Thanks to her effort and initiative, for the past two years this work has given her very favorable results, allowing her to improve the financial situation of her family. While she does this job, her husband, Leonardo, offers services of rural transportation from Macara to Ayaviri, in the little bus they bought through much effort. Between the two of them they seek to offer security and education to their five young children. Cleofe wants to increase her merchandise stock, and to make this work, she needs a loan. Let's help make Cleofe's plans become reality, she awaits your positive response.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Cleofe de 49 años de edad, desde muy pequeña siempre fue una mujer muy hacendosa y optimista.Se dedica a la venta de bebidas y regalos, mercadería que ofrece en todos los matrimonios de su pueblo natal, Macari, trabajo con el que gracias a su empeño e iniciativa, hace dos años le viene otorgando resultados muy favorables permitiéndole así mejorar su situación económica familiar.Mientras ella desempeña este trabajo, su esposo, Leonardo, presta servicios de movilidad rural de Macará a Ayaviri, en su pequeño ómnibus que adquirieron con mucho esfuerzo. Entre los dos buscan ofrecerle bienestar y educación a sus cinco hijos menores.Cleofe desea aumentar el stock de su mercadería y para llevar a cabo este proyecto requiere obtener un préstamo.Ayudemos a concretar los planes de Cleofe, ella espera por tu favorable respuesta.

loans.use: Buying a larger quantity of merchandise for her small store (Compra de mayor cantidad de artículos para su pequeña tienda.)

loans.name: Bwafuna (Ii) Group

texts.en:
Justine is 48 years old and a single mother of five children. She cooks and supplies snacks to a certain primary school. She will use the extra profits from this loan to pay school fees for her children.
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more baking flour, frying pans, and sugar to cook snacks for a local school

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anastacia is a hard-working woman with big dreams of transforming her small work space into one of the largest and busiest restaurants in her area. Along with preparing and selling her delicious dishes, she has decided to convert a portion of her small space into a convenience store and sell items of primary necessity and use the extra income to provide for her family. Anastacia carries out her work with much joy because it allows her to afford to educate and care for her two beloved children, who have become her reason to live and motivate her to keep making headway. With the goal of enlarging and remodeling her restaurant, Anastacia is requesting a loan. With your support and her plans, she will be able to earn more income. You can help Anastacia reach her dreams soon.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Anastacia, es una dama muy laboriosa con gran deseo de convertir su pequeño espacio de trabajo en uno de las más grandes y concurridos restaurantes de su zona, adicionalmente a esta labor de venta y preparación de deliciosos potajes, ha decidido adecuar un espacio de su reducido local para la venta de abarrotes y artículos de primera necesidad con los que obtiene indispensables ingresos económicos que obtiene para el sustento de su familia.Anastacia desempeña estas labores con mucha voluntad y alegría porque gracias a estos les otorga educación y bienestar a sus dos queridas hijas, quienes se han convertido en su razón de ser y la fuerza que la motiva a seguir adelante. Con el fin de acrecentar y remodelar su restaurante solicita un préstamo que luego de tu gentil colaboración y su buena inversión podrá generar mayores ingresos económicos. Usted puede hacer que doña Anastacia concrete en corto tiempo su anhelo.

loans.use: Enlarge her restaurant and purchase larger quantities of primary-need items for her small convenience store. / Ampliación de su restaurante y compra de mayor cantidad de artículos de primera necesidad para su pequeña bodega.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Fatuma K.. She is married with 2 children, aged 3 and 9, and has 1 other dependent, who is her younger sister.

In 2005 Fatuma established a seamstress business, and she requires a new loan in order to purchase additional material and sewing accessories. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase material and sewing accessories for her seamstress business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy U. is married and has 6 children. She is 48 years old and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She has been selling foodstuffs and provisions in her shop since 1989. Mrs. U. is requesting a loan of $700 to buy a refrigerator for cooling drinks. In addition, with this loan she will be able to buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: To buy provisions, foodstuffs, and a refrigerator

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Ohiegbomwan Magdalene is 38 years old and married with five children. She sells meat in the Ekiosa market, one of the local markets in her community. She is from the Oka Area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been engaged in this business since 2005. She needs a loan of $700 to buy more meat for sale to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more meat for sale

loans.name: Mapartar Group

texts.en:
Salamatu is 40 years old and married with four children. The Maparta group leader started her food business three years ago and was able to expand it with a previous loan from SMT. She is happy that the business allows her to meet some of the family’s expenses and supplement her husband’s meager income.

The group members are very cooperative and also operate a savings club. The savings are currently being kept by the leader as collateral; in the event that a member fails to pay the Kiva loan installment on time, the group will pay from the savings. The members would like to expand their businesses and are therefore requesting a loan of $1,475.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, palm oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana M. is a person with focus, she is enterprising and active. She is married with two children: Amayrany is 9 years old and is currently attending primary school; and Brandon is 2 years old. She started her business to have a second income from her husband's, so that she can provide her children a better life and become a success. She started in April 2002 sellnig sweets outside her house located in front of two schools, where many students pass by. She wanted to take advantage of that fact and it was going very well, so well that her husband decided to join her and set up a larger stand. Today they can depend on their stand, and always continue to work hard to make it through.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 US that will be repaid in a term of 3 months to purchase more merchandise that is in great demand and to have a better selection to offer her clients. With your help all of this can be made possible.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Juana Martínez es una persona seria, emprendedora y activa. S casada y tiene 2 hijos: Amayrany de 9 años, estudiante de primaria y Brandon de 2 años. Inició el negocio para tener otro ingreso aparte de lo que percibe su esposo y poder darles a sus hijos una vida mejor y salir adelante. Comenzó en Abril de 2002 vendiendo dulces afuera de su casa ya que tiene casi enfrente dos escuelas y pasan muchos estudiantes, por lo cual quiso aprovechar, y como me empezó a ir muy bien con la venta de dulces su esposo se animó a poner un negocio un poco mas grande lo cual hicieron. En la actualidad ya cuentan con su miscelánea y les va muy bien, están esforzándonos por salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para poder comprar mercancía que tiene mayor demanda y tener un mejor surtido para atender a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda esto será posible.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ligia has a small business selling clothing from her home. She lives in the Ticuantepe municipality. She is 39 years old, is married and has two children who are in school. Her husband helps support the family from the income he obtains as a commercial carrier. Ligia has had her business for seven years and she carries it out with a lot of effort and dedication because with her business she helps her husband so that all the burden is not on him. Also, her husband has allowed her to grow as a small businesswoman and in turn to feel useful to society and her family. With the loan she is requesting, her business selling women’s clothes will improve since she currently relies on a small inventory of these products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Ligia tiene una pequeña venta de ropa en su casa de habitación, con la cual surte a los vecinos de su barrio. Habita en el Municipio de Ticuantepe, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos estudiantes. Su esposo la apoya en la manutención del hogar con los ingresos obtenidos de su actividad que es transportista. Ligia tiene 7 años de tener el negocio, lo cual lo desarrolla con gran esfuerzo y dedicación porque con éste apoya a su marido y no le deja toda la carga a él. Además que le ha permitido desarrollarse como mujer microempresaria y también sentirse más útil a la sociedad y a su familia. Con el préstamo solicitado aumentará su negocio en ropa para dama ya que actualmente cuenta con poco inventario de este producto.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to stock business.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Gloria Maria tiene 46 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah de la ciudad de Managua, es viuda, y no tuvo hijos. Gloria Maria es una pequeña comerciante que tiene un cafetín en un hospital de la ciudad de Managua, en su cafetín ofrece diversos productos como gaseosas y golosinas. Hace 5 años puso ese cafetín y a través del tiempo lo ha mejorado tanto en infraestructura como en atención. Este cafetín lo inició con ahorros que ella había hechos por algunos años, y a través de créditos a AFODENIC, ha podido crecer poco a poco. Su sueño siempre fue terminar de construir su casa ya que a ésta le hace falta algunos detalles, como por ejemplo el techo del porche de su vivienda el que instalará con el dinero de este préstamo.
texts.en:
Gloria Maria is 46 years old and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua. She is a widow and doesn't have any children. She is a small businesswoman, running a snack bar at a local hospital and offering diverse products such as soft drinks and snacks.She has been doing this for five years, and over time has improved its infrastructure and customer service. She started the snack bar with savings she had from a number years, and with loans from Kiva partner AFODENIC, she has been able to make it grow little by little. Her dream always has been to finish building her home, since it still lacks some details, for example the porch roof she plans on building from this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put a roof on her porch

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Mrs. Lon S., 44, lives in Preak Thom village in Kandal province with her husband, Mr. Khieng Sovannara, and their two children. She is a vegetable seller in the local market and her husband is a construction worker who makes a small income to support the family. Their youngest child is one year old and the older child is employed in a garment factory.

Since her first child's work place is far from home, Mrs. Lon S. spends a lot of money on transportation. In order to save money on transportation, Mrs. Lon S. has been saving to buy a motorbike for her child to go to work. She is requesting a loan to add to her savings.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child to go to work.

loans.name: Nasriniso

texts.en: Nasriniso has sold fabrics for women's clothing at the market for many years. Her fabrics are some of the best at the market. By now she has many clients. She knows her business very well. She is a mother of 5 kids. Her husband works as a cook. She wants to borrow money for purchasing more goods for selling and thus make more profit with which she can provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: Purchasing more fabrics and expanding her business

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam es soltera, vive con sus hermanas y su padre. Tiene más de 7 años de experiencia en la crianza de animales, principalmente ovejas, a las cuales cuida con mucho cariño. También tiene cultivos de quinua y papa, que vende en el mercado principal de la ciudad Jauja, ahora tiene planes para mejorar y producir más. Adicionalmente Miriam trabaja en la municipalidad de su localidad, como asesora de  proyectos, ella es docente de profesión y lo combina con sus labores agrícolas. Es la quinta vez que Miriam solicita un préstamo en MFP, y es una de las clientes más cumplidora de su banco comunal. En esta oportunidad desea invertir en la compra de sacos de abono y fertilizantes, a fin de preparara su tierra para la época de siembra.
texts.en:
Miriam is single and lives with her sisters and father. She has more than 7 years of experience raising animals, mainly sheep, which she raises with much care. She also has quinoa and potato crops that she sells in the main market in the city of Jauja; now she has plans to improve and produce more. Additionally, Miriam works for the municipality of her area, as a project adviser. She is a teacher by profession, which she combines with her agricultural work. This is the fifth time that Miriam is requesting a loan from MFP, and is one of the most dependable clients of her communal bank. With this loan she would like to invest in the purchase of sacs of manure and chemical fertilizer, so that she can prepare her fields for the planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacs of fertilizer

loans.name: Emilina Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Emelina tiene 40 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Memorial Sandino, estado civil casada su esposo es albañil, tiene dos hijas de 12 y 17 años de edad, sus planes para su familia es brindarle un patrimonio seguro y con mayor protección. Doña Emelina tiene su pequeño negocio de variedades desde hace dos años, sus objetivos en el ámbito económico es aumentar el volumen de venta a través de nuevos clientes y ofreciéndole nuevos productos. Con la solicitud del préstamo de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cementos, bloques y ladrillos para terminar de construir su casa, y poder gozar de una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Señora Emelina is 40 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She is married, and her husband is a builder. She has two children, who are 12 and 17 years old. Her plan for her family is to provide them with a safe, more protected future. For the past two years, Doña Emelina has had a small business, where she sells a variety of items. Her economic objectives are to increase her sales volume through gaining new clients and by offering new products. With this loan from Afodenic, she will be able to buy construction materials, like cement, concrete blocks, and bricks, to finish building her house so that she can enjoy a proper home.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to finish building her house

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 36-year-old married man with three children, living in Jnah in Beirut. He has worked as a plumber since he was 18 years old. He inherited the plumbing business from his father. Ali wants to borrow $1200 to purchase new and improved tools for his plumbing business.

loans.use: Buy new plumbing tools

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, junto a su mamá, empezó desde cero a aprender a manejar una tienda, y le parece que todavía puede ‘crecer’ en su conocimiento del negocio. La idea de comenzar con su tienda de helados, gaseosas, dulces, jugos y salchipapas nació de la necesidad de ayudar a su mamá y proveerla de algún ingreso.
Anteriormente María trabajaba como contadora en una empresa. Se dedicó a esta ocupación durante cinco años tras haber conseguido su título en contabilidad. No obstante, cuando implementó el negocio de la tienda con su madre terminó por manejarla ella misma.
Su negocio tiene casi tres años, y está ubicado en un local que es parte de la casa de sus padres y ella lo alquila a ellos. Mientras que antes tuvo ayuda de un par de primas en el trabajo de la tienda ahora ella trabaja sola, y a veces recibe ayuda económica de su hermana. Por esto, hace cinco meses se juntó a EDAPROSPO y los préstamos la ayudan a llevar para adelante su comercio.
Sin embargo, a sus treinta y tres años María planea trabajar solo un par de meses más con la tienda, y luego a dedicarse a algo diferente por ella misma, ya que ni está casada ni tiene hijos.
texts.en:
María, together with her mother, started from nothing to learn how to run a store and she believes that she can still increase her knowledge of the business. The idea of starting a store for ice cream, soft drinks, candy, juices and salchipapas (a fast food dish of sliced pan-fried beef hot dogs and french fries) came out of the need to help her mother and have some income. María used to work as an accountant for a company. She worked at this occupation for five years after she graduated with her degree. However, after she started up the store with her mother she ended up running it herself. The business is almost three years old and is located in part of her parents´ home, which she rents from them. Before, she was helped in the store by a few of her cousins but now she works by herself and sometimes gets financial help from her sister. For this reason, five months ago she came to EDAPROSPO and receive a loan to help out her business. At her 33 years, María plans to work just a few more months in the store and then look for something different for herself since she is neither married nor has children.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ice cream, drinks and candy for her store.

loans.name: Chadulu O Group

texts.en:
Hadija has been a charcoal seller in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for 10 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $25. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Hadija is married and has four children between the ages of 2 and 13. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members: Raila, Kuruthum and Tune. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Sabzbahor

texts.ru: Набиева Сабзбахор проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 32 года , замужем и имеет пятерых детей.Домохозяйка. Занимается фермерской деятельностью.Имеет небольшое хозяйство , где разводит крупно рогатый скот. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы получать молоко.Молоко она сможет реализовывать своим соседям, а часть оставит своим детям. Погашать кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sabzbahor N. lives in Vahdat. She is 32 years old, married and has five children. She is a homemaker and involved in an agricultural business. She has a small farm where she raises livestock. Sabzbahor plans to obtain this loan to purchase a dairy cow and have milk. She could sell the milk to her neighbors and leave some for her children. She can repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Valeriu

texts.en:
Valeriu has two greenhouses on a surface of 776 m. p. He works growing tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, and eggplants. Business is profitable because Valeriu has experience in business and knows how to use technology for increasing vegetable production. He also has 1. 5 hectares of arable land where he grows cabbages and onions. 

Valeriu sells his vegetables at the wholesale market in his district. Valeriu used to grow vegetables mostly in the field, but now he grows them in the greenhouses. He has taken out a loan from Microinvest to purchase film to build another greenhouse.

loans.use: construction of a new greenhouse

loans.name: Dodo

texts.ru:
Абдуллоев Додо Нарзуллоевич 1962 года рождения ,таджик ,женат, имеет 6 детей. 
 Жена Азизова Равшан проживает с мужем и детьми в г.Истаравшане.
 Клиент уже около 10 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Ему помогает сын Иззатулло.
 Клиент берёт займ 1200 сомони сроком на  10 месяцев.
 Дополнительный семейный доход он получает за счет реализации помидоров и огурцов, которые он выращевает вместе со своей семьей.
texts.en:
Dodo A. was born in 1962. He is Tajik. He and his wife, Ravshan Azizova, have 6 children and reside in Istaravshan. Dodo has been working in agriculture for over 10 years. is son Izzatullo assists him in this business. The family earns extra cash by planting cucumbers and tomatoes. Dodo is applying for a 10-month loan of 1200 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to grow vegetables

loans.name: Zanab

texts.en:
Zanab is 50 years old and is married with four children. She cooks and sells beef to earn a living. She is hoping to obtain a loan in the amount of N100,000 in order to purchase more beef to cook and sell.

She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to cook and sell

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El centro focal Germán Buch esta ubicado en la  ciudad de El Alto, a este pertenece la asociación "Renacer”, trabajan hace un año junto a la familia de Pro-mujer, con mucha responsabilidad en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
Diferentes son los negocios que existen en este grupo, algunas se dedican a la costura; otras realizan confección de calzados; tejido a mano de chompas y mantillas, una de ellas tiene su taller de cerrajería. Actualmente desean aumentar su producción para vender sus productos a tiendas comerciales, por lo que necesitan mayor capital, para la adquisición de materia prima. Tienen la seguridad  de mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera mejorar también la calidad de vida de sus familias
texts.en:
The central focus of German Buch is located in the city of El Alto, which pertains to the “Renacer” [Reborn] association.
