Adriana needs a loan to buy more merchandise, for example: sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, sacks of noodles, and other items.  Adriana is grateful for the opportunity being provided through these means, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule.  Adriana belongs to the communal bank "Pinkulluna," in the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, sacks of noodles, and other items.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 30 años, es una mujer buena y amable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 13 y 07 años, tiene una casa propia en donde comparte sus días a lado de su pareja y sus dos hijos quienes son su razón de esfuerzo, trabajo y sacrificio. El trabajo de Martha consiste en lea venta de abarrotes en general, tiene una tienda en su casa que es muy visitada ya que esta ubicada en una calle muy concurrida, además de tener fácil acceso, ella vende de todo y los clientes van muy a menudo por que saben que encontraran ahí de todo y a un bajo precio, al principio cuando indicio su trabajo vendía pocas cosas y en cantidades pequeñas, poco a poco fue creciendo y ahora tiene una tienda de abarrotes grande, trabaja sola y le esta yendo muy bien ya que gana bien pero se esfuerza mucho también. Al principio tubo la dificultad de conocer muy bien su trabajo, lleva realizándolo por tres años y este tiempo aprendió muchas cosas para así tener mejores ingresos y manejar mejor su negocio, tiene muchos planes a futuro pero el principal es de poder agrandar su tienda. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, por ellos espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará productos para su tienda, entre las cosas que comprará serán abarrotes, pasamanería y algunos otros que le piden a menudo en su tienda.
texts.en: Martha, 30 years old, is a good and kind woman. She lives with her partner, with whom she has two children, 7 and 13 years old. She has her own house where she spends her days at the side of her partner and their two children, who are her reason for effort, work, and sacrifice. Martha's business is selling general groceries. She has a store in her house that is very popular, since it is located on a very busy street. In addition to being easy to reach, she sells everything, and her customers come in very often because they know they will find everything there and at a low price. At first when she started her work, she sold few things, and in small quantities. Little by little her business grew, and now she has a large grocery store. She works alone, and it's going very well for her since she earns a lot, but she works a lot, too. At the beginning she had the difficulty of learning her business very well. She has been in this business for three years, and in this time she learned many things in order to increase profits and better manage her business. She has many plans for the future, but the principal one is to expand her store. This will be her third loan with MFP, so she hopes for your collaboration so that she will be able to realize her plans. On the other hand, she promises again to make her payments on time, as with previous loans she has had. She is also very happy to belong to her communal bank, since all of its members are very responsible and supportive. With the amount requested of 1500 soles, she will buy products for her store, among them groceries, personal accessories and office supplies, and other items that people often ask for in her store.

loans.use: to purchase products to supply her store.

loans.name: Yngrid

texts.es:
Yngrid nació en la ciudad de Calca y vive en la ciudad donde nacio, ella tiene 29 años  edad y tiene una relación de unión libre pero todavía no tiene hijos, ella alterna sus actividades cotidianas con su trabajo en la ciudad del Cusco, ella es técnico en administración hotelera y trabaja en uno de los hoteles más lujosos de  la ciudad del Cusco y sus funciones como trabajador son bar, recepción y limpieza. Ya son varios años que se desempeña su carrera profesional y le va muy bien pero el sueldo que le pagan no le alcanza para los gastos del hogar entonces se las ingenio para abrir un negocio. Yngrid  en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta de panes y crianza de animales menores como  por ejemplo pollos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más pollos y para comprar harina de trigo para elaborar más panes.  

Yngrid es integrante del grupo “Virgen de Asunta de Calca” lo conforman 15 socios que viven en la ciudad de Calca de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Yngrid, 29, was born in the city of Calca and lives there still.  She is partnered, but has no children.  She is an administrator at one of the most luxurious hotels in Cusco and her responsibilities range from tending bar to cleaning.  She has worked at the hotel for many years and likes the work.  The pay, though, is too little to cover her expenses and, consequently, she decided to start her own business.  Two businesses, in fact.  She splits the time she's not working at the hotel between one business making and selling bread and a second business raising chickens.  She will use this loan to buy more chickens for her poultry business and flour and other supplies for her bakery business.  

Yngrid is a member of the Virgen de Asunta de Calca community bank.  The bank has 15 members, all of whom live in Calca, a city in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her poultry business and supplies for her bakery business.

loans.name: Bernita

texts.es: Bernita, de 39 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en concubinato con Carlos, desde hace 15 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, a los cuidan en casa de su mamá, ubicada en la ciudad de Pampas. Junto a su esposo se dedican a diversas actividades. La principal durante el año es la agricultura, tienen 10 años sembrando papa, alverja, olluco y maíz, en sus 7 parcelas de terreno agrícola. Que según cuenta, adquirió gracias a su esfuerzo y constancia. Además en cada cosecha viajan a la capital del país, a comercializar sus alimentos. Pero en temporadas de feria y festividades, realizan negocio. Que consiste en la venta de frazadas, colchones, sombreros, cucharones de madera y ollas de barro; a los diferentes caseríos de la zona, como son Salcabamba, Tayacaja, Quishuar y demás; donde ya es conocida y obtiene buenas ganancias, pues tiene clientes fijos. Ahora desea ahorrar dinero para comprar su casa propia. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “las líderes de santa anita” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está muy contenta pues tendrá, apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Bernita, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra al por mayor de frazadas, mantas típicas y ollas; para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Bernita, 39 years old, is a hard-working woman. She has been living with her partner Carlos for the last 15 years. Both have 4 children whom they look after in her mother's house, located in the city of Pampas. Together with her husband they work in various activities. The main one during the year is agriculture. They have 10 years experience planting potatoes, peas, ulluco and corn in their 7 agricultural plots. These they acquired thanks to their constancy and effort. 

Furthermore, with each harvest they travel to the capital of the country to market their foodstuffs. However during market days and festivities they do business which includes selling blankets, mattresses, hats, wooden spoons and clay pots to the different settlements in the area, such as Salcabamba, Tayacaja, Quishuar and others, where she is renowned and makes good profit as she has regular customers.

Now she wishes to save money to buy her own house. She belongs to the solidarity group "Las Líderes de Santa Anita" and this is her second loan with MFP where she is very happy as she will have financial support and will therefore feel sure about moving on with her business. On the other hand she promises to comply with her quota payments. Furthermore, she likes to be part of her association because all of its members are responsible, supportive people. Bernita, on receiving support; will invest the requested money in buying bedspreads, traditional blankets and pots wholesale, in order to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, blankets and pots.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena, se dedica a la crianza de pollos y administra un comedor, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella inicio a administrar los negocios con el apoyo de su esposo, trabaja en su casa, no tiene un horario fijo para realizar sus labores.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pollos pequeños y concentrado para alimentarlos, este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar la granja, ampliándola con la compra de más pollos.
La aspiración de Magdalena es que este préstamo cubra sus expectativas, mejorando el negocio y su condición como comerciante.
texts.en: Magdalena raises chicks and runs an eatery.  She lives with her husband and two children.  She started to run the businesses with support from her husband.  She works at home and does not have a fixed work schedule.  She is currently asking for a loan to buy chicks and feed concentrate for them.  This loan will help her improve the farm expanding it with the purchase of more chicks.  Magdalena’s hope is that the loan will meet her expectations improving the business and her condition as a merchant.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed concentrate.

loans.name: Samet's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager living in Battambang province’s Bovel district, Samet is aged 47 years and married with four children. She and her husband are farmers who have been growing rice for 10 years. Besides this, she also earns additional income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her 47,000KHR per day. 
This is the sixth loan for Samet with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her farming production to generate more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Jencie

texts.en: Jencie is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma's husband died from heart attack 14 years ago.  She has four children and worked as a nurse for long years.  She is now running a health booth which she founded with a very small budget eight years ago.  She is using her fourth loan.  With the help of the loans she bought bulks of health materials and expanded her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Fatma hanım eşini 14 yıl önce kalp krizinden kaybetmiş.  4 çocuk annesi olan Fatma Hanım hemşire olarak uzun yıllar kuruluşlarda çalışmış ve sekiz yıldır küçük bir sermaye ile kurduğu sağlık kabinini işletiyor.  Maya dan 4. kredisini kullanan Fatma Hanım Kredileri ile sağlık malzemeleri alarak işini geliştirdi.

loans.use: to purchase medical supplies

loans.name: Marlen Yolany

texts.en:
My name is Yolany, I’m an enterpreneur, I have a little bread factory at home. I have several years working in this type of activity, thanks to this business I’m able to help cover my family expenses, offering my children better opportunities so they can study. Right now I need to invest more, because is Christmas season and sales are larger.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Yolany, soy comerciante, cuento con una pequeña mini fabrica de pan de casa en mi casa de habitacón, cuento con varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad, gracias a este negocio puedo comtribuir con los gastos de mi familia, ofreciendo a mis hijos mejores oportunidades para que ellos puedan estudiar, actualmente necesito invertir mas ya que en esta epoca de navidad el volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use: To buy flour, cooking fat, eggs, wood, margarine, sugar, milk, among others.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is married and has two small children. Her husband works in a recycling factory, but his income isn’t enough to cover all the needs of his family. Rita is a very dynamic and enterprising woman, and a year ago she decided to help out her husband by selling shoes. She has reinvested a part of her income in her business, because she has a great desire to get ahead; unfortunately, it is not enough to satisfy what her customer's orders.

At this time, Rita needs a loan in the amount of $375.00, which she will use to buy merchandise for the summer season. She plans to return it over a period of 5 to 10 months because she believes that with her job she can do it. She needs your support and warmth, she is awaiting this loan to continue with her business. You can help make possible a better life for Rita and her family. Decide to support her.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rita es casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una fábrica resicladora, pero el ingreso que obtiene no es suficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia. Rita es una mujer muy activa y emprendedora y decidió, desde hace un año, apoyar a su esposo vendiendo calzado, del ingreso que ella recibe ha reinvertido una parte en su negocio porque tiene enormes deseos de superación, lamentablemente esto no es suficiente para satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes.

En estos momentos Rita necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $375 dólares que utilizará para la compra de mercancía de temporada de verano, ella confía en retornar éste en un plazo de 5 a 10 meses porque confía que con su trabajo podrá lograrlo. Ella necesita de tu ayuda y cariño, está en espera de este préstamo para continuar con negocio, tú puedes hacer posible una mejor vida para Rita y su familia, decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Iskandarov

texts.en: M. is married and has four children. Formerly, he was a teacher of Russian language, but from 1995 until now he has been a food seller. He had a very good knowledge about trading from his brother who was a trader. M. was given a loan of $888 by MLF «HUMO». He has increased the range of his products and lowered prices. With a loan of $1000, he plans to further increase the range of goods and buy larger quantities, thus reducing transportation expenses and lowering prices. For the poor population of Khuroson low prices are very important for purchasing goods.

loans.use: Selling food

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es:
Benjamín is married and has 2 young kids. His salary used to be very low did not cover their basic household needs. He therefore decided to work for himself and started to rent a taxi in order to work. When he had saved up enough money he bought his own taxi. He works hard every day for the wellbeing of his family and for his children’s education.

Right now Benjamín would like a loan of $475 which he will use for the repairs and maintenance of his taxi so that he can offer a better and safer service to his clients. He will repay this loan in 6 months. Benjamin thanks you for your support and for the opportunity that you can give him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Benjamín está casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos, el salario que recibía como empleado era muy poco y no podía cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia así es que decidió trabajar por su cuenta y comenzó a rentar taxis para trabajar, pronto comenzó a ahorrar y logró adquirir su propio taxi. El bienestar de su familia y el deseo que sus hijos puedan continuar estudiando es lo que lo motiva a trabajar y esforzarse más cada día.

En estos momentos Benjamín está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la reparación y mantenimiento de su taxi, para ofrecer un mejor servicio y mas seguridad a sus clientes, él promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Benjamín agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y salir adelante con su familia.

loans.use: Maintenance and repair/Mantenimiento y reparación

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is single and lives in Kahovka and has a small business there. She sells footwear in the local market. Alla has been in this trade for four years. Presently, she has about $2000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $1000. Monthly net profit is about 350. 

Alla would like to get a loan of $1200 to increase her turnover capital and her sales. Despite all the major challenges she had faced in her business Alla didn’t give up and is determined to press on with her business and achieve real success as a small entrepreneur. Today her mind is filled with many new ideas of how to make her business bigger and better and is planning for the long-term. Alla is hoping to use the loan to fulfill some of her dreams by promoting growth of her business.

loans.use: To purchase new shoes wholesale

loans.name: Moussa Sadon

texts.en:
M. Moussa Sadon is a dynamic and ambitious tradesman. M. is 32 years old and married. He lives with his wife and their 2 children in Attécoubé, a populated township in North-West Abidjan. M.’s oldest daughter goes to primary school.

M. owns a small general food store in the Attecoube open market. He sells various tinned products, aromatic products and vegetable oil. He has expanded his activities during the last couple of years with the different loans he received from AE&I. He has improved his family's standard of living and made good progress in his business. He now wishes to purchase goods in bulk so as to meet his customers' higher demands in the coming weeks approaching the end-of-year celebrations.

loans.use: Maiga Moussa Sadon will use the loan to replenish his general food store

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria del Pilar’s entire family is in the grain harvesting and processing business, but each person also spends some time each year doing other activities. Upon seeing that she could obtain good results, Maria del Pilar, along with the help of her mother, has decided to open a small processing factory for cereals. Recently, they have become one of the most important providers for the shops and vegetarian restaurants of the city of Juliaca. This young businesswoman’s wish is to have a great processing plant for cereals and Andean grain. For the moment, she wishes to obtain a loan to buy primary material to process their heavily demanded products. Let us help this young businesswoman prosper with her new project.

Translated from Spanish by David Hou, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Toda la familia de Maria del Pilar, estuvo dedicada a la transformación de granos, pero conforme pasaban los años cada uno dispuso realizar otras actividades ajenas a esta labor. Al ver que podía obtener buenos resultados, Maria del Pilar con apoyo de su madre con mucho empeño y diligencia decidió implementar su pequeña fábrica de transformación de granos andinos (cereales), actualmente se están convirtiendo en los proveedores más importantes de las tiendas y restaurantes vegetarianos de la ciudad de Juliaca.El deseo de esta joven empresaria es tener una gran planta de procesamiento de cereales y granos andinos y por el momento desea obtener un préstamo para comprar materia prima para procesar sus productos tan demandados.Apoyemos a esta joven empresaria a prosperar con su nuevo proyecto.

loans.use: Increase of capital to meet the demand for her products.

loans.name: Ntawo A (I) Group

texts.en:
Milly is 45 years old and married with three children.She has a poultry farm of laying hens. She intends to use the extra profits to begin commercial farming and to buy a plastic water tank.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To construct a brooder house for chicks

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is a very diligent mother with big plans for her business. For the past five years she has been dedicated to the buying and selling of second-hand shoes, which she acquires in bundles from the city of Tacna and sells in the cities of Cusco and Juliaca. She carries out this work with the support of her husband, Walter, and it's generating an important economic source for them, allowing them to provide for the well-being and education of their two young children, who are the reason and motivation to keep working hard. Norma, seeing a great demand for her business, wants to increase her stock, and for this reason is requesting the loan. With your support, Norma thinks she will be able to improve her financial situation even more.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Norma es una madre muy empeñosa y con grandes planes para su negocio, desde hace 5 años está dedicada a la compra y venda de zapatillas de segundo uso, mercadería que adquiere por fardos de la ciudad de Tacna y los oferta en la ciudad de Cusco y Juliaca. Este oficio que desempeña con apoyo de su esposo, Walter, les está generando una importante rentabilidad económica, permitiéndole brindar bienestar, educación y un techo propio a sus 2 menores hijos, quienes son la razón y el motivo que los impulsa a seguir esforzándose.Doña Norma viendo la gran demanda del mercado, decidió aumentar la cantidad de su stock es por esa razón que tiene pensado acrecentar su capital de inversión, ella considera que con tu apoyo y su voluntad mejorarán aún más sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Offer customers a large selection of shoes / Incremento de capital para ofertar mayor cantidad de zapatos a la población en general.

loans.name: Ahror.

texts.ru:
Ahror M. lives in the Shahrinav region. He is 45 years old, is married and has 5 children. Ahror has a high school education, he raises small livestock that he then sells for meat. He purchases livestock at the regional market, feeds it for 30-40 days and then sells it for a profit. He has been in this business for 15 years. This business is the main source of income for his family. In addition, the expansion of the livestock business provides local markets with fresh meat. Ahror will use his loan to purchase young sheep and goats. He will pay back the loan over a 6 months period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Малаев Ахрор Умарович проживает в районе Шахринау.Возраст 45 лет . Женат имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит мелко-рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо. Покупает товар на рынке района, откармливает около 30-40 дней , а затем перепродает по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 15 лет. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом.Клиент хочет получить кредит для того чтобы закупить молодых овец и коз. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase small livestock

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is thirty-three years old, married and a mother of three children. All of her children are currently in school. She sells onions, beans and sugar in the Mankessim market.

Efua wants to use her loan to buy more sugar, beans and onions to avoid price hikes and reduce her frequent travel to Takyiman, which is in the northern part of Ghana, for her products.

She is a proud member of the group called “Gyedzi,” which means believe. Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loans.use: to buy more onions, beans and sugar

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela sells fresh vegetables in the San Martin Jilotepeque Chimaltenango market. She buys the vegetables wholesale and then sells them individually. She has had this business since she was a girl, inheriting it from her mother. Her husband died 17 years ago, and with this business she has supported her 4 children, all of whom study. She also raises pigs, which she buys when they are little and then sells them.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Adela se dedica a la venta verduras frescas en el mercado de San Martin Jilotepeque Chimaltenango, ella compra esas verduras al por mayor y las vende por unidades. Ella se ha dedicado a este negocio desde que era niña, lo heredo de su madre. Su esposo murió hace 17 años, y con su negocio ha salido adelante con sus 4 hijos, todos ellos estudian. En su cada también se dedica a la crianza de marranos, los cuales compra pequeños y luego vende.

loans.use: Invest in buying vegetables

loans.name: Teresa María

texts.es:
Teresa B. is originally from the Nagarote district in the city of León where she sells crafts, which she makes in her home.

Fifty-seven years old, Teresa has managed to get ahead thanks to the income generated by selling these crafts. Initially she was not very successful because she started out selling in small quantities. Since then, however, a lot of time has passed and Teresa has improved her financial situation.

Teresa is seeking the support of a Ceprodel loan, which will enable her to purchase crafts for sale. If her loan is approved, Teresa will be better off by using the loan to improve the conditions of her house.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La señora Teresa B. es originaria del municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León donde tiene su venta de artesanías las cuales comercializa en su propia casa de habitación.

A sus 57 años, ha logrado salir adelante gracias a los ingresos generados por las ventas de estas artesanías. Sus inicios fueron muy malos por haber comenzado a vender en pequeñas cantidades pero a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha logrado mejorar su condición económica.

Hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de las artesanías para la venta. Con el otorgamiento del crédito se beneficia porque así puede mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of crafts

loans.name: Ileana

texts.es:
Ileana started her business three years ago at the invitations and with the help of one of her neighbors who was doing very well selling cosmetics. Ileana's business took off when her husband lost his job, and Ileana organized cosmetics parties while her husband looked after their young children. With clients from these parties she began establishing her network, which continues to grow every month.

Ileana needs a loan for $600 to be paid back in 6 months, to purchase more merchandise and continue with the growth of her business. This will be possible with your help!

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva translator

Ileana inicio su negocio cuando la invito una vecina, que se estaba beneficiando mucho con la venta de productos cosméticos, así comenzó ayudada por su vecina, su negocio se activo debido a que su esposo quedo desempleado, entonces el cuidaba a los hijos mas pequeños para que ella pudiera hacer demostraciones por las tardes, y así empezó a formar su red de ventas, actualmente ya tiene su cartera de clientes mas los que crece mensualmente, hace tres años que inicio el negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder continuar con su negocio. Con tu ayuda esto será posible.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long T., 40, lives in Phnom Penh with her husband, Yim Chhun, and their children. She sells fish in the local food market each day making US$3 per day, while her husband is a construction foreman and he makes US$3.5 per day. The family is also supported through the employment of one of the children who works in a local garment factory. Selling fish in the market typically involves purchasing them from a local fisherman and reselling them at a higher price. Long T. has seen customer demand rise for her business and right now the price of fish is rising. She has asked for a loan of US$1000 to invest in her business and to see it grow. She believes that this investment can help to increase her customer base and will provide improvements that can benefit her in the long term.

loans.use: Long would like to invest in her fish selling business.

loans.name: Karla Estebana

texts.es: Doña Karla tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación de la ciudad de Managua, tiene seis hijos, de los cuales cinco son independiente y uno esta estudiando en la universidad las edades son de 17,19, 20,21, 24, y 26 años de edad. Su esposo es conductor. Doña Karla tiene una pulpería, que inició con fondos propios y  con ayudad de su esposo e hijos, empezó vendiendo pocos productos, ahora la pulpería ha incrementado su inventario, tiene ocho años de tener la pulpería. La solicitud de crédito es para invertir en la pulpería en la compra de productos como granos básicos y productos de limpieza, y así no desmejorar la oferta para sus clientes. La meta de Doña Karla es poder terminar de darle estudios a su hijo menor para prepararlo profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Karla is forty-six-years-old, married, and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the city of Managua. She has six children, five of whom are independent and one of whom is studying at the university. They are seventeen, nineteen, twenty, twenty-one, twenty-four, and twenty-six-years-old. Her husband is a driver. Ms. Karla has a local store, which she started with her own funds. With the help of her husband and her children, she started selling a few products. Now, she has had the store for eight years, and the inventory of the store has increased. She is requesting a loan to invest in the store and to purchase products such as basic grains and cleaning products. This way, the supply for her clients will not decrease. Mrs. Karla’s goal is to be able to finish giving her youngest child an education to prepare him for a professional career.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains and cleansing products for her local store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy furniture

loans.name: Zareena Rustam Ali Group

texts.en:
Zareena Baji is the daughter of R. A. and lives in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. She is unmarried. She has three brothers and three sisters. Two brothers are in the food business and her younger brother sells wood. Her sisters attend school. Zareena Baji does household work and helps to take care of her family.

She has successfully repaid her prior two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy groceries for her brothers grocery shop. She is joined in her loan group by other members. Parveen Baji is requesting a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shamim Baji is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics for her cosmetics business. Naseem Baji is requesting a loan to buy materials (shaving and cutting tools) for her barber saloon.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for the repayment.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Egnonam Afi

texts.fr:
Madame T. Egnonam Afi est née en 1981 à Ganavé, une des villes du Togo. Elle s’est mariée avec un mécanicien moto et ils ont deux (2) enfants. Depuis l’année passée, elle exerce le commerce des produits pharmaceutiques au marché d’Agoè, un quartier au nord de Lomé.
Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle soutient ses enfants et paye les dépenses de la famille.
Actuellement son stock est épuisé et elle désire s’approvisionner. A cet effet elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter divers produits et différents produits pharmaceutiques.
texts.en:
Ms. Egnonam Afi T. was born in 1981 in Ganavé, a city in Togo. She is married to a motorbike mechanic, and they have two children. Since last year, she has been doing commerce in pharmaceuticals in the Agoè marketplace. With the income from this business, she supports her children and covers family expenses. Currently, her inventory is depleted, and she would like to get supplies. For this, she is requesting this initial loan to buy various good and different pharmaceutical products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods and different pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth tiene 56 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II y vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero por no contar con los debidos medios económicos no pudo continuar estudiando. Se casó a los 28 años y tuvo 5 hijos, 2 hombres y 3 mujeres, pero ahora tiene solamente 4 hijos porque una hija falleció. Los 4 hijos dependen de la pareja porque aún son estudiantes.
Elizabeth elabora y vende tamales en las tardes. Se sienta al costado de su amiga que vende pan, los clientes se sienten provocados por los tamales para el lonche y lo compran. Esta actividad lo realiza de manera ambulatoria.
El primer crédito fue de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas y lo invirtió en comprar manteca y maíz.
Con este crédito de S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en todo lo que sea necesario para tamales.
Elizabeth sueña con tener una gran empresa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth is 56 years old and belongs to the Community bank of United for a Better Future II, and lives in the district of Florencia de Mora, department of Libertad, Peru. She finished high school but couldn't keep on studying because of lack of economic resources. She married when she was 28 years old and had 5 children 2 sons and 3 daughters, but now she only has 4 children because one of her daughters died. The 4 children are still dependents, because they are all still in school. Elizabeth works and sells tamales in the afternoon. She sits next to a friend who sells bread, the clients then get tamales for their lunch when going to buy bread. She works on this on the streets. Her first credit was for S/.300 which was cancelled in 4 quotes and invested it on buying butter and corn. With this new loan for S/.800 which will be cancelled in 4 quotes too, she will invest on all supplies necessary to create her tamales. Elizabeth dreams on having a great business one day.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest on the preparation of tamales

loans.name: Elidió

texts.es:
El señor Elidió R. R. vive con su esposa e hijos, ellos tienen 5 años viviendo en esa casa.
El señor Elidió trabaja como mesero prestando sus servicios en diversos eventos como bodas, XV años, etcétera, el tiene 2 años trabajando en ese puesto, su esposa trabaja como chofer de carretera. Entre los ingresos de ellos 2 mantienen a sus hijos.
El señor Elidió R. esta solicitando un préstamo para contratar mano de obra y construir una herrería y piso de concreto en su casa, con el objetivo de tener mas seguridad en su hogar y así de esa manera él y su familia vivan mas cómodamente.
texts.en:
Mr. Elidió R. R. lives with his wife and children, and they have lived for five years in this house. Mr. Elidió works as a waitor, providing service at events such as weddings, quinceneras (15th birthday celebrations for girls), etc. He has had this position for 2 years, and his wife works as a driver. Between their two earnings, they support their children. Mr. Elidió R. is asking for a loan so that he can contract workers to construct some iron bars and a concrete floor for their home, with the goal of having more security en the house, and in this way, his family will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Misty McNally, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make iron bars and a conrete floor in his home

loans.name: Alejandra Patricia

texts.es: Alejandra Patricia R. R. tiene 27 años, está casada, y tiene 2 hijas. Esta joven tiene muy buenos propósitos para con su negocio seguir manteniendo esta fuente de ingresos ya que es el único medio de supervivencia para su familia. Su actividad económica es la venta de oro laminado y plata, así que la venta de estos productos la realiza de manera ambulante y lo ofrece a sus familiares y compañeros. Su deseo es de establecerse con sus productos en algún mercado en donde pueda exponer sus productos por lo que necesita capital de trabajo para la compra de variedad de productos. Ella va a pagar la cantidad de C$ 5.500 córdobas a un plazo de 6 meses.
texts.en:
Alejandra Patricia R. R. is a 27-year-old married mother with 2 children. This young woman has very good goals in order to keep her business afloat because it is her family’s sole source of income. She sells silver and gold-plated jewelry for a living as a street vendor, offering her merchandise to family and friends. She wishes to establish her business in some market where she can display her products, which is why she needs business capital to purchase a greater variety of products. She is requesting a loan for C$5,500.00 Nicaraguan Cordobas, which will be repaid in 6 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret Sienje is a 26-year-old mother of 2 children, raising them on her own. She sells clothes in the Nyamasaria slum and is looking for a small loan so she can expand her business. She hopes to improve the lives of her children and will be using her profits to pay their school fees.

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en:
Ismayil T. is 54 years old and is married with four children. He is a small entrepreneur with a grocery store he has rented for the last seven years. He sells various kinds of foodstuffs in the store, such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, detergents and many other items.

Now Ismayil would like to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push on to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children will progress by means of their studies, and he is doing his very best to achieve this. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more food items for his store

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Née en 1985 à Adétikopé, banlieue de Lomé dans la Préfecture du Golfe, Mme Ama G. est une jeune femme mariée avec un (01) enfant à charge. Ses études scolaires étant écourtées dûes aux manques de moyens financiers, elle entreprit très tôt l’apprentissage de la coiffure et tresse. Actuellement, elle a terminé sa formation et veut s’installer dans son propre compte, mais n’a pas les ressources. Néanmoins, avec son esprit d’initiative, elle réussit à faire pour le moment la tresse dans un carrefour au bord de la route afin de trouver un revenu substantiel pour s’installer convenablement et ouvrir son atelier. En ces périodes de fêtes de Pâques, où les demandes en tresses des femmes et des filles sont très élevées, elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner en mèches et "chouchouvi". Ses clientes pourraient acheter directement les mèches chez elle pour les tresses. Ainsi, elle pourra faire des bénéfices sur la vente des mèches en plus de sa main d’œuvre. Ceci lui permettra de se tailler une place au soleil et de rivaliser d’ardeur avec ses camarades qui ont pu poursuivre leurs études.
texts.en:
Born in 1985 in Adétikopé, a suburb of Lomé in Golfe prefecture, Ms. Ama G. is a young married woman with a child to support. Since her schooling was cut short due to a lack of financial means, she soon undertook an apprenticeship in hairdressing and braiding. Currently, she is finished with her training and wants to get situated and on her own but doesn’t have the resources. Nevertheless, with her initiative, she is for the moment successful in doing braids at a crossroads location in order to find substantial revenues for getting situated properly and to open her own workshop. During the Easter season, when the demand for braids from women and girls is very high, she’s requesting financing for supplies of hair extensions and chouchouvi. Her customers would be able to buy hair extensions directly from her for braiding. Thus, she will be able to make a profit from selling hair extensions, in addition to her handiwork. This will enable her to carve out a place for herself under the sun and to rival her friends, who have been able to pursue their schooling.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hairdressing and braiding hair

loans.name: Alumukeng Lumumba Night Group

texts.en: Mrs. L. Night is 39 years old and married with no children. She has been selling charcoal for over 3 years. She is now requesting a loan to purchase bags of charcoal. She is happy because she can help herself out and also help her community by supplying charcoal to them at fair prices. Her dreams are building a house and obtaining livestock for more wealth.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.en:
Tatiana has been in the garment business for many years. Having a rich experience in the business, she decided to launch her own a tailoring shop two years ago.

As a seamstress who has set up shop in Chisinau City, she is hoping to provide a variety of services to local clients. She employed tailors who actively participate in increasing the business despite nationwide competition. They can offer alterations on prom dresses, bridesmaid dresses, pants, jeans and mess kits. Tatiana enjoys the customers and she really enjoys meeting people and helping them to get what they need to have done.

Tatiana did extensive research before starting up her tailoring shop. She began producing better grades of garments with fine material and a highly qualified workman team. A good quality sewing machine will be her biggest start-up expense. She decided to borrow a loan of 30,000 lei from Microinvest to buy a new sewing machine for new workers where each of them is interested in business expansion.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Nancy Soledad

texts.es:
La señora Nancy Soledad P. C.  tiene 56 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria completa, no tiene  hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Nancy  se dedica a la venta de productos de pan llevar y tiene un teléfono publico, este negocio se inicio hace 25 años,  su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Bellavista  II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc.
El crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos para implementar su bodega.
Nancy  tiene como sueño tener su bodega mas implementada y comprarse su congelada para vender helados  para crecer como microempresaria
texts.en:
Nancy Soledad P. C. is 56 years old and she lives in the Esperanza district of the Trujillo region in La Libertad, Peru. She completed primary school, and she has no children that are still dependent on her. Nancy owns a convenience store and she also has a public telephone service. She started her business 25 years ago, a business she runs from her home. With the first loan of 300 soles she received from the Bellavista II community bank (Kiva Field Partner), she made an investment in products such as rice, sugar, pasta, etc. With this loan of 300 soles, she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and pasta, to supply her grocery store. Nancy's dream is to have a better established convenience store and to buy a freezer to be able to sell icecream, to expand her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products such as rice, sugar, and pasta to supply her convenience store.

loans.name: Tutafika Group

texts.en:
Charles P., age 42, is married with three children, ages 15, 13 and 9. He has a tailoring business which he started in 1995. He also sells clothes in his tailoring shop. He works daily from 9.30 a.m. until 8 p.m. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $138.

This will be Charles’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He wants to use this loan to increase capital and to buy a sewing machine.

Charles will share this loan with his loan group, Tutafika, which has 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Charles is first from the left in the second row.

loans.use: Increase capital and buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.en:
Ambrosia L. is from the village of P-24, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is fifty-nine years old and married with nine grown children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling products like cooking oil, soy sauce, vinegar and so on, in the local market. Ambrosia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $250 a month from these activities.

In June 2009, Ambrosia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation through engaging in business activities. Ambrosia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and for working capital

location.town: P-24, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del No

loans.name: Margarita Pastrana

texts.es:
la señora Margarita Pastrana M. tiene 34 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Rigoberto Javier Flores,  tienen un hijo, ellos no tienen casa, estan rentando desde hace 04 años. El se dedica a la albañileria y ella costura en su casa a las personas del barrio, necesita el prestamo pàra comprar una maquina nueva de costurar por que la que tiene casi ya no le sirve.
la meta de ellos es poder coprar una casa y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida, ese es su mayor sueño en esta vida y dice que trabajando duro lo va a poder cumplir.
texts.en:
Señora Margarita Pastrana M. is 34 years old and lives with her domestic partner, Señor Rigoberto Javier Flores. They have one son. They don't have their own house, but have been living where they are renting for four years. He is a construction worker and she works from her home as a seamstress for people from the neighborhood. She needs this loan to buy a new sewing machine because the one she has is almost useless. Their goal is to be able to get a house and thus have a better quality of life. That is her greatest dream in this life and she says that by working hard she is going to achieve it.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.en:
The Oñondivepa Committee was formed thanks to the desire to better and overcome their low socio-economic status, since the woman of this committee are people of very limited resources.
   They receive an average of 400,000 Guaraníes and they use it to buy and then sell a wiD. range of things including: flour, eggs, oil, meats, condiments, milk, sugar, herbs, salt, vegetables, melons, watermelon, bananas, oranges, and a variety of fruits.  
Furthermore, they buy and sell second hand clothing, footwear, dairy products, etc. to try to increase their incomes and better their way of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, oil, meats, condiments, milk, sugar, herbs, salt, and others.

loans.name: Set

texts.en:
Mr. Set S., 65 (shown in the picture), and his wife, Mrs. Kong Sem, 64, live in a small village along national road number 2, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, have been married since 1963, and have 7 children: 2 sons and 5 daughters. Unfortunately, 4 of them have died. The remaining children are married, and 2 live in separate houses.

Set and his wife have been growing rice for 40 years. He is now requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide for his farming business.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide for growing rice

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes J. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in the resturant and is requesting a loan to purchase more chairs and tables in the resturant for better acommodation. 

 Agnes is 23 years old and is Married with a husband that is a fire brigador. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the floor of her resturant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more chairs and tables in her resturant

loans.name: Bolortuya

texts.en: Bolortuya is 31 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Dornogobi province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son, age 8, attends a local secondary school while her daughter, age 5, attends kindergarten. Her youngest child is an 8-month-old infant who stays at home. Bolortuya owns and operates a local public bath house. These bath houses are important for local people, as many of them do not have running water with which to bathe. She began her business in 2007 and she earns between 150,000 and 200,000 tugrugs per month. While her business is doing well, it can be expensive to maintain a public bath house. Bolortuya replaced one third of her showers last year, and these repairs make it hard to expand or significantly improve her business. Because of this, she is requesting a 900,000 tugrug loan in order to make repairs and remodel her bath house.

loans.use: To make repairs and remodel her bath house.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  membres du groupe Kotognogontala sont tous des  femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants, et  vivant la plupart dans des familles monogames à Hamdallaye,  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait l’achat et la vente de condiments alimentaires, de fruits et légumes, de bois de chauffe, de riz et de la restauration. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution  et tous les trois précédents prêts ont se sont  bien dénoués. 
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 1sac de 100kg de riz, 4 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 2 chargements de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 1 sac de 100kg de graines d’arachide (pour  faire de la pâte d’arachide pour la restauration) et 10 paniers de fruits. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages environnants. Elles effectuent leurs ventes à domicile, de façon fixe dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante. Elles vendent au comptant, souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five members of the Kotognogontala group are all married women who are on average 32 years old with 3 children, and live mainly in monogamous households in Hamdallaye, one of the districts in the town of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. This group of women are engaged in buying and selling food condiments, fruits and vegetables, firewood, and rice, and in preparing meals for sale. In order to satisfy the needs of their clientele, they decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their fourth collaboration with the institution, and all three of their previous loans were repaid properly. With their new loan, they intend to buy one 100-kg bag of rice, 4 packets of food condiments, 2 van-loads of firewood, one 100-kg bag of peanuts (to make peanut paste for meal preparation), and 10 baskets of fruit. They obtain their supplies at the grand market in the town of Sikasso and in the neighbouring villages. They sell their goods at home, at stands in the markets, and door-to-door in various districts. They sell in cash and often on credit to a clientele composed of men and women. They foresee realizing an average monthly profit of 18,500 FCFA each, of which one portion will be used as savings and to provide for their families, and the rest invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell various items

loans.name: Sinjiya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe  SINJIYA  sont toutes mariées dans des familles  monogames avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent à MEDINE  un des  quartiers de la ville de Sikasso  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur  quatrième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but  de  satisfaire le besoin de leur  clientèle et d’augmenter leur profit. Tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente du bois de chauffe, d’orange, et de pomme de terre. 
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter,  30 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe , 15 sacs d’orange et 20 sacs de pomme de terre.  
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et dans les villages environnants. Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché de Sikasso ville  sur place, à domicile et de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant et souvent à crédit.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 19 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour aider le mari et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités et le remboursement du prêt.
Les femmes du groupe SINJIYA  ambitionnent de devenir des commerçantes grossistes.
texts.en:
The four women of the SINJIYA group are all married and in monogamous families. On average they are 39 years of age and have 3 children. They live in MEDINE, one of the neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are on their fourth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the intention of satisfying the needs of their clientele and increasing their profits. All the preceding loans were reimbursed without any difficulty. They perform various activities including the sale of wood for heating, oranges, and potatoes. With this loan, they plan to buy 30 loads of firewood, 15 bags of oranges and 20 bags of potatoes. They supply themselves in the big market of the city of Sikasso and in the surrounding towns. The merchandise is sold from a location in the big market of Sikasso city, door-to-door and on foot to a clientele composed of women and men, for cash and often for credit. They hope to realize an average monthly profit of 19,000 FCFA each, of which a part will be used to help their husbands and the remainder will be invested in the business and in repaying the loan. The women of the SINJIYA group aim to become wholesale traders.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, oranges and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Heyly

texts.es:
Heyly es una socia dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 24 años, es soltera, ella tiene una bodega en su casa y cuenta con el apoyo de su prima. 
Heyly forma parte del Banco Comunal “Fray Martin” desde hace dos años y 4 meses, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en la compra de gaseosas. 
Actualmente ella requiere un crédito de 900 soles, con el que comprará artículos para su bodega como arroz, azúcar, fideos, productos comestibles. La meta de Heyly es ampliar su negocio, tener una tienda comercial y vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Hayly, 24, has been a dynamic, hard-working member of the "Fray Martin" communal bank for the last two years and four months. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region; she's single and runs a small grocery store in her home where her cousin helps her. Her first, 300 sol loan, was used to buy soft-drinks. Hayly now needs a 900 sol loan to buy inventory items like: rice, sugar, pasta, food items, for her store. Her goal is to expand her business until she can have a commercial store and sell at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Lourdes' Group

texts.es: “Alborada”, es el nombre que agrupa una asociación de nueve personas, que se  reúnen en el centro focal Senkata hace más de cuatro años. Entre las tantas actividades que tienen este grupo tenemos a Lourdes A. (presidente de la asociación) que se dedica a la venta de artículos varios de acuerdo a la temporada, anteriormente ella vendía  material escolar, ahora por las fiestas de fin de año necesita comprar adornos y juguetes para venderlos en ferias de la ciudad. Venta que realiza de forma ambulante.  Sus compañeras se dedican a la venta de papa, ropa deportiva, jugos naturales, calzados y otros. En este nuevo ciclo la asociación “Alborada” afirma que necesitan capital para la compra de mercadería, adquiriendo variedad de productos.
texts.en:
"Dawn of day" is the name of a group of nine people that has been meeting in the Senkata regional office for more than four years. Among the numerous activities of the group, the business of Lourdes A. (president of the group) is selling various items according to the season. Previously, she sold school supplies. Now she needs to buy ornaments and toys to sell at city fairs for the end-of-year celebrations. She sells her products as a roving merchant. Her associates sell potatoes, sports clothing, natural juices, footwear, and other items. For this new loan cycle, the Alborada group needs capital to buy merchandise and acquire a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Nile Group 1, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Maine is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a widow with seven children, all still in school, and she also takes care of three more dependants. For the last 12 years, Maine has had a business selling fresh bananas from Njeru trading center. Her major challenge is transporting goods to her stall. She is able to make 100,000 UGX as profits a week and attributes this to acquired trust from her customers and her good customer care skills.
Maine hopes to set up her own banana plantation in order to reap from the sale of her own produce. She also wants to build a house for her children and be able to pay their school fees. Maine is requesting a loan to buy more bananas for resale.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel de 46 años, vive con su esposa Antonia que tiene  51 años y con sus 2 hijas; Sonia de 27 y Daysi de 21 años, juntos viven en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 28 años siembra  alverja, papa, maíz y sobre todo flores de gladiolos, pues apenas sale  la cosecha,traslada sus productos agrícolas a la capital, donde tiene un puesto en un mercado, según refiere transportar  lo cosechado hasta Lima es bastante rentable ya que el precio de sus productos se eleva al 100 %, lo que le permite ahorrar y vivir cómodamente; también dice que al principio  no le gustaba la agricultura, pero cuando empezó a formar su propia familia la necesidad hizo que trabaje en las tierras; en el futuro le gustaría sembrar en mayor  cantidad, sobre todo flores de gladiolos pues invierte poco y gana regular.Es el octavo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas.Con el dinero del préstamo comprará una bolsa de semilla de  alverja, varios sacos de abono, fertilizantes y botellas de insecticidas y fungicidas.
texts.en:
Samuel, 46, lives with his wife Antonia, 51, and their two daughters, Sonia, 27, and Daysi, 21. They live together in their own house. For 28 years, Samuel has grown peas, potatoes, corn, and above all, gladiolas. Just after the harvest, he takes his products to the capital where he has a market stall. He says taking his harvests to Lima is profitable, as the prices there are 100% higher. This permits him to save and to live comfortably. Samuel says that at first he did not like agriculture, but when he started his own family, he began to work the fields out of necessity. In the future, he would like to grow more, especially gladiolas, which bring good returns on a small investment. This is Samuel’s eighth loan with MFP and he promises to be punctual with each of his payments. With this money, he will buy a bag of pea seeds, several bags of manure, fertilizers, and bottles of insecticides and fungicides.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pea seeds, manure, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Josephin Epifania

texts.es: Josephin labora en la Alcaldia Municipal de Nueva Guinea, es madre de 3 niños: Lesly que estudia 5to grado de primaria, Johathan de 14 años en 3er año de secundaria y Franklin de 15 años estudiando el 4to asño de secundaria; requiere financiamiento para mejorar su casa y espera contar con el apoyo de kiva para realizar este pequeño proyecto, pues desea ponerle ceramica a la casa y mejorar la cocina.  Ademas tiene un pequeño negocio de Cafetin en la universidad URACAN de Nueva Guinea, de donde obtiene ingresos adicionales para el sustento familiar.  Josephin se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, de buenos valores, honesta y muy querida en su comunidad. Su mayor sueño es tener una casa bonita con las condiciones basicas para que su familia viva comoda.
texts.en:
Josephin works for Nueva Guinea's city hall. She has three children: Lesly, who is a fifth-grader, Johathan, 14, who is in 9th grade, and Franklin, 15, who is in 10th grade. She needs financing to improve her home and she hopes to have Kiva's support with this small project. She wants to install tile flooring in the house and improve her kitchen. Besides, she runs a small cafe in Nueva Granada's URACAN university which produces additional income for her family. Josephin is hard-working, has good values, is honest and very well-liked in her community. Her greatest wish is to have a nice house that has the basic conditions so that her family can live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace the floor and improve the kitchen.

loans.name: God Knows Us Group

texts.en: Mary B. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Knows Us. In the photo, Mary is the one holding the sign. She is 45 years old and is a single mother with six children, all of them high school graduates and some of them now married. Mary and her family live and work in the Gbengber community in Elwa in Monrovia, the capital of Liberia. She was never able to go to school herself due to lack of financial support from her parents. Mary’s business is the sale of foodstuffs such as oil, pepper, garden eggs (eggplant), etc. She buys her goods from wholesalers and sells retail to residents of her community. She has been running this business for more than twenty years and hopes to become a big businesswoman in the near future. Mary started selling with money that was given to her by her late husband but she is sometimes faced with rainy season problems because, when it rains, business can really be bad. Mary talks to her customers in a friendly manner in order to encourage them to continue to buy from her. She dreams of buying land to build a house for her family. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more oil, pepper and garden eggs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Food preparation and sales

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Mr. Isaiah A. was born in 1956. He is married to Loice Kiptoon and they have eight children: Wilson (23 yrs: in college), Jematia (19 yrs: Form four graduate), Kibet (21 yrs: Standard eight), Kipkulei (17 yrs: Standard 7), Kiprop (15 yrs: Standard 6), Cheptumo (13 yrs: Standard 5), Jeruto (10 yrs: Standard 3) and Rutto (8 yrs: Standard 1).

Isaiah runs a timber yard and also practices maize farming. He started this business twenty-nine years ago. He gets a monthly profit of Ksh 3,000 from this business and Ksh 5,000 from other sources of income which include his farm produce.

Isaiah was introduced to KADET by a community leader. He has never borrowed from another source before and this will be his first loan from KADET. He has requested a loan of Ksh 40,000 from KADET of which he plans to use Ksh 10,000 to purchase petrol (gasoline) for the power saw, Ksh 15,000 to plant crops, and the balance to purchase logs for sawing timber.

If this loan boosts his business he will use the extra profit to open a furniture shop. He dreams of opening a sawmill and he describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, petrol for timber harvesting and logs for sawing lumber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Anton

texts.en:
Anton U. is an entrepreneur and a married man. He runs a book shop where he sells a variety of books for kindergarten, primary and secondary schools at Yombo Vituka Ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases the books from the wholesale book shops at the Kariakoo City Market shopping center and sells them retail to customers. 

He is requesting a loan of T.shs 1,200,000 to capitalize the business.

loans.use: To capitalize the business

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Mr. Sat S. is 50 years old and is married to Mrs. Khy Heang, 51, who sells a few cakes in the village. For more than nine years, Sat S. has been earning a living by catching fish in and around the river. This couple takes care of three school-aged kids; another child is married and lives separately. 

Recently some of his fishing tools were ruined, so his fishing activity and current income have been affected. To solve the problem, Sat S. has decided to seek a loan to repair his broken tools and to buy new essential accessories for fishing.

loans.use: To repair broken tools and to buy new essential accessories.

loans.name: Osvaldo De Jesus

texts.es:
En el barrio San Salvador de Barranquilla, ubicado  muy cerca la reconocida  vía 40, que en los carnavales se llena de palcos y es también la zona industrial  de esta ciudad,  todos conocen la tienda "Los pajaritos" de la cual es propietario  Osvaldo O. P.  de 42 años de edad.  Desde hace 30 años su padre inició este negocio  cuando  fue despedido de la empresa donde trabajaba e inició vendiendo  productos de la canasta familiar y artículos de miscelánea; en esa época el negocio lo atendía su hermano y desde hace 5 años lo maneja Osvaldo,  quien con todo su empeño  y mucha disciplina  ha podido solventar sus necesidades; Aunque en los Pajaritos, su tienda, vende diariamente ranchos y vivevers, los fines de semana las bebidas frías que consumen sus clientes, generan mayor volumen de ventas y así mismo más utilidades, por eso le va bien durante todo el mes y porque sus clientes lo prefieren al ofrecerle mejores  precios que sus competidores.

En la actualidad está aplicando a su tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará  víveres como el azúcar, arroz, harina,  enlatados, granos, y aceite en mayor volumen, así obtendrá descuentos  especiales, se adelantará al  aumento de los precios de estos productos y surtirá su negocio  cómodamente. Con sus anteriores financiamientos logró que su negocio despegara, porque lo sentía un poco estancado  por falta de capital,  pero ahora Osvaldo puede ofrecer diversidad de productos a sus clientes. 

Sus sueños y metas están relacionados con aumentar sus ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia, por eso todo su crédito lo invierte en su tienda para impulsar su crecimiento, pues para Osvaldo constantemente hay muchos desafíos, ya que algunas veces siente que necesita más dinero para mucho de lo que desea hacer y se siente restringido en sus gastos porque  todo  le toca resolverlo a él solo, así que tiene que esperar.
texts.en:
The streets in the San Salvador de Barranquilla neighborhood are filled with grandstands during Carnival, and it is also the industrial zone of the city. Here, everyone knows the “Los Pajaritos” [Little Birds] store owned by Osvaldo O. P., 42 years of age. His father started the business 30 years ago when he lost his job. He began selling household food products and miscellaneous items. At that time, Osvaldo’s brother worked at the store, and Osvaldo has been in charge for the last five years. With much discipline and effort, he has managed to make a living. Although Los Pajaritos sells groceries and household items, on the weekends cold drinks make up the greatest volume of sales and profits, making the business profitable for the whole month. Also, the customers like that the prices are lower than those offered by the competition. Osvaldo is applying for his third loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will buy grocery items like sugar, rice, flour, canned goods, grains, and cooking oil in bulk. By buying in quantity, he can get special discounts and stock up the store. With his previous loans, he was able to get the business off the ground, as it had been stagnant due to a lack of working capital. Now, Osvaldo can offer a wide variety of products to his customers. Osvaldo’s dreams and goals are to increase his income to provide for his family. For this reason, all of his loan will be invested in the store, to keep it growing. For Osvaldo, life has constant challenges. Sometimes he feels that he needs more money for things he desires, but because he has many responsibilities, he knows he must wait.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grocery items

loans.name: Filadelfia Group

texts.es:
Una D. nuestras socias es la Sra. Norma, hace muchos años aperturo una imprenta la cual  dirige con mucho esmero y dedicación, allí elabora boletas, facturas y tarjetas para toda ocasión y todo los documentos que le solicitan.
Ella es casada y tiene 6 e hijos que la ayudan a seguir adelante, el objetivo D. Norma es que sus hijos sean profesionales y siente que lo está haciendo realidad, ya que una D. ellas estudia en la universidad, ella se siente contenta y con muchas ganas D. apoyar al grupo.

Gloria se dedica a comercializar condimentos y productos descartables como son vasos, platos y servilletas, en un mercado D. Chosica con la ayuda D. uno D. sus hijos y D. su esposo.  Comenzó este negocio hace 18 años juntamente con su esposo ahora con su esfuerzo día a día desea brindar lo mejor a sus 2 hijos. El grupo tiene alrededor D. 2 años trabajando con Edaprospo, en el cual demuestran responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Norma is one of our members. Many years ago she opened a printing business. She runs it very carefully with a great deal of dedication. She makes tickets, bills, and cards for all occasions. She makes all the documents that are requested. She is married and has six children, who help her get ahead. Norma’s goal is for her children to become professionals. She feels that she is making that a reality because one of her daughters is in the university. Norma is happy, and she has a great desire to support her group. Gloria sells condiments and disposable products like glasses, plates, and napkins. She sells, with help from one of her children and her husband, in the Chosica market. She and her husband started this business 18 years ago. Now, with her daily effort, she wishes to give her two children the best. The group has been working with Edaprospo for approximately two years. During that time they have been very responsible with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products and supplies

loans.name: Luis Emilio

texts.es: El señor Luis Emilio, es casado y tiene dos hijos con edades de entre 16 y 18 años de edad. El señor Luis se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, principalmente perfumes, los cuales distribuye de manera ambulante. El ya tiene 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual empezó debido a la falta de empleo que tiene el país. El trabaja en compañía de su esposa, es decir ella le ayuda en la distribución de los productos. El señor desea invertir este crédito en la compra de más mercaderías, esto con el objetivo de vender más ahora que se acerca la fecha especial del día de las madres. Un reto que se le acerca al señor es en invierno, ya que las ventas para este periodo bajan considerablemente. El señor tiene el sueño de obtener más ganancias para así ampliar su tramo, el cual está localizado en el mercado.
texts.en:
Luis Emilio is married with two children between 16 and 18 years of age. Luis sells cosmetics, mostly perfumes, which he distributes as a street vendor. He has 20 years of experience in this activity, which he began due to the lack of work in his country. His spouse accompanies him, helping with the distribution of the products. Luis wants to invest this loan in more merchandise with the goal of selling more now that it is close to the special date for Mother’s Day. One challenge for Luis is that sales decrease considerably during the winter. Luis dreams of earning more income in order to expand his stand in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es entrenador de fútbol de las divisiones menores de el club Bolivar, y su esposa trabaja en la administración pública..
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para Salud (tratamiento médico de su hijo).
Es cliente antiguo en Impro, desde mayo del 2007, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Francisco is a soccer coach for the minor leagues of the club Bolivar. His wife works in public administration. His home is located in the Miraflores section of the city of La Paz. The loan would be destined for health care costs (medical treatments for his son). He is an old client of Impro’s, since May of 2007, and his history qualifies him as a top client. That is to say, he has complied with his past loan payments, allowing him access to this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for medical treatments for his son.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita O. is from the village of Brgy.Lantap,Bagabag,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 58 years old. Isabelita is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Isabelita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Isabelita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Isabelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isabelita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Isabelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Duncan Pempa

texts.en:
Duncan Pempa N. is 25 years old and married to Sayialel N.. He supports two people in his family. Duncan is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last three years.
