He learned about KADET through a friend who is a KADET registered client in his area of residence. This will be his first loan. He is planning to use 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) on harrowing, 20,000 KES on seeds and fertilizer and 10,000 KES on planting 10 acres of wheat.

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Duncan's dream is to do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To use on harrowing, seeds, fertilizer and planting wheat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cloth for sale

loans.name: Ilyas

texts.en:
The business activity from which Ilyas A. makes a living is the breeding of livestock. He started this business 9 years ago with a small number of livestock. As his business has developed, he has acquired greater quantities of animals for their eventual sale and he has gained from their derivatives. 

According to Ilyas, he works very hard so that he can take care of his children and his profit is 350-500 AZN. For that reason, he is always looking for a way to improve his family's living conditions. Currently, he needs a loan of 1000 AZN in order to purchase more cattle to later resell, after breeding them. This will allow him to fully meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase three cattle.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Florence has a business of a retail shop, which she has had for 3 years.  Florence also has a business of a pay phone and phone air time.

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase and stock sugar and maize flour.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Florence hopes to own a plot and a house. 

Florence is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by boosting her businesses.

loans.use: buying sugar and flour for retail shop

loans.name: Mar Azull Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama mar azul. Está ubicado en el Estado de Puebla, México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes y es la 1ra vez que solicita un crédito.

Norma rocío Gutiérrez T. es la presidente D. grupo. Tiene 33 años, estudió hasta el 6 semestre  de bachillerato, cuenta con un negocio de carpintería, tiene en total 2 hijos 1 mujer y 1varon.  Ella se dedica a elaborar artículos de madera y vende en diferentes poblaciones que inició hace 15 años. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada con muchas ganas de sobresalir.   Quiere este crédito para invertir más en su negocio en compra de madera de diferentes medidas.   También espera con este préstamo obtener mejores ganancias y así hacerse de más clientes para lograr una mejor vida.
texts.en:
This group is called “Mar Azul” (Blue Sea).  It is located in the Mexican state of Puebla.  It has 9 members and it’s its first loan request.

Norma Rocío Gutiérrez T., 33, is group President.  She finished 11th grade.  She has a carpentry shop.  She has two children, one boy and one girl.

She makes wood articles that she sells in various locations.  She started this business 15 years ago.

She feels excited when requesting the loan with lots of desire to stand out.  She wants the loan to invest more in the business buying wood in various sizes.  She also hopes the loan will help her obtain better profits and acquire more customers in order to attain a better life.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of wood to invest in her business.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila tiene 49 años, vive sola con su hijo en su casa propia. Hace más de 7 años se dedica a la venta de un plato típico muy conocido en su zona que se llama “tocosh”, que muchos de los pobladores de su ciudad lo conocen como una mazamorra de propiedades curativas y medicinales. Es así que Cirila se instala todos los días frente a un hospital a ofrecer este platillo, negocio que le ha resultado algo rentable pero suficiente para mantener a su hijo. En ocasiones no logra vender todo la preparación, pero sabe que debe continuar trabajando para poder vivir. Este trabajo le ha traído satisfacciones porque le permite tener sus propios ingresos además que es un trabajo que no requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico por lo que desea implementarse con mejores herramientas de trabajo. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, por lo que agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita, por que sabe que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más baldes y platos; asimismo ingredientes como papa y chuño.
texts.en:
Cirila is forty-nine, single, and lives in her own house with her son. For more than seven years she has earned her living selling a traditional dish, well-known in her region as "tocosh," that many of the residents of her city know as a corn soup with curative and medicinal properties. Cirila stations herself daily in front of a hospital offering her dish, a business that has proven somewhat profitable, but sufficient to support her son.  She occasionally doesn't manage to sell everything she's prepared, but she knows she should keep working so she can live. This work has brought her satisfaction because it permits her to have her own income, and it's a job that doesn't require a lot of physical effort.  She would like to set herself up with better supplies for her work.  

This is Cirila's first loan with MFP.  She really appreciates all the people who will make the loan she is seeking, because she knows that it will be extremely useful in advancing her business.  She plans to invest her loan in more buckets and plates, as well as ingredients like potatoes and potato flour.

loans.use: To buy buckets and plates, as well as potatoes and potato flour to prepare her corn soup.

loans.name: Mboudjecko

texts.en: Mboudjecko J. was born in 1978. He is married to Nyonga Odette and they are blessed with three children all below the age of 15 years old. He lives in a small house of three rooms with his family. He lives in Bali Park, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. J. has faced some challenges in life, amongst which are the inability to meet the basic necessities of his family, like clothing, feeding, transportation and educating himself and his children. He has faced difficulties in raising capital to start up a small business that will sustain him and his family. He plans to invest this loan in a gardening business. With this loan he is going to buy seedlings and farm products. He believes the business will succeed because the previous loan he took was repaid by the income raised from an old farm of his, therefore, he concludes that he is sure the business will succeed. He is certain that this business will succeed because the products he produces are highly demanded in the market. The loan will help his community because they will be able to afford all food ingredients at low or no cost. J. will plough back his profit into his business and use part to care for his family. He also will use the proceeds to pay his children’s school fees and cater to the family. He prefers GHAPE because of the training he frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase seedlings and renting a piece of land

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
el señor Luis Enrique P. F. esta casado con la señora Maria Mejia y viven en el barrio Suyapa de la ciudad de Nacaome, Luis se dedica al comercio cuenta con un negocio de pulperia desde ya hace 3 años,  su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion.
Luis es una persona muy trabajadora y es muy dedicado a su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia e invertirlo en su negocio y de esta manera poder incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis Enrique P. F. is married to Sra. Maria Mejia and they live in the Suyapa neighborhood of the city of Nacaome. Luis has a store that he has managed for three years out of his home. He is a hardworking person who is dedicated to his family.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise and invest in his business so that he can increase his sales and his income.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Zoraya

texts.es: La señora Zoraya C. Rodríguez tiene un restaurante en el norte de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Ella fue empleada durante varios años y al quedar sin empleo decidió crear su propio negocio. Aunque la señora Zoraya no tenía experiencia  en temas de culinaria, logró contratar a una experta cocinera que le enseñó todos los secretos del oficio. La mayoría de las ventas son de comidas corrientes a precios económicos por lo cual ha logrado conquistar una gran clientela formada principalmente por estudiantes universitarios y empleados de oficinas cercanas. La microempresaria considera que el éxito de su negocio se debe a la exquisitez de sus comidas, precios económicos y sobre todo al trato amable que le dispensa a todo el que la visita. Este es el sexto crédito que la señora Zoraya tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y el primer credikiva. Planea invertirlo en la compra de víveres y varias mesas y sillas plásticas. Siempre se ha destacado por su puntualidad en los pagos y mucho entusiasmo para participar en todas las actividades que organiza la Fundación. El restaurante vende en promedio 60 almuerzos diarios a $ 4.000 COP cada uno. El margen promedio de ganancia es del 41%. La señora Zoraya planea ampliar las ventas de platos especiales a empleados de oficinas cercanas con altos ingresos. Además de la usuaria, el negocio genera otros tres empleos directos a mujeres cabeza de hogar. La microempresaria se define como una mujer alegre que disfruta mucho su trabajo por el contacto diario con el público.
texts.en:
Zoraya C. Rodríguez has a restaurant in the north of the city of Barranquilla.  She worked for a company for several years but when she lost her job she decided to set up her own business.  Although she didn't have any experience in culinary matters, she managed to hire an expert cook who taught her all the secrets of the trade.  Most of her sales are of reasonably-priced fast food.  She has managed to attract a large customer base which is primarily made up of university students and people who work in nearby offices.  This small businesswoman considers that the success of her business is down to the excellence of her meals, her reasonable prices and above all the kind service which she gives everybody who visits her establishment.

This is Zoraya's sixth loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and her first Kiva loan.  She plans to invest it in buying supplies and a number of plastic tables and chairs.  She has always stood out because of the punctuality of her loan repayments and the enthusiasm which she has for taking part in all the activities which Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organizes.

Zoraya's restaurant sells on average 60 lunches a day at 4,000 Colombian pesos each.  Her average profit margin is 41%.  Zoraya plans to expand her sales of special dishes to nearby office workers with high incomes.  As well as employing its owner, her business has also created jobs for three women who are heads of their families.  Zoraya describes herself as a happy woman who really enjoys her work because she has daily contact with the public.

loans.use: To buy food supplies and several plastic tables and chairs

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama "Mujeres Unidas" porque nos platican que en temporada de la cosecha van todas las mujeres unidas a sus parcelas a cortar sus limones. Esta ubicado en la comunidad de Paso Rincón, San Juan bautista Tuxtepec en el estado de Oaxaca. El grupo esta conformado por 6 integrantes que se conocen por ser habitantes del mismo pueblo y cortan su limón en grupo. Este es su segundo préstamo con Fundación Realidad. La representante del grupo se llama Leonarda P. F. tiene la edad de 66 años ella solo estudio hasta el primer año de primaria y tubo una hija a la cual llama rosa, su hija ya es casada. Doña "Leo" como la llaman en su comunidad tiene un pequeño molino de maíz(en el cual van a moler todas las mujeres del pueblo su maíz para hacer sus tortillas) y una pequeña parcela en la que siembra limón y ella necesita el préstamo para comprar algunos fertilizantes y abonos para su sembradío,también algunos costales de maíz para vender en su molino, doña "Leo" se despierta todos los días a las 5:00 AM para abrir su molino y molerle su maíz a sus clientas su molino se ubica en su hogar, ella espera en un futuro comprarse un molino nuevo ya que el que tiene en ocasiones falla. La señora Leonarda es una señora muy alegre y con muchas ganas de trabajar. La señora Angelina P. O. también es integrante del grupo Mujeres Unidas. Ella tiene 67 años. Ella solo estudio hasta el tercer año de primaria. Doña Angelina solo vive con su nieto de 10 años, el estudia el quinto año de primaria. Ella se dedica a la siembra, cultivo y venta del limón y necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para su sembradío, doña Gela (como la llaman sus amigas) nos platica que en diciembre es cuando mas ganancia le deja el limón debido a que por el frió el limón se escasea, su parcela se encuentra a 200 metros de su casa. Ella desea que en un futuro su nieto pueda ir a la universidad y sea un gran ingeniero. Las otras 4 integrantes se llaman: Rosa Elvira M. P., Nelly Marisol M. A., Rosa R. P. se dedican al cultivo de limón ellas desean el préstamo para invertirlo en fertilizantes y abonos y Denis Carvajal M. que vende perfumes por catalogo de casa en casa necesita el préstamo para comprar sus perfumes.
texts.en:
This group is called “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women).  They tell us that this is because during harvest time all the women go to their fields to pick lemons together.  It is located in the community of Paso Rincón, San Juan Bautista Tuxtepec, in the state of Oaxaca.  It has 6 members who know each other because they all live in the same town and pick lemons together.  This is their 2nd loan with Fundación Realidad.  

The group representative is Leonarda P. F., 66.  She only finished first grade.  She has a daughter, Rosa, who is already married.  Doña “Leo,” as she’s known in her community has a small corn mill that all the women in her community come to use to grind corn to make tortillas and a small plot of land that she grows lemons on.  She needs the loan to buy fertilizers and manure for her crops.  She also needs a few sacks of corn to sell at the mill.

Doña “Leo” wakes up every day at 5am to open the mill and grind corn for her customers.  The mill is located in her house.  She hopes in the future to buy a new mill because the one she has breaks down sometimes.  Leonarda is a very cheerful woman who very much wants to work.

Mrs. Angelina P. O., 67, is another member of the Mujeres Unidas group.  She only got to third grade.  Angelina lives just with her 10 year old grandson who is in fifth grade.  She is a lemon farmer and needs the loan to buy fertilizers and manure for her crops.

Doña “Gela,” as she’s called by her friends, tells us that December is the month when profits from the lemons are highest because lemons are scarce then due to the cold.  Her farm plot is 200 meters from her house.  She hopes that her grandson will be able to go to the university in the future to become a great engineer.

The other four members are: Rosa Elvira M. P., Nelly Marisol M. A., Rosa Ramírez P. who are all lemon farmers and need the loan to buy fertilizers and manure and Denis Carvajal Martínez who sells perfume via catalogue door to door and needs the loan to buy perfumes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and manure for lemon crops, to buy corn and to buy perfumes to sell via catalogue.

location.town: Paso Rincon, San Juan Bautista Tuxtepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Sewing clothes is the main part of 48-year-old Kim T.'s daily routine. Kim T. provides her service to her neighbors, sewing both traditional and modern clothes. She runs her business very well, and a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides. 

Kim T. is married to Song Sing, 53, a construction foreman, and they have four children. One of their daughters is employed in a garment factory as an internal staff, while the other three are single and are studying in school. 

Kim T. is concerned that her daughter is facing difficulties travelling to her workplace. She travels to work by hiring a taxi or by walking because she doesn't have her own vehicle. To encourage her daughter, Kim T. has requested a loan in the amount of $1100 to to buy a new motorcycle for her daughter to travel to work.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle to travel to work

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es: Leonel tiene 56 años, su actividad es la elaboración de cuarterones. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio este negocio en su casa de habitación con el paso del tiempo es que el fue adquiriendo experiencia con este medio de vida. El siempre está buscando la forma de cómo ganarse la vida ya que todos los días tiene que trabajar bajo el sol para poder hacer sus cuartos. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando y obtener más clientes. el financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de herramientas, materiales, cementos, ladrillos entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Leonel is 56 years old and he makes bricks.  Some 12 years ago he didn't have this business.  He began the business in his residence.  With the passage of time, he gained experience in this way of life. 

Leonel is always looking for ways to earn his living, since every day he must work under the sun to be able to make his bricks.  In the future,  he wants to continue his work and to obtain more customers.  The financing he solicits is for buying  tools, material, cement, and floor tiles, among other things.

loans.use: BUYING TOOLS, MATERIAL, CEMENT, AND FLOOR TILES FOR HIS BRICK-MAKING BUSINESS

loans.name: Carla Vanessa

texts.es: Carla Vanessa tiene la edad de 35 años, sus propósitos son superarse en la vida para salir adelante con su negocio ya que es lo que mas importante para seguir generando a su familia el sustento diario. Su actividad económica es la brindar el servicio de bar y comedor, por lo que tiene que levantarse temprano para limpiar, realizar las compras y en la elaboración de sus deliciosos platillos. Hace más de  12 años, inicia este negocio por la necesidad de buscar un trabajo es que decide establecer un pequeño negocio al principio no poseía la experiencia necesaria para con este negocio, pero con el paso del tiempo fue adquiriendo la habilidad para hablar con sus clientes. El financiamiento es para granos básicos, frutas, verduras, platos desechables y cubiertos.
texts.en: Carla Vanessa is 35 years old and her goal is to improve herself in order to make her business a success. The most important thing is to keep generating an income for the daily support of her family. She has a restaurant bar. She starts her day very early to clean up, to make her purchases, and to make her delicious recipes. She started her business more than 12 years ago and she started out for the need to find work. She decided to establish a small business of her own. She didn't have the experience she needed with the business but with time she acquired the ability to chat with her clients. Her loan will be used to purchase basic grains, fruits, vegetables, and disposable plates and cutlery.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is too young for school. She owns a house that is without both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
Mwanamisi has operated a vegetable selling business for the past two years, selling from home to neighbors and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of competition from other vegetable stall operators. She hopes to establish a reliable business in the future. With this 20,000 KES loan, Mwanamisi wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables for resale

loans.name: Mpara Abagamba Kamu Traders Group B-Mubende

texts.en: Anges K. is 41 years old and makes a living selling clothes in her town, Mpara-Mubende. She has been in business for the last 15 years, and she and her husband work hard to support their six children. Agnes also earns additional income by working as a farmer. She earns about 400,000 shillings a month and will use this loan to buy more bales of clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.use: The buy of more bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita B. is from Guba Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old and married, with two school-aged children and one infant child. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products to her neighbors and passersby. She has been engaged in this business for almost five years and earns approximately $350 a month.
 
In April 2005, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living conditions and to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC with a good record of repayment. 

Lolita is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 45,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standards of her family.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Dora Alejandra

texts.es: Dora nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 35 años de edad, ella tiene su pareja y tienen dos hijos, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco (Capital Arqueológica de América) y se dedica a la vende de pasamanería pues tiene un puesto de venta en la calle Trinitarias. Ya son 15 años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Dora pertenece al banco comunal “Conzume III” de la Asociación Arariwa y ya son varias veces que se presta crédito de la institución pero en esta oportunidad Dora requiere el préstamo para el aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar mercadería como por ejemplo jaboncillos, pasadores, cepillos, betunes y otras cosas más.
texts.en: Dora was born in the city of Cusco and is 35 years old.  She lives with her partner and two children.  She lives in Cusco (Architectural capital of the Americas) and she sells miscellaneous goods from stand on Trinitarias street.  She has done this for 15 years and it has gone very well because of the effort she puts into her work.  Dora belongs to the communal bank “Consume III” of the Arariwa Association.  She has requested several loans from this institution.  This time, Dora is requesting a loan to increase her business capital as she wishes to buy merchandise such as, soap, hair pins, brushes, shoe polish and other items.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as soap, hair pins, brushes, shoe polish and other items.

loans.name: El Milagro Oli Group

texts.es: LA SEÑORA CARMEN C. Q. ES MIEMBRO DEL GRUPO "EL MILAGRO OLI". ELLA VIVE EN EL ESTADO DE MEXICO, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA Y PIDIO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN MÁS ROPA DE VARIEDAD, DE UNA MEJOR CALIDAD Y DE GRAN VARIEDAD PARA EL GUSTO DE TODAS SUS CLINTAS. SE SIENTE CONTENTA YA QUE GRACIAS A ESTA OPORTUNIDAD LOGRARA AMPLIAR SU NUMERO DE CLIENTES, YA QUE EN LA ZONA DONDE ELLA RADICA NO HAY MUCHA GENTE QUE SE DEDIQUE A ESTE NEGOCIO. ELLA DESEA QUE CON LAS GANANCIAS PUEDA MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE SU FAMILIA Y ASI MISMO SEGUIRA TRABAJANDO COMO HASTA EL DIA DE HOY PARA SEGUIR HACIENDO CRECER SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Carmen C. Q. is a member of the group El Milagro Oli.  She lives in the state of Mexico.  

She works selling clothing and is asking for this loan to purchase a larger variety of good quality clothing so that she has a variety of clothing to satisfying all of her customers.  She is happy that thanks to this opportunity she will be able to expand her number of customers since there are not many people selling clothing in her area.  

She hopes that she can improve her family's quality of life with her income and continue working like she is today to make her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for her business.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Simona, de 43 años, es una mujer laboriosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Frans de 42 años y sus 05 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindar una buena educación. El trabajo que realiza Simona es labrar la tierra donde cultiva cacao y café, esta labor la realiza junto a su esposo, quien también trabaja arduamente para obtener ingresos para su familia. Ella ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores precios obtiene por sus granos de cacao y café. Cuando su trabajo se le acumula no duda en contratar jornaleros para que tenga mas avance en cuanto a su faena. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que amenazan su productividad, ya que esto reduciría sus ganancias, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador desde su chacra hasta su comunidad, lugar donde realiza el secado respectivo de sus productos. Más adelante espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su 11avo préstamo de Simona con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con el crédito solicitado comprará semillas, abono y fertilizantes, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en: Simona is 43 years old and is a hardworking woman.  She lives with her 42-year-old husband Frans and five young children, for whom she wants to provide a good education, in a house that they own.  Simona works the land, growing cacao and coffee along with her husband, who also works hard to earn a living for his family.  It is convenient for her to bring her products to the city of San Francisco, which she says is where she sells her cacao and coffee grains at the best prices.  When there is a lot of work, she doesn’t hesitate in hiring workers to get it done quicker.  What she likes most about her job is preventing her crops from having pests that threaten their productivity, as this would reduce her earnings.  She has been working in this area for 15 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products, as it is a long and tiring journey from her farmland to her community, where she then dries her products.  In the future, she hopes to buy new lands to increase the number of crops.  This is Simona’s eleventh loan with MFP and she expects to make her payments on time, as she does not want to cause problems for her communal bank, where she is very happy.  With the loan requested, she will purchase seeds, manure and fertilizers to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy coffee and cacao seeds, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
La señora Florinda es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 69 años de edad, está casada  y tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad.
Lleva 15 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y ha estado invirtiendo en una ganadería, negocio que es de su familia.
El trabajo más pesado lo realiza su esposo, quien se dedica exclusivamente al cuidado de los animales.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará 3 rollos de alambre de púa, 5 sacos de sal, 1 ternerita.
El negocio de la carne y leche, es rentable porque de ahí pueden hacer los derivados, que son muy comerciales. A pesar de sus años sigue trabajando y lo hará hasta que tengas fuerzas para hacerlo.
Florinda manifiesta que seguirá con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos para poder hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Florinda is a member of the Communal Bank “El Arenal” which is located in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 69 years old, married, and has five adult children.

Florinda has worked with the loans from Manuela Ramos for 15 years and has invested in a livestock business that is owned by her family. The most difficult work is done by her husband while she spends her time exclusively taking care of the animals.

With this new loan of 3000 PEN, Florinda will buy three rolls of barbed wire, five bags of salt, and one calf. Her business of selling meat and milk, products that come from her animals, is profitable because these items are valued in the commercial market. Despite her age, Florinda will continue to work as long as she has the strength. She says that she will continue to utilize the loans from Manuela Ramos in order to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase barbed wire, bags of salt, and a calf.

loans.name: Carmen Guadalupe

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

La señora Carmen es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y los intereses son mucho más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad y estudian en universidad. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el mismo que se dedica a la compra y venta de arroz, polvillo y arrocillo, los mismos que los compra en una piladora en Charapoto y luego lleva a entregar  por quintales a otras ciudades y en su localidad,  también se dedica al cultivo de este producto, trabaja de lunes a viernes tanto en sus cultivos como en sus ventas, sus  productos los deja a crédito hasta un mes de plazo y cobra de acuerdo a como lo prefieran sus clientes.  Nos cuenta que su esposo lleva en esta actividad ya por más de 15  años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz, polvillo e insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos.

 Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales
texts.en:
The members of the “Crucita” communal bank meet in Portoviejo Canton’s Crucita Parish.  This location is known for the beautiful beaches that surround it that are very popular with national and foreign tourists.  It is called “Crucita la Bella” (Crucita the Beautiful).

Carmen is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are quick and interest rates are much lower than at other credit institutions.  She’s 46 years old, married and has three children, all adults going to the university.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is taking out the loan for her husband’s business.  He is a rice and rice byproducts merchant.  He buys them from a mill in Charapoto and then sells them by the quintal in other cities and in his location.  He also farms rice.  He works from Monday through Friday both on his crops and in his sales.  Sales are on credit with up to a month to pay; he collects payment according to customer preferences.  She tells us that her husband has been in this business for over 15 years now and has always done well.

This loan is to buy rice, rice flour and farming supplies for the crops.  Her dream is that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen was born in 1979.  He lives in Sevkar village, Tavush marz, with his parents, his wife, and his three children: two daughters and a son.
Since 1985 Karen’s family has engaged in stock-raising, bee-keeping and land cultivation. With the profits from farming they supported their family, bought furniture and constructed a new cow-house. 

Also Karen is also involved in charcoal production, which is allowing him to increase his family income.  This is Karen’s second loan from Nor Horizon and Kiva and now he is asking for a 700.000 AMD to buy some calves for his farm and also fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy some calves for his farm and also fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Maina

texts.en:
Maina is 26 years old. He is married and supports three people.

He is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last three years. He learned about KADET from credit officers. This will be his first loan which he is planning to spend to purchase farm inputs.

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

His  dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.es:
La señora Silvina, tiene 38 años de edad, su pareja desde hace tiempo es señor Lorenzo, con quien tiene 2 hijos pequeños. Ellos viven en su casa propia que está situada en la ciudad de Encarnación.
La señora Silvina es comerciante desde hace varios años, ella se dedica a la venta de mercaderías de varios tipos tales como: colchas, sabanas y otros;  tiene mucha clientela en la zona de Encarnación, ya que a muchos de sus clientes les distribuye por pedido. Su esposo, que también es comerciante, la ayuda en las ventas. Gracias a estas actividades ellos han podido educar a sus hijos, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier imprevisto que se le presente.
Ella solicitada el crédito para la compra de más mercaderías, tales como colchas, sabanas, frazadas y demás, ya que tiene pedidos de sus clientes los cuales le gustaría cumplir.
texts.en:
Silvina, 38, has a longtime partner, Lorenzo, with whom she has two small children.  They live in their own house located in the city of Encarnacion.

Silvina has worked in retail trade for a number of years.  She sells a variety of merchandise such as: bedspreads, bed sheets and other items.  She has a lot of customers in the area of Encarnacion, and for many of them she delivers merchandise that they have ordered in advance. Her husband, who is also a merchant, helps her with her sales.  Thanks to these activities they have been able to educate their children, maintain their home and cover any unexpected expenses.

Silvina requests a loan to buy more merchandise such as bedspreads, bed sheets, blankets and other items, since she has orders from her customers that she would like to fill.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, bed sheets, blankets and other items

loans.name: Yuridia

texts.es:
La señora Yuridia estudio hasta la primaria terminada, tiene cuatro hijos tres mujeres y un varón .Ella se dedica a la venta de pasteles y necesita el préstamo  para comprar mas material, ya que sus clientes le piden pasteles enteros y grandes pero no los hace por falta de material.
Tiene tres años vendiendo pasteles, antes de vender pasteles se dedicaba a vender tamales, es una señora muy trabajadora que le gusta salir adelante para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
Sus clientes  la recomiendan que ponga un local  para que venda  bien los pasteles ya que los hace muy ricos, por esa razón le encargan mucho para las bodas, pero en ocasiones no los hace por la falta de insumos.
Esta muy contenta porque con el apoyo de fundación realidad va a comprar lo que le hace falta y con sus  ahorros va a poner su local.
Uno de sus sueño es tener una  pastelería  y obtener buenas ganancias para ayudar a sus hijos  para que terminen sus estudios.
Le da las gracias a Fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sra. Yuridia completed her elementary school education. She has four children, three daughters and a son. Yuridia sells pastries and needs a loan to buy more supplies. Her customers request entire pies and large pastries, but she lacks the necessary materials.

Yuridia has been selling pastries for three years. She previously sold tamales. Yuridia is a hardworking woman who enjoys getting ahead so that she can provide a better quality of life for her children. Her customers recommended that she open a shop so that she could sell most pastries since they are quite delicious. For this reason, she charges more for weddings, but on occasion she will run out of supplies.

Yuridia is very pleased because the support from Fundación Realidad enables her to buy what she is lacking. With her savings, she was able to open a shop. One of her dreams is to have a formal pastry business so that she can generate good earnings to help her children finish their education. She thanks Fundación Realidad for the support it has given her so that she can move forward and fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making pastries such as flour, eggs, milk, whipping cream, and other items.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and has two children.

Imad has been an owner of a workshop since 2003. He makes tombs. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $1000 loan to purchase a stone cleaning machine. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a stone cleaning machine.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old single man who lives in Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip, located in Palestine. Mohammad is a Palestinian National Authority employee with decent salary. He will get married soon, and because his salary is not enough to pay for wedding expenses such as purchasing home furniture and appliances, he is in need of a loan in the amount of $1,000 from FATEN.

When Mohammad gets the FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to pay easily for wedding expenses and live his coming life in better home conditions.

Mohammad is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture and appliances for his wedding.

loans.name: Elizabeth Maria

texts.es: Elizabeth de 55 años vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 14 años principal motor de su vida. Hace 20 años llegó desde hace 20 años a la Ciudad amurallada: Cartagena de Indias, en busca de un mejor futuro, especialmente con muchos deseos de estudiar  ser una profesional, pero como fue difícil ingresar a la universidad, sus amigos le recomendaron capacitarse en confecciones y hoy felizmente puede decir que con su decisión de superarse ha logrado su experiencia emprendedora e independiente y la generación de ingresos autónomos para atender  los gastos de su hogar. En la actualidad Elizabeth está vendiendo también mercancía variada, mediante guías especializadas de productos y aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas como telas y accesorios, así como también mercancías que han solicitado sus clientes, a propósito del mes del amor y la amistad que trae consigo el incremento de sus ventas. Su meta es capitalizarse y lograr puntos de exhibición de sus productos, para el crecimiento de “Confecciones María José” y este es justamente su gran desafío.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old and lives with her husband and 14-year-old son, who serve as her primary motivation in life. Twenty years ago, she arrived in Cartagena de Indias from the city of Amurallada in search of a better future. Elizabeth wanted so much to study in order to become a professional, but she had difficulty gaining admission into the university. Her friends recommended that she learn how to sew and now she says that she is happy that she made that decision. Elizabeth has excelled because the experience she has gained as an independent entrepreneur allows her to generate her own income for covering the household expenses. At the moment, Elizabeth also sells a variety of merchandise through specialized catalogs. For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan.

This is her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Elizabeth will buy raw materials, such as fabrics and accessories, as well as products that have been ordered by her customers. The month of love and friendship (the Colombian equivalent to Valentine’s Day) is approaching and will bring an increase in her sales. Her goal is to acquire more capital and secure more places to display her products so that her business, “Confecciones María José”, can grow. This will be her greatest challenge.

loans.use: to purchase materials and accessories for sewing as well as products that have been ordered by her customers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married and has two children.
Ali has owned a shop where he sells and repairs cars batteries since 2006. He inherited his business from his father so he has good experience and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.
Ali is requesting a loan of $2800 in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to earn more profits so he can add more items to his business as spare parts and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 26 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She has a business selling groundnut paste in Buluk branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Lilian requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnut paste to sell

loans.name: United Traders Association Group

texts.en:
Maseray is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Kambia, a town in northern Sierra Leone, about 37 years ago. Maseray is married to a driver, and the couple has three children. For many years now, Maseray has been selling fish.

This is the first loan that Maseray and her group members have applied for from SMT and the Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Maseray will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to expand her business. She will buy fish wholesale to add to her current stock of fish.

loans.use: to buy fish wholesale to add to her current stock of fish.

loans.name: Manuela Del Socorro

texts.es: Manuela Del Socorro tiene 61 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Manuela es una señora muy responsable ella disfruta de realizar esta actividad. Ella tiene más de 33 años con este negocio, el arduo trabajo constante tiene 2 hijos menores de edad bajo su cargo. Trabaja para sus gastos personales y también ayuda con los gastos del hogar, con el objetivo de comprar granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, jugos entre otros productos. Este es su sexto crédito que realiza para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en: Manuela Del Socorro, 61, has a grocery store.  Manuela is a very responsible woman who enjoys doing her work.  She’s had the store for over 33 years.  It is constant hard work.  She has two minors in her care.  She works for her personal expenses and also to help cover household expenses.  Her goal is to buy basic grains, snacks, soft-drinks, bread, detergent and fruit juice, among other products.  This is the sixth loan that she’s used to buy raw materials.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for he store.

loans.name: Lena

texts.es:
Lena sigue participando en uno de los bancos comunales de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Lena sigue dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza mediante catálogos. 

Lena con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

Lena requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercedaria como por ejemplo perfumes, anillos, lápiz labial y otras cosas más. 

Lena se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lena continues as a member of one of Asociación Arariwa's community banks, in Cusco.  She continues selling beauty products through catalogs.

Lena's previous loan went very well and she was able to make good profits.  For this reason, she would like another loan as they help her a lot.

Lena needs this loan to buy more merchandise such as perfumes, rings, lipsticks, etc.

Lena is grateful for the opportunity that she is being given and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as perfumes, rings, lipsticks, etc.

loans.name: Kalima

texts.ru:
Калиме 53 года, замужем, имеет два сына, один из которых школьник. На протяжении 20 лет Калима занимается  животноводством – разведением и откормом скота, ежегодно обрабатывает 1,5 га земли с кукурузой,  занимается этим бизнесом вместе с любимым мужем (на фото), который является ее опорой и поддержкой в любых начинаниях. На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Калимы  имеется 2 коровы, 10 овец , имеются все необходимые условия для содержания скота. Также дополнительным источником дохода для семьи является торговля  продуктами питания.
В целях увеличения поголовья скота, Калима обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец. Доходы от кредита семья планирует вложить в покупку участка земли под строительство еще одного сарая для содержания скота.
texts.en:
Kalima is 53 years old, she is married and has two sons one of whom is going to school. During the last 20 years Kalima has been doing animal husbandry – breeding and feeding cattle. Each year she plows 1.5 hectares of land with corn and has been in this business with her beloved husband (on the photo) who is her support in any undertakings. At this time Kalima has two cows and ten sheep in her household and she has all the necessary conditions for keeping the cattle. Also as an additional source of income for the family they sell food products.

With the purpose of increasing the headcount of cattle Kalima has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy calves and sheep. The family plans to use the profit from the loan to buy a parcel of land to build one more shed for the cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Jose De Jesus

texts.es: José de Jesús es un joven y a pesar de su corta edad es muy responsable que ayuda a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. Para el es muy importante apoyar a sus padres con las mejoras de la casa ya que le traen buenos recuerdos ya que en ese lugar fue donde creció y tuvo un techo donde refugiarse. El calor de hogar que tuvo con su familia no se compara con el agradecimiento que le tiene a sus padres y quiere darles algo de lo que ellos le ofrecieron. En este momento quiere terminar de levantar una barda que inicio su padre pero por falta de dinero no ha podido terminar su proyecto, por lo cual el solicita un préstamo para comprar material como cemento, arena, blokcs y paga mano de obra de esta manera obtendrán mayor seguridad.
texts.en: José de Jesús is a young man, and despite his young age he is very responsible in helping his parents with their household expenses.  He considers it very important to help his parents with home improvements, and doing so brings back good memories, since their house is the one in which he grew up.  José de Jesús is very grateful to his parents for all they have provided him, and he wants to give them something in return.  At this time he wants to finish building a wall that his father had started, but which his father was unable to finish because he lacked the money.  That is why José de Jesús is asking for a loan: to purchase materials such as cement, sand, and blocks, and also to hire workmen for the project.  The wall will provide the family with more security.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a wall.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
Mario Alberto tiene 27 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a la pareja tiene 1 hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo de 2 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.
La VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El caimito, Perteneciente a la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo Corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul.
Mario se dedica a la Agricultura siembra de maíz, arroz, cacao hace 10 años.
Las compra y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para poder trabajar en la agricultura, comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, abonos. Con el dinero del crédito podrá adquirir los abonos sin ningún tipo de problema porque contara con dinero en efectivo.
El sueño es poder comprarse una finca. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.

Con la ayuda del prédtamo ANTERIOR ha podido invertir en la agricultura, la producción ha aumentado, en la familia la relación ha mejorado, los ingresos han ido aumentando a medida de culktivar y venderlos a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Mario Alberto is 27 years old. He lives in consensual union with his partner and together they have a child. He lives with his wife and the 2 year old child in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank Jerusalen is located in district of Caimito, belonging to the parish Puerto Pechiche, in the canton of Puebloviejo. This is an area of agricultural activities planting short cycle crops such as corn, rice, and pigeon peas. 

Mario has been working in agriculture for ten years planting corn, rice, and cocoa.

He is asking for a loan in order to work in agriculture, buying seeds, fertilizers, urea, and compost. With the money from the loan he will buy the compost because there are no problems when paying with cash.

His dream is to be able to buy a farm. He has not been presented with any problems. In his free time he enjoys playing sports.

With the money from a previous loan he has invested in agriculture, has expanded his crops, and the well being of his family has improved. The profit has been increasing due to his method of cultivation and sales at a good price.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, and compost in order to be able to do his agricultural work

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es: Diana de 25 años es casada tiene 2 hijos uno de 9 años y otro de 7 años  vive en una casa de interés social y se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, artículos para el hogar y juguetes usados esta es la fuente de ingresos con la que ella puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ella vende sus productos en diferentes colonias donde se reúnen varios comerciantes y exhiben sus productos para vender. Diana es una mujer muy emprendedora y requiere comprar juguetes y ropa de temporada como pants, chaquetas, tenis, sudaderas para esta temporada navideña y de invierno y así poder incrementar sus ventas y obtener un ingreso mayor para ella y su familia.
texts.en: Diana is twenty-five years old, married with two children, ages nine and seven, and lives in a house in a low-income community. She sells used clothes, shoes, items to be used in the home, and toys. Through this source of income she is able to help her husband cover living costs. She sells her products in different neighborhoods where retailers meet and offer their wares. Diana is a very enterprising woman and needs to purchase toys and seasonal clothing such as pants, jackets, tennis shoes, and sweaters for winter and the Christmas season. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales and earn more income for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el mismo corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Marina;  La socia tiene 42 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 19, 8 años de edad, la socia trabaja vendiendo pasamanería, la socia trae mercadería de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia vende en un stand del mercado, ella vende todo lo referente  a ligas, pinzas, cremitas como vaselinas, escobillas para zapatos, pasadores, espejos, ganchitos, lejía, detergentes, bolsas entre otros. La socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de pasamanería y poder implementar su mercadería.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Marina belongs to the "José Carlos Mariáteguí" communal bank, located in the very heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department. She lives with her partner and has two children, ages 19 and 8. 

She works selling notions. She brings merchandise from the city of Cusco, and sells it at a stand in the market. She sells a wide variety of goods, including pony tail holders, tweezers, creams such as vaselines, shoe brushes, mirrors, hooks, bleach, detergents, bags, and other items. 

She wishes to use the loan to buy notions and to stock up on merchandise. The borrower is thankful for the loan, and promises to make her instalment payments in accordance with the loan schedule.

loans.use: To buy notions, and to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Liliana Carolina

texts.es:
Lilian, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y tamales, vive con sus tres hijos, ella recibe ingresos únicamente de las ventas que realiza, las cuales son los días sábado y domingos por la tarde, pero solo las pupusas, ya que los tamales los realiza en los días de semana.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, tomates, condimentos, aceite, para la elaboración de las pupusas y los tamales, con esta inversión espera mejorar el negocio y aumentar las ventas.
El objetivo y sueño de Lilian es poder obtener su propia casa, donde poder ofrecerles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en: Lilian lives with her three children. She sells pupusas and tamales and only receives income from sales made, which are Saturday and Sunday afternoons, but only the pupusas, since the tamales are made on weekdays. She requests a loan for the purchase of corn, tomatoes, spices, oil, to prepare the pupusas and tamales.  With this investment she hopes to improve business and increase sales. Lilian’s goal and dream is to get her own house, where she can offer her children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase corn, tomatoes, condiments, oil, pork, cheese.

loans.name: God Gee Women-I Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “God Gee Women I” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan which these entrepreneurs have accessed from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kumba, aged 33. She was born in the small town of Sandor in eastern Sierra Leone but currently lives in Koidu, together with her husband and five children. Her husband is a monthly salaried worker and their children are attending primary and secondary schools. For the past five years, Kumba has been a “cookery seller” (i.e. sells cooked rice with delicious sauce). 

With her share of this loan, Kumba is going to buy cooking ingredients like rice, palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), tomatoes, onions, pepper, fish, etc. in large quantities so she can cook a large quantity of rice and sauce for sale. (Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Edward, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy large quantities of ingredients like rice, palm oil, tomatoes, onions, pepper, fish, etc.

loans.name: Gabriela Martinez

texts.es: Gabriela de 55 años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia; Ella posee un chalet donde vende artículos de primera necesidad tiene varios años con el negocio, tiene mucha clientela porque vende productos de primera calidad a precios bajos, y es muy amable; ella quiere invertir en su negocio comprando mas productos para surtir su tienda por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar  granos básicos, golosinas, pan, huevos productos instantáneos, bebidas etc. ella es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gabriela is 55 years old and lives with her family in her own home. She has a stand where she sells essential items such as bread, beans, rice, milk, eggs, and lunch meat, among others. She has been in business several years and gained valuable experience that has allowed her to earn a higher profit. She has many customers because she sells quality products at low prices and she is very friendly. She wants to invest in her business, buying more products to supply her store. She is asking for a loan in order to buy basic grains, snacks, bread, eggs, instant products, drinks, etc. Gabriela has good payment references and is very responsible. She says that she can pay her debt and at the same time she hopes that this will allow her to be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, snacks, bread, eggs, instant products, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Hounsa Raphaël

texts.fr: Hounsa Raphaël âgé de 42 ans a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire, mais a appris la couture par la suite. Activité qu'il exerce depuis une quinzaine d'années dans son atelier sise à son domicile. Hounsa Raphaël est mariée à une marchande du nom de Marcelline et est père de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et a sa charge. Hounsa Raphaël vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Hounsa Raphaël achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle Hounsa Raphaël pour une cinquième fois sollicite, un crédit auprès de Alide. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des fournitures de coutures.

loans.name: Sonia Marina

texts.es: La Sra. Sonia, hace tortillas, vende gaseosas y productos lácteos, esta es la actividad comercial a la que se dedica y le permite mantener a sus hijos quienes están en edad escolar dos de ellos en la universidad, para Sonia es muy difícil mantener los estudios de sus hijos aunque recibe apoyo económico de su esposo, para eso se esfuerza bastante para mantener los ingreso del negocio. Este crédito que solicita es para invertir con más productos como quintales de maíz y comprara una cocina eco fogón para tener mejores condiciones de trabajo y así podrá realizar más tortillas para vender, esperando con esta inversión incrementar las ventas.

loans.use: La señora Sonia está intentando mejorar su economía invirtiendo en su negocio de venta de tortillas, para apoyar a sus hijos para que avancen con los estudios.

loans.name: Devotte

texts.en: Devotte is 30 years old, married with 3 children. She operates a retail shop for 2 years. She sold her land, and got capital to start off her current business this is because she could no longer handle being unemployed and a survivor. She is faced with a challenge of inadequate capital yet she has to care for her family using what she has. She now wants to construct a house to cut off the expenditure of renting. She requests for  a credit facility to buy timber and iron sheets for construction.

loans.use: to buy timber, and iron sheets for construction.

loans.name: Elsy Del Socorro

texts.en:
Elsy Chacon, her husband and two children live in Merida, Yucatan. Alberto Martinez, Elsy\\\'s husband, once worked in a tailor shop but it has already been 10 years since they have established their own business, with a modest capital and a simple sewing machine. With time and with the support of Admic and the loans provided to them, they were able to purchase four specialized sewing machines, and in doing so they have been able to give their two children the education they needed. With a strong entrepreneurial spirit Elsy and her husband, and now with the help of one of their sons, they have been able to realize their dreams, to have their own well-established tailoring shop.

Now they have a contract to produce uniforms for a large company, and in order to realize this contract they need a loan of $925, which will be paid within 6 months. Please support Elsy and her husband continue on with the progress they have achieved through their dedicated efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Elsy C., su esposo y sus dos hijos, viven en la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán. Alberto Martínez, esposo de Elsy, trabajó en una sastrería, pero hace 10 años emprendieron su propio pequeño taller, con un poco de capital y una máquina sencilla. Luego, con el paso de los años y con el apoyo de los prestamos recibidos por parte de Admic, pudieron comprar cuatro máquinas especializadas y así han logrado cubrir todas las necesidades y educación de sus hijos. El espíritu emprendedor y la entereza de Elsy y su esposo, así como el apoyo en el negocio de su hijo han hecho posible la cristalización de su sueño, su propio taller de sastrería.

Actualmente ellos tienen un pedido de uniformes para una empresa grande y para poder invertir en ello requieren un prestamo de $ 925.00 dólares, para ser cubierto en un plazo de 6 meses. Haz posible la continuación de lo que con tanto esfuerzo Elsy y su esposo ha construido, apóyalos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is married and has four children. One of his sons is in Secondary school. Hassan lives in the Buza area of Dar es Salaam. He runs a fruit and vegetable stall outside his house. He has been in this business for more than six years now. Hassan grows vegetable himself and sells them in his stall.

Hassan thanks all his lenders for his first loan with Kiva. The loan was of much help to him. He was able to a add stock of insecticides and buy a spraying pump. Hassan is now requesting a second loan with Kiva to strengthen his business. The loan will be used to add more fruits and vegetables, which he does not produce himself, and to start selling some staple food items like wheat flour, maize flour and rice. A loan of USD 550 will help him implement his plans.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes has a small business selling women’s accessories and shoes. She started with $100 of her savings and the support of her husband. She offers her products to locals and also sells door-to-door. She has started to explore the possibilities of selling new products such as toys and electronics. She is requesting a loan in order to continue testing the market and investing in the most popular products. She has four children, who are all studying. They live together in a house of wood that is slowly being converted to cement.

loans.use: to buy new products to sell

loans.name: Catalina Amparo

texts.en:
Catalina is a 41 year old, single mother of two. She has two sons: one has just started his college career at La Universidad Andina and he younger is attending high school at La Escuela Militar. A few years ago, Catalina was married and had a business with her husband. The business failed and they went bankrupt. Catalina’s husband left her and her two sons for a younger woman. Before coming to PRISMA, she would have described herself as depressed and agitated at life. She is now much more relaxed and happy. She currently has three jobs and is also attending school.

She has been working with Unique, a cosmetics and jewelry mail order company, for seven years now. Unique incentivizes sales by offering gifts for every goal the seller achieves. Catalina is such a good saleswoman that she is now receiving doubles of gifts. She largely purchases according to her orders, but will occasionally buy in bulk when there are special offers. She averages around 400 orders a month. Catalina has also been working with Herbalife selling protein shakes and other products. She has been with them for four months now and prefers their incentives which are often cash bonuses. She has also been working part-time at a local NGO as a secretary. Catalina hopes that with the $650 loan she will be able to purchase more goods at a lower cost and be able to sell in much larger quantities. By dealing in bulk Catalina has a chance to reach up to 75% commission as opposed to the current 25%.

loans.use: Purchase products in larger quantities to receive greater commission.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María B. is 34 years old, separated, and has an 8-year old daughter. They live in the house of María’s parents with her other siblings. María buys and sells merchandise such as clothing for women, men, and children; sports footwear, cellular phones and domestic electronics. She has a vehicle that she uses to transport and sell her merchandise throughout the neighborhoods and cities. María wishes to acquire more merchandise as she begins to expand and sell in new areas. Also with the new season approaching from spring to summer, she hopes to receive a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more merchandise at the best price.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María B. tiene 34 años, es separada y tiene una hija de 8 años, ellas viven en la casa paterna con varios otros hermanos. María se dedica a la compra y venta de artículos de mercería tales como ropas para damas, caballeros y niños; calzados deportivos, celulares e inclusive electrodomésticos; ella tiene un vehículo con el que sale a realizar ventas por los barrios y ciudades así como también las cobranzas diariamente. María desea adquirir mayor mercaderías ya que está abriendo nueva zona de ventas y por la nueva temporada primavera-verano, para ello solicita un crédito de $ 1000 con los que podrá comprar más y a mejor precio las mercaderías.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as tops, pants, shirts, shoes, sportswear, children clothing, etc.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Isabel Chale was born on March 4th, 1969 in Catembe a province of Maputo. She is 38 years old, married and mother of 5 children. She was raised by her uncles in Maputo where she studied until the 6th grade. After school she sold Badjías (a snack made of fried beans) to help her family. After she was done with school she continued to work with baking and selling bread. When she was 19 years old her husband started to sell fish. The business did not do well so he got a job with a company and worked in the Popular Market in Maputo for 6 years. When the company closed he started selling vegetables and other basic products in a stand.

She was introduced to Hluvuku by friends and requested her first loan with which she started building her business. She is building a mini market. Today she has 2 employees and supports 8 people. She buys her inventory from Maputo, rents a car then brings it back to her market. In the end of the month and summers she makes the most money averaging 10.000mt selling cereals, vegetables, oil and sugar. Her business is doing well and her income base is of 15.000mt a month. With this income she is improving her home and saving. With the loan of 60,000mt, Isabel improved the building of the store she is renting, in the future she wants to diversify her products and buy a bigger car to transport products. These loans have changed Isabel’s life and she is very enthusiastic about the future.

Translated from Portuguese Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização:Bairro Chalí, Catembe-Maputo Cliente: Isabel Chale Actividade: Comércio Valor de Empréstimo:60,000.00Mt ( 2.400usd) Aplicação: Compra de Produtos para revenda Início:21/08/2007 Fim:11/02/2009 Isabel Chale, nasceu aos 04 de Março de 1969 em Catembe na província de Maputo, tem 38 anos de idade , casada maritalmente tem 5 filhos estudou apenas até 6ªclasse devido a debilidade financeira dos seus progenitores. Passou uma parte da sua Infância com seus tios na capital ,Maputo durante 7 anos onde, depois da Escola dedicava se na venda de Badjías( produto feito com feijão que de seguida é frito e come -se com o pão) para ajudar nas despesas de casa . Algum tempo depois volta á catembe junto dos pais onde não continuando com os estudos , passou a dedicar se na venda de Pão. Aos 19 anos junta se com seu marido e muda de negócio passando a vender Peixe e porque o negócio não estava a correr bem , decide procurar emprego tendo conseguido na Feira Popular de Maputo onde trabalhou durante 6 anos. Momentos depois a Empresa veio a fechar e como solução imediata para garantir o sustento da família voltou ao mundo de negócio tendo arranjado uma banca e passou a vender hortículas e outros produtos da primeira necessidade. Conheceu a Hluvuku por meio de amigas e solicitou o primeiro empréstimo com o qual começou a erguer a sua infraestrutura comercial. Nao possui nenhuma formação do seu negócio, tendo ganho experiênça ao longo dos anos de trabalho , com os empréstimos seguintes transformou a sua barraca( infraestrutura comercial precario)em Mini mercearia e comprou uma viatura caixa aberta o qual lhe ajuda no transporte de mercadoria. Actualmente conta com uma Merceária que é propriedade sua e uma outra arendada. Vive actualmente com 8 pessoas na sua responsabilidade, e no seu negócio emprega duas pessoas uma das quais tem 2 filhos.

A sua actividade inicia as 8 horas e não precisa de transporte porque a mini mercearia localiza-se junto de casa e só para ir a outra é que tem se deslocado do carro próprio. A sua mercadoria adquiri do outro lado da baía, na cidade de Maputo onde tem alugado um carro para levar a mercadoria até na atravessia isso porque o seu carro é pequeno e não poderia transportar todos produtos duma só vez. Depois de atravessar a mercadoria, tem usado o seu transporte para a distribuicão pelas Mercearias. O melhor período no seu negócio é no fim do mês e no verão onde a receita diária chega a atingir 10.000,00mt e os produtos que mais vende são os cereiais , leguminosas , óleo ,vegetais ,e açúcar . Tem feito registos no seu negócio e a única dificuldade no seu negócio é no transporte de mercadoria uma vez a sua viatura é menor o que lhe obriga a ter que alugar outra . O seu negócio está tomando um rumo satisfatório e a sua margem de lucro mensal tem sido na ordem de 15,000.00mt e com este rendimento uma parte aplica na ampliação e melhoramento da sua casa , nas despesas domésticas e uma parte vai para a poupança. Com o presente crédito de 60,000.00mt aplicou no apetrechamento do estabelecimento que alugou junto á baía. E ,futuramente pretende diversificar o seu negócio abrindo uma ferragem e comprar uma viatura maior pelo que ainda recorrerá ao empréstimo. Este empréstimo e outros anteriores modificaram positivamente o seu negócio e a sua vida e está muito entusiasmada .

loans.use: To buy onother produts for retail

loans.name: Elen

texts.id:
Elem S. is a light Food and drinks seller, who offered them at her house on Drupadi street, Denpasar. Elem S. rented land, on which she and her husband build a very simple hut, where they live together. To help her husband to fulfill daily family expenses, Elem S. sells light food and drinks. With the capital obtained from Dinari, Ms. S. hopes to expand her business in selling food and drinks to fulfill daily family needs, and of course also to save for their future own home.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Elem S. adalah penjual makanan dan minuman ringan yang dijajakan dirumahnya di jalan Drupadi Denpasar. Elem S. mengontrak tanah yang kemudian dibangun rumah yang sangat sederhana untuk ditinggali bersama suaminya, dan untuk membantu suaminya dalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga mereka, Elem S. menjual makanan dan minuman ringan. Dengan mendapatkan modal yang diberikan oleh DINARI Elem S. berharap supaya bisa membantu mengembangkan usahanya dalam menjual makanan dan minuman guna memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya serta berusaha mengumpulkan uang untuk mendapatkan rumah sendiri tentunya.

loans.use:
To buy materials for Food making

Untuk membeli bahan makanan

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema, age 28, is married with 2 children (ages 8 and 3). She and her husband also take care of her 14 year old niece. They also financially support support her mother. In 2004, Neema started a tailoring business where she works from 7am to 6pm daily. In a month, she can make a profit of about $27.

Neema hopes for a loan to increase her services to her customers. She is a member of a loan group called Tujikomboe, totaling 30 members who keep each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase services to her customers

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a young entrepreneur and mother of three children who is fighting to lift her family out of poverty. A few months ago, she took an FSMA loan, and used it to open a small business selling fried bananas, potatoes, spicy pork sausage, and natural juices in the Mata San Juan community of Santo Domingo.

Susana explains that her business supports her children. She also explains that she has to increase her income to fend for her youngest son, born just two weeks ago.

With her second loan, Susana wants to buy raw materials and other goods to move her business forward. With this loan, the entrepreneur will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of raw materials and other goods for a small business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca Sagoh Warri is married with 6 children. She is 58 years old. She is from Delta State, Nigeria but resides in Benin City.

Rebecca buys timber and converts the timber to planks that she then sells. She studied the trade for a year and 5 months. She has been in the business since 2000. Rebecca needs the loan of $875 to buy more timber to convert to planks.

loans.use: To buy more timber for sale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a peasant farmer, a husband, and a father of two children. He is fifty-six years old and has been selling second-hand clothes for the past two years in his village. He farms in the morning and sells clothing in the afternoon.

Joseph wants to use his new loan to buy bails of second-hand clothes to sell. He can use the profit to save some money for his children’s education and also to register for National Health Insurance.

He is a member of the group called Tree of Life. The group members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

In the photo, Joseph had just returned from the farm.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo belongs to “Las Almendras” (The Almonds) community bank, located at 323 Jr. Manco Capac, in the district of Calleria, in Ucayali. She is 43 years old, has one children, she is separated. With the first S/. 300 loan from Manuela Ramos Consuelo decided to set up a small stand selling typical food.

She sells food outside her house every day; starting at 5 p.m. she fires up the charcoal and starts grilling bananas and meat that will later be consumed by clients that love her food.

With this S/. 1,000 loan, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy rice, eggs, sugar, oil, vegetables, spices, meat, etc.

Consuelo is very thankful with Manuela Ramos for providing support to all women, specially single moms, who look to provide for a better future to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Consuelo pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Almendras, ubicado en el Jr. Manco Capac 323, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años, tiene 1 hijo, es separada. Consuelo con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un pequeño puesto de venta de comidas típicas.

En la actualidad vende sus comidas en la puerta de su casa todos los días a partir de las 5 de la tarde atiza su carbón y empieza a asar sus plátanos y carnes que mas luego serán consumidos por sus clientes que gustan mucho de su rica comida.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: arroz, huevos, azúcar, aceite, verduras, condimentos, carnes, etc

Consuelo esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por brindar apoyo a todas las mujeres en especial a las madres solteras, que buscan darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to make food for sale

loans.name: Tuli Pelesasa's Group

texts.en:
This group from Fatausi contains of three women. This is their first loan cycle and they are asking for $750 each. This money will be used to start up or improve their businesses. Their husbands, children and other family members are really supportive of their efforts. They are from one village and they work together and support each other in their group. These are their first loans and if they do well then they will be eligible for more.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of chemicals, equipments and tools for the businesses

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Pham Thi H., 46 years old, currently lived with her daughter who is 25 years old. Before joining TYM, tH. family income was unstable as her husband passed away relatively young.
