In 1998, sH. joined TYM and used her first loan to collect and buy wasted materials and then resell them. With hard work and determination, after 10 years of joining TYM her family economy has been much more stable. SH. opened up a small store to sell miscellaneous goods. Now, sH. continues to buy and sell scrap while her daughter takes care of tH. store. Her family income is about 3 million VND. SH. would like to borrow 6 million VND this cycle to expand her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Hệ năm nay 46 tuối. Chị hiện có 1 con gái đã 25 tuổi. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị gặp mnhiều khó khăn do chồng chị không may mất sớm, con còn nhỏ. Năm 1998 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để đi thu mua phế liệu về bán cho các đại lý. Nhờ chăm chỉ làm ăn , qua 10 năm tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị hiện tại đã ổn định hơn. Chị đã tiết kiệm để nuôi con khôn lớn. Hiện nay gia đình chị đã có 1 cửa hàng tạp hoá nhỏ kinh doanh tại chợ. Hàng ngày chị đi thu mua phế liệu về bán còn con giá chị quản lý cửa hàng.Thu nhập của gia đình hiện tại khoảng 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Để đầu tư vốn cho cửa hàng tạp hoá chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000đ.

loans.use: Invest in grocery

loans.name: Ni Ketut Tari

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Tari has 2 married children, and her husband is a farmer. Although her children are married, she is still driven to expand her business. The $538 loan from DINARI will be used to fatten 2 pigs: $64.61 for buying the pigs, $215.35 for building pig pen, and the remaining for 5-month worth of pig food.

After finishing her chores everyday, Ni Ketut Tari tends her pigs. First, she cleans the pig pen. Then, she washes the pigs, and lastly, feeds them. She feeds the pigs twice a day (in the morning and evening) with a mix of rice padi chaff, wheat chaff and concentrates. She is planning to spend $161.51 for food during the next 5 months, and sell the pigs for $279.96. Thus, her net profit for 5 months will be $53.84. Her first loan will be used to build pig pen. After she pays off this loan, she is planning to buy a pig sow.

Translated by Joan, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Ketut Tari memiliki 2 orang anak dan semuanya sudah menikah.Walaupun semua anaknya sudah berumah tangga, tidak mengurangi semangatnya untuk berusaha. Suami Ni Ketut Tari seorang petani. Modal yang di dapat dari Dinari dipakai untuk memelihara 2 ekor babi penggemukan. Ni Ketut Tari memperoleh pinjaman sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,-. Modal yang dikeluarkan untuk membeli bibit babi sebesar Rp. 600.000,-. Untuk membuat kandang menghabiskan Rp. 2.000.000,- dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan selama 5 bulan. Setiap hari setelah selesai mengerjakan pekerjaan rumah, Ni Ketut Tari segera mengurus babinya. Pertama yang dilakukannya adalah membersihkan kandang, setelah itu memandikan dan terakhir memberi makan. Setiap hari Ni Ketut Tari memberi makan 2 kali setiap pagi dan sore hari. Adapun campuran pakannya : dedak padi, dedak gandum, dan konsentrat. Sampai panen menghabiskan pakan Rp.1.500.000,- Sedangkan penghasilan kotornya Rp. 2.600.000,- Jadi keuntungan bersih yang diterima Ni Ketut Tari selama 5 bulan Rp.500.000,- Pinjaman pertama ini difokuskan untuk membuat kandang dan kelengkapannya, setelah melunasi pinjaman ini, ia berencana untuk membeli induk babi.

loans.use: To build pig pen and buy pig food

loans.name: Yelba Rosa

texts.es: Yelba habita en el barrio 3-80, es casada y tiene 47 años de edad,  tiene un hijo de 16 años de edad, qué cursa la secundaria, su esposo es comerciante y conductor de taxi de su propiedad. El negocio de Yelba es la venta de nacatamales. Empezó vendiendo sopa los días domingos en su casa de habitación, pero decidió aprovechar el buen sazón que tiene y empezó también hace dos años las ventas de nacatamales. La solicitud del préstamo es para inversión de su negocio, ya que desea mejorar la infraestructura del local donde vende nacatamales y así poder mejorar la atención que ofrece a sus clientes. Espera que con este negocio pueda cumplir el sueño de poder educar a su hijo para que éste sea una persona de bien a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Yelba lives in the 3-80 neighborhood. She is is married and she is 47 years old. She has a 16-year-old son, who is in middle school. Her husband is a merchant and driver of his own taxi. Yelba's business is the sales of nacatamales (Honduran tamales). She started by selling soup on Sundays at her house, but she decided to make good use of her seasoning skills ans she started selling nacatamales two years ago. She plans to use the requested loan in her business, since she wants to improve the infrastructure of the place where she sells the nacatamales and to be able to improve the service to her clients. She hopes that with this business she will be able to her fulfill dream of being able to provide the education to her son so he can be a person of good to society.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the infrastructure of her business premises.

loans.name: Ngwe

texts.en:
A., popularly call Mami Fish, is a single mother with three children. She was not able to go to school because her parents were not able to pay her fees, so she had to drop out; her parents were not able to provide the family with food, clothing or other basics.

However, her friends encouraged her to join GHAPE in 2006. She used her first loan of $40 to start buying and selling palm wine, a locally made wine from Palm trees and commonly consumed by many people in the north-west province. She had some profits from these sales and was able to take a second loan in 2007, when she decided to expand to buying and selling food items such as Egusi, fish and onions.

With this loan she hopes to continue her business, buying and selling dried fish, onion and fresh tomatoes.

loans.use: To increase her food inventory, including fish, onions and fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Mrs. Yi N. is a villager in Kork Doung village in Takeo Province. She is 22 years old and the mother of a young child.  Her husband, Mr. Khun Kunthea, is a construction worker. She is a farmer and owns a small piece of land for cultivating rice. However, her field is infertile and she must hire laborers with oxen to plow her field. In order to deal with the field problem, Mrs. Yi N. requests a loan to buy fertilizers and hire laborers with oxen to plow herrice field.  Her husband is presented on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and hire laborers with oxen to plow the rice field.

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es:
En el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Ángela C. se dedica con mucho ahínco al negocio de venta de artículos plásticos los cuales comercializa en su propio tramo donde atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Ella es una dama soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres pequeños hijos en edades escolares. Es por este motivo que se esfuerza grandemente para brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. 
Hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los artículos plásticos con el propósito de comercializarlos en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the Central Market in the city of Chinandega, Mrs. Ángela C. eagerly sells plastic products, which she markets in her own section where she works every day, starting very early in the morning.

She is a single woman and is responsible for taking care of her three small children, who are in school. Because of this, she works very hard to offer her children the conditions necessary for their development. At this time, she is looking for the support of Ceprodel to get a loan so that she can buy plastic goods with the goal of selling them in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Patricia Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Patricia Maribel tiene 35 años de edad, es tesorera del Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor y vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió Técnica de Computación.  Se casó a los 23 años y tiene un hijo de 9 años que estudia en el colegio.
Su negocio consiste en la elaboración y venta de joyas de oro y de plata. Tiene un taller en su casa donde trabajan conjuntamente con su esposo, el trabajo es muy fino y artístico.
Con su primer crédito de S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, compró plata, para elaborar, aretes, sortijas y cadenas.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en material como oro de 18 quilates y plata.
Patricia sueña con tener una fábrica de joyas para poder tener una vida más holgada.
texts.en:
Mrs. Patricia Maribel is 35-years old, the treasurer for the community bank Unidas para un Futuro Mejor (‘United for a Better Future’), and lives in the Florencia de Mora district of the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad in Perú. She studied computer technology. She married at 23 and has a 9-year old son who is in school. Her business consists of making and selling gold and silver jewelry. She has a workshop in her house where she works with her husband; their work is very fine and artistic. With her first loan of 300 PEN, repaid in 4 payments, she bought silver to make into earrings, rings, and necklaces. With this loan of 1,700 PEN, to be repaid in 4 payments, she will invest in 18K gold and silver. Patricia dreams of having a larger jewelry factory to support a more comfortable life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of gold and silver to make jewelry

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa D. is a 33 year old trader. She is married with three children who are currently in school. She has sold used clothes through hawking for three years now, in order to take care of her family. With this business, she has been able to support one child's education, who is in the final year in the senior high school. Her major challenge over the years has been the lack of funds to increase her business. Yaa has lots of marketing experience and she is very confident that the loan would enable her to make remarkable business progress. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes and shoes of a greater variety to increase her inventory. She says her greatest joy would be when she is able to provide all her kids with a quality education to make them more resourceful in the future. She hopes to save enough to fulfill this dream of hers. Yaa belongs to a village bank called ‘Good name’. 

Yaa lives at Apatrapa, a suburb of Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Yaa is fortunate that her husband has built a two bedroom house. 

She hopes to receive a loan to make her business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more after taking care of the household.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Los Laureles 1 Group

texts.en:
The group 1 from the "Los Laureles" Bank of Hope, a group of 5 entrepreneurs, live in Los Alcarrizos, on the northwestern outskirts of Santo Domingo, the capital city. Pressina H. is the group coordinator. She is divorced and has no children.

Pressina, like many of the group members and the people who live in her area, is a Haitian inmigrant. She barely has elementary school education. Pressina sells clothes as her micro-business. Some of the other group members´ businesses are food stands and small grocery/convenience stores. Pressina hopes that taking loans to expand her merchandise and be able to satisfy a larger clientele will allow her to be financially independent one day and live in better conditions. She also hopes her business reaches a point where she makes enough profits to help others in need.

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: purchase a wider variety of clothes for sale

loans.name: Rous

texts.en: Rous N., 57, has a business renting rooms from her home and is able to make US$5 per day. Her husband stays at home and helps with the house work. Two of their children are wedding chefs. Rous N. would like to take out a loan to build additional rooms to rent out.

loans.use: To build more rooms to rent out

loans.name: Malakhat

texts.en:
Malakhat A. is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Eighteen years ago, she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available on their land for this business.

She is engaged in this business with her husband. Slowly, the number of calves increased and her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps, and for this reason is requesting a loan.

Become an important part of the growth of Malakhat’s business.

loans.use: Purchase calves.

loans.name: Esili M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 40 years old Esili M. from Kyela, married with five children between the ages of 12 and 25. Esili has been running a rice business since 2004. Working at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week, she currently earns about $100 a month and is now requesting a loan of $375 in order to purchase rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the variety of crops she sells. Esili thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk.

loans.name: Meira Okwong Betta Group

texts.en: Mrs. O. Betta is a married woman, aged 50 years. She has 9 children and 11 orphans. She has been making pancakes and frying ground nuts for over 20 years. She will use the loan to purchase ground nuts and cassava flour, sweet bananas and cooking oil for baking pancakes. With this loan, her business will expand. She is actively dreaming to purchase a bicycle.

loans.use: To purchase ground nuts and cassava flour, sweet bananas, cooking oil for baking pancakes.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is 44 years old and she is married with eight children. She sells provisions like toothpaste, tomato paste, etc. She is requesting a loan amount of 100,000 nairas to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more provisions

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia D. owns and operates a business making and selling a variety of food products in the local community. She is 44 years old, married and has four adult children. They are from the town of Opol, Misamis Oriental. Lelia has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support her children's education.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Séna

texts.fr: Cette dame habite avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier de nykonapoè qui est un quartier périphériques de la ville de Lomé, après une étude approfondie des besoins des résidents de ce quartier elle a débuté le commerce en détail d’eau en sachets appelés « PURE WATER ». Elle réalise de bons chiffres d’affaire tous les jours. Faisant face en ce moment à une rupture de stock elle sollicite pour se réapprovisionner de WAGES un crédit pour acheter  400 sachets d’eau « Pure Water ».
texts.en:
This is a woman who lives with her husband and children in Nykonapoè, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. Following an in-depth study of resident needs in this district, she started a retail business selling water in baggies called "PURE WATER". She realizes good sales figures everyday. Facing at this time an inventory shortage, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to stock up again with 400 baggies of "Pure Water" brand water.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy water in "PURE WATER" sachets

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 26 years old; she is married and the mother of one child who is schooling. She is determined to provide for her child through hard work and commitment.

To support her child, Evelyn has been selling cosmetics products like spray, powder, blushes, lipstick, etc. for four years now and sells through hawking (going door-to-door). She sells these cosmetics in the neighborhood to her loyal clients.

Evelyn buys her stock from Kumasi which is a nearby town. She says selling of cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory. This, she believes, will enable her make enough income to sponsor her child’s education and her business progress. She is so sure that your loan support will bring her to the desired results.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anora

texts.en:
Anora S. is from the village of Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Anora is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Anora owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, selling fish. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fish to local community members. Anora has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Anora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Anora is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Anora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase of additional fish to sell

loans.name: Erdenejargal

texts.en:
Erdenejargal D. is a 38-year-old teacher from Arhangai province in central Mongolia. In 2008, Erdenejargal started an auto repair shop with her husband. They purchased land in a good location and built a well-equipped workshop. Since then, their business has been very stable and they have many regular customers from their community.

Erdenejargal is married and the mother of three children. The older children, Batbulgan and Battungalag, attend a local secondary school. The family is socially open-minded, and they have a positive outlook on life.

Their business capital has increased from 200,000 tugrugs (~ $138 US) when they started their business to a current amount exceeding 600,000 tugrugs (~ $414 US). The success of the business has greatly improved the family's quality of life. Erdenejargal says, “As the business begins to operates more steadily, I plan to hand over control to my husband, so I can work as a teacher.” She is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 tugrugs (~ $900 US) to buy supplies for her auto repair business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her auto repair business

loans.name: Ich

texts.en: Ich S., 26, is a low-income person living in Siem Reap Province. She is a good mother who tries to determine her one lovely young child to attain the primary school. Ich S. currently plants a variety crop on her own land. Beside her farm work, she also goes with her husband to fish along the Tunle Sap River for extra profit. She retails her fish in retail in market after she finishes fishing, while her husband depends on fishing business. In addition, Ich S. plans to raise a few pig out of her home but she lacks capital. She is looking for a loan to buy pig-food and piglet for raising.

loans.use: To buy pig-food and piglet for raising

loans.name: Tserenbat

texts.en:
Tserenbat M., a 22-year-old single man, lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent home, in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. A very hard-working young man, he operates an auto spare-parts trading business in his town which he began in 2000 in partnership with his father with capital of 300,000 tugrugs ($210 USD) . After years of success and growth, Tserenbat went off on his own in 2008, and today, his working capital exceeds 1,500,000 tugrugs ($1,050 USD). From his business profits he bought a car, and he is now working hard to further grow his business.

As auto parts make up a large portion of his sales, Tserenbat hopes to take advantage of the rapidly-growing number of Mongolians who own cars. He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug ($1,750 USD) loan to purchase more machinery parts for his business. His dream is to one day own his auto parts store.

loans.use: To purchase more machinery parts

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: TATTEY Koku est un homme âgé de 61 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il habite à Kpadapé, un village situé à 10 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est un enseignant retraité. Avec ce crédit, il estimerait achever sa maison afin de ne plus payer les frais de location. Dans l’avenir, il rêve de construire une autre maison à AVENO.
texts.en:
Koku T. is a 61-year old man, he is married and is the father of 4 children. He lives in Kpadape, a village located about 10 kilometres from Kpalime. He is a retired teacher. With this loan would love to complete building his house, so that he will no longer have to pay rent. In the future, he dreams of building another house in Aveno.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete building and maintenace of his house.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar es una socia dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 59 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos mayores, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, es viuda desde hace mucho tiempo, pero siempre ha sabido salir adelante con su esfuerzo y dedicación al trabajo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal ”Mujeres Valientes” desde hace ocho años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en productos para la venta de menús.  Actualmente Pilar necesita un crédito de 1500 soles que le permitirá invertir una parte en arroz, aceite, azúcar, para la preparación de platos (comida) para vender y otra parte invertirá en la compra de madera para construir cuartos con el fin de alquilarlos. La meta de Pilar es terminar de construir los cuartos para poder alquilarlos y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Pilar is a dynamic woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 59 years old and the mother of three adult children and runs a small business selling food from her home. She has been widowed for a long time but through her hard work and dedication to her business, she has always managed to come out ahead. She has been a part of the communal bank “Mujeres Valientes” (Brave Women) for the past eight years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN (~$100 US), which she invested in items to add to her menu. Now Pilar needs a loan of 1,500 PEN ($525 US). She will use part of the money to buy rice, cooking oil, and sugar, which she will use to prepare food to sell to her customers. She will use the rest of the money to buy lumber in order to build small rooms that she can rent out. Pilar’s goal is to rent out the rooms in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food items and lumber

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a forty-one year old, married, mother of two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town. However, majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or major occupation alongside other trading activities. Agnes is trader. She trades in maize and other food items such as yams. She buys the goods from nearby communities and sells at the local market. She has been in this business for eleven years and wants a loan to purchase goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda tiene 44 años, vive junto a su esposo, quien es trabajador dependiente, y con sus 3 hijos que son estudiantes.
Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de embutidos (chorizos, salchichas, jamonadas entre otras variedades) y productos lácteos (yogur y queso), los cuales lleva a vender por los distintos lugares de su localidad, dejando al crédito o al contado a sus clientes
Adicionalmente, en su vivienda cuenta con 6 habitaciones que alquila desde hace un año atrás, y  esto hace para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. 
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conocer muchos lugares y relacionarse con muchas personas, además le es rentable porque ya cuenta con una lista de clientes regulares que le hacen pedido de sus productos constantemente.
Para el futuro, le gustaría implementar en su casa un ambiente para vender zapatos.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y se siente muy a gusto porque todos sus compañeros son personas responsables. Amanda invertirá el 50% del dinero que ahora solicita en su negocio de venta de embutidos y productos lácteos; con la otra parte mandará a refaccionar algunas de las habitaciones que alquila en su casa.
texts.en:
Amanda, 44, lives with her husband, who is a salesclerk, and their three children, who are students. For the last two years she has sold cured meats {chorizo (cured pork sausage, flavoured with paprika), sausages, ham for sandwiches, among other varieties} and dairy products (yoghurt and cheese) which she takes to the various areas of the city to sell, both for cash and credit, to her customers. In addition, her house has six rooms which she has rented for the last year; she does this to help her husband defray household expenses. What she likes most about her job is to get to know various places and people. Besides, it's profitable because she has a list of regular customers who always place orders with her. For the future, she would like to set up a space in her home to sell shoes. This is her first loan with MFP. She is a member of a communal bank and is very comfortable there because all her fellow members are responsible persons. Amanda will invest half of the money in her cured meats sales and will use the other half to refurbish some of the rooms she rents in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and refurbish rental rooms.

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos Group

texts.en:
Ninita is the coordinator of her group Unidos Venceremos (United we will overcome), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in an agricultural community based around the sugarcane industry on the outskirts of La Romana, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their four children.

Ninita is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans without problems. She plans to use this loan to invest in her "colmado" (a small corner store which sells the basic necessities) by purchasing rice, beans, sugar and soda to sell to her clients. She will use the profits to continue investing in her business, with the goal of creating a larger more sustainable business that will provide a steady stream of income for her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Rice, sugar, flour, soda and beans to sell in her cornerstore

loans.name: Cossiba Victorine

texts.fr: G. Cossiba Victorine est née le 02 Mai 1965 à Bopa au Bénin. Victorine est mariée à AMOUSSOU Félix un entrepreneur. Le couple a deux enfants, qui sont tous scolarisés. Victorine vit avec ses enfants à Cococodji non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Victorine est dans ce quartier depuis environs 5 ans. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Victorine n’a pas été à l’école, mais a appris la coiffure. Victorine exerce ce métier depuis 4 ans. Victorine vend aussi dans son atelier, des produits cosmétiques, des bijoux, des mèches et aussi des tissus. C’est à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Victorine s’approvisionne. Dans le but de renforcer son activité afin de mieux satisfaire la demande des clients, Victorine sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Cossiba Victorine G. was born on May 02, 1965 in Bopa in Benin. Victorine is married to Felix Amoussou a businessman. The couple have two school aged children. Victorine lives with their children in Cococodji, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Victorine has lived in this neighborhood for about 5 years. Together, the couple support the needs of their family. Victorine has not attended school but has studied the hair dressing trade. Vistorine has practiced this trade for 4 years. She also sells products from her salon such as cosmetics, jewelery, hair pieces and fabrics. Victorine buys her products from Lome in Togo, a country neighboring Benin and also from Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. To strengthen her business and better satisfy the needs of her clientele, Victorine is requesting this first loan from ALIDe.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 cartons of cosmetics, 2 dozen hair pieces, 15 pieces of fabric and jewelery

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es: EL señora Javier Antonio C., tiene 41 años de edad, es soltero y habita en el barrio San Pedro, tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 8 años los dos actualmente estudian el señor C. trabaja arduamnete para poder ofrecerles a sus hijos la educacion, el señor es agricultor desde hace 6 años, el señor comenzo trabajando en este rubro gracias a la ayuda que su patrona le ofrecio él le cuida el cultivo y con su trabajo honrado y responsable se  ha ganado su confianza tanto asi que la señora le ofrecio unas tierras para que él las trabaje y se sustente, con el tiempo se ha visto con dificultades de plagas que amenazan con su cosecha, es por esta razon que solicita esta ayuda y con ella comprara fertilizates y fungicidas que le aseguren la produccion de limon, tiene pensado que esta inyeccion de capital a largo plazo le traera los recursos necesarios para comprar su propio terreno y poder birndarles la estabilidad necesaria a su familia.
texts.en:
Javier Antonio C. is 41 and single. He lives in the San Pedro neighborhood. He has two children, 15 and 8, who go to school. Mr. C. works arduously to be able to give his children an education. He has been a farmer for six years. He started working in this field thanks to help that his boss offered him. He takes care of the crops. Through his honorable and responsible work he has won her confidence. She offered him some land so that he could work it and support himself. With the passage of time he has seen some difficulties from plaques that threaten the harvest. That is the reason he is asking for help. With the loan he will buy fertilizers and fungicides that will assure the lemon production. He thinks that in the long run this injection of capital will bring the necessary resources to buy his own land. Then he will be able to provide his family with the necessary stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural materials

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento "SAN MIGUEL" se encuentra en su 5º ciclo, todas las socias viven en la zona de San Miguel, tienen puestos de venta de comida internets y tiendas de barrio, Es un grupo responsable y solidario.

Como presidenta esta la señora Magda ella vende carne, tiene su tienda de barrio, y tambien vende almuerzos al medio dia, ella tiene un hijo que ya esta casado, es muy responsable y lider en su grupo, el dinero lo utiliza en compra de abarrotes para su tienda.

Como tesorero esta Andres quien tiene su taller de publicidad en el centro de la ciudad es casado no tiene hijos y conoce muy bien el manejo del dinero , el dinero lo utiliza para mejoramiento de su taller

Como sesretaria esta la señora Angelica la señora es casada tiene 6 hijos, su esposo es cerrajero, es responsable asiste a todas las reuniones y el dinero quese presta es para el negocio del esposo.						
						
Todas las integrantes del banco de emprendimiento son responsables trabajan casi todo el dia para mantener a sus familias ya que muchos tienen hijos que todavia estan en edad escolar y estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianz brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The San Miguel Communal Bank is in its fifth cycle. All of the members live in the San Miguel region. They have stands that sell food, internet access, and neighborhood stores. It is a responsible and united group. Magda is the president. She sells meat. She has a neighborhood store, and she also sells lunch at midday. She has a son who is married. She is very responsible; and she is the leader of the group. She will use the money to buy groceries for her store. Andres is the treasurer. He has an advertising shop in the center of the city. He is married, but he does not have children. He knows how to manage money very well. He will use the money to improve his shop. Angelica is the secretary. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a locksmith. She is responsible, and she attends all of the meetings. The borrowed money is for her husband’s business. All of the members of the communal bank are responsible. They work almost all day to support their families. Many of them have children who are still school-age. They are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and merchandise

loans.name: Jappo Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Jappo Liggey  ou en français  « MAIN DANS LA MAIN POUR TRAVAILLER »  est un groupement féminin qui regroupe en son sein 5 femmes commerçantes toutes habitantes dans le quartier Angle Serigne Fallou de Thiès une ville située à 70 Kms de Dakar. Il a été formé, il y’a tout juste un an,  et est  dirigé par la plus âgée Madame Mame Dior M. née en 1949. Pour le renforcement de leurs activités les membres de ce groupe souhaitaient un financement de 500 000 FCFA qu’elles vont se partager à part égale.
 Madame Mame Dior M. mère de 8 femmes est  très physique et dynamique. Elle  fait le commerce depuis plus de 40 ans et en a même acheté une maison avec les bénéfices générés par le   travail. Cependant, avec sa part de ce  prêt, 100 000 FCFA, Madame Mame Dior M. compte acheter divers produits pour son commerce. Elle veut acheter du melon, le melon récolté avec le projet de la GOANA (Grande Offensive  Agricole pour la Nourriture et l’Abondance) un projet mis en œuvre par le président  Abdoulaye Wade pour développer l’agriculture et faire face à la sécurité alimentaire. Cet investissement de Madame M. lui permettra de renforcer son travail et d’accroitre ses bénéfices. 
Quant aux autres  membres du groupe, elles sont : Madame Rama N. restauratrice dans son quartier depuis 18 ans, Madame Aminata D. vendeuse de cacahuètes et fruits au niveau de l’école élémentaire du quartier depuis 20 ans, Madame Ramatoulaye M. restauratrice devant le portail d’une école supérieure de la ville et Madame  Mame Néné D. vendeuse de sandwich, jus , habits et chaussures au niveau de son quartier.
texts.en:
"Jappo Liggey" (translated: Working Hand in Hand) is a women's group consisting of five women merchants who all live in the Angle Serigne Fallou neighborhood of Thiès, a town situated 70 km from Dakar. This group was formed just one year ago and is led by the oldest member, Mrs. Mame Dior M., who was born in 1949. In order to bolster their businesses, the members of this group would like a loan of 500,000 F CFA of which they are going to receive equal shares.

Mrs. Mame Dior M., the mother of 8 young women, is an energetic lady. She has been working as a merchant for more than 40 years and has even managed to buy a house out of the profits from her business. However, with her share of this loan, 100,000 F CFA, she plans to buy various items for her business. She wants to buy melons harvested by the project "Great Agricultural Campaign for Food and Abundance" which was instituted by President Abdoulaye Wade to expand agriculture and address the issue of food security. This investment of Mrs. M. will allow her to bolster her little business and increase her profit.

As for the other members of the group, they are: Mrs. Rama N. who has been serving cooked food in her neighborhood for 18 years, Mrs. Aminata D. who has been selling roasted peanuts and fruit at the elementary school for 20 years, Mrs. Ramatoulaye M., who sells cooked food outside a high school in town, and Mrs. Mame Néné D. who sells sandwiches, juice, clothing, and shoes in her neighborhood.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: re-stock their businesses

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a 45 year old mother of three children who go to school. She has been running “Hellys Dressmaking” Shop dealing in tailoring and dressmaking. She has been in business for 13 years and she has been doing well. She says that since joining Faulu Kenya, her business has grown tremendously. She is requesting for a loan of Kes. 80,000 to add stock of fabric for her business. She hopes to become a designer and own a dressmaking school as well as produce high quality products. She describes herself as hardworking, focused and visionary.

loans.use: Add stock of fabric

loans.name: Khoudia

texts.en:
Khoudia D. is a 26-years-old women from the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She is married and is the mother of five children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for three years and has always paid back her loans on time.

Khoudia D. raises sheep which she sells at the grand agricultural market of nearby Bambey. She will use this loan to buy more sheep. The revenues from selling them at the market allow her to improve the living conditions of her young family.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep

loans.name: Adebola

texts.en: Adebola is 45 years old and married with four children. Her husband also works to support their home. Her children are excelling in school, and this gives her joy. She is a friendly and hardworking woman. To make a living in Ibadan, Oyo State, she sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She has a stall where she sells her groceries. Her customers are usually friends and residents. In the future, she hopes to own a supermarket. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 70,000 NGN in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Kigumba Bakyara Group

texts.en:
T. Mathias is an ever-optimistic 42-year-old teacher who is married and the father of four. He operates a modest retail business in Kigumba-Rwensiga, Kyenjojo district. With a business longevity spanning seven years, he has reason to smile. With this business he has managed to significantly sustain and improve on his family’s welfare.

To all appearances, Mathias’ future business prospects look rosy. With close to 50,000 shillings coming in every week from his business, he envisions an even greater profit once he can obtain this loan. He anticipates being in a position to buy more merchandise for his retail shop once he acquires this loan.

Mathias belongs to a group of eleven members who hold each other accountable and insure each other in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Pascal Comlan

texts.fr: Y. Pascal Comlan est né le 17 Mai 1969 et est marié à HODEHOU Valérie. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. C’est depuis son jeune âge que Pascal Comlan réside au quartier Xwlacodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où il vit avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple supporte ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Pascal Comlan n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Depuis environs cinq ans, Pascal Comlan vend de l’huile de palme par le système de distribution ; ce qui lui permet d’assurer les charges qui lui incombent. Pascal Comlan s’approvisionne à Kpondave au Bénin. C’est un ancien client de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre prêts qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d’augmenter son stock de produits et de pouvoir mieux répondre à la forte demande de sa clientèle, Pascal Comlan sollicite un autre prêt.
texts.en:
Pascal Comlan Y. was born on May 17, 1969. He is married to Valérie Houdehou. The couple has four children who all attend school. Since a very young age, Pascal Comlan has been a resident of the neighborhood of Xwalacodji in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where he lives with his children and wife. The parents provide together for their family. Pascal Comlan never attended school. Pascal Comlan has been selling palm oil through the distribution system for about five years. This enables him to pay for his expenses. Pascal Comlan gets his supplies in Kpondavé in Benin. He is a long-standing customer with Alidé and has already been granted four loans which he has repaid on schedule. He wants to increase his inventory and better meet the high demand from his customers. This is why Pascal Comlan applies for another loan.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm oil

loans.name: Tumuai

texts.en:
Tumuai  S. is 48 and married with four children (ages 14 - 21).  She is starting a business, planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Tumuai needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Tumuai  joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tumuai 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Reyna Elizabeth

texts.es: Reyna Elizabeth tiene 24 años, su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que tiene esta actividad, Pero antes de que ella tuviera su negocio, no tenía trabajo pero con ciertos ahorros decide quedarse en una casa comercial, en donde ella ofrece los diferentes productos por catálogos, así es como ella empieza a ganarse la vida y realzar un sin número de visitas a todas las personas que conoce a pesar que los recorridos son largo mantiene la esperanza de que mejorar sus situación. El crédito será para la compra de cremas, colonias, tratamientos, ropa interior y otras cosas. su deseo es seguir con este negocio.
texts.en:
Reyna Elizabeth is 24-years-old. She sells cosmetics. She's done this for more than 3 years. Before starting her business she didn't have work, but with some savings she decided to set up in a commercial center, where she offers various products from catalogs. That's how she started making a living. She's been making countless sales visits to everyone she knows, and even though the trips are long she maintains hope that this work will improve her situation. The loan will be for the purchase of creams, colognes, beauty treatments, underwear, and other things. She hopes to maintain this business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Keila

texts.es:
Keila H. García   es una joven  de 25 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Desde niña Keila se levantaba todos los días a las 4.30 am de la mañana para poder ordeñar las vacas de su familia.  Por lo que la lechería ha sido parte de su vida siempre. Asegura que en su comunidad hay bastante demanda la leche que producen sus vacas puesto que ha sido el negocio con el cual sus padre ha podido mantener la familia. Ahora ella quiere tener su propio negocio y que con mas vacas podría aumentar la producción y así sacar más provecho de sus habilidades. 

Es por eso que Keila desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢641,000 (seiscientos cuarenta y un mil  colones) para comprar 5 vacas mas  y poder hacer crecer  su negocio y así comprar la casita de sus sueños 

Keila   es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Keila H. García is a young woman who is 25 years old. She lives with her husband in a community called Hernández, which is in Los Chiles, Alajuela province. This community is noted for its mountains, great landscapes, and high humidity; in addition, it is on the road very close to the northern border of our country. Major economic activities are ranching and agriculture. Specifically, they grow basic grains, tubers and oranges. Since she was a girl, Keila rose every day at 4:30 in the morning to milk the family cows because dairy farming has always been a part of her life. She assures us that there is plenty of demand in her community for the milk of her cows, and, indeed, her parents used dairy farming to support their family. Now, Kelia wishes to have her own business, and with more cows, she would be able to increase production and take advantage of her experience and skill. For this reason, Kelia wishes to obtain a small loan of 641,000 colones ($1,200), with which she will buy five more cows and expand her business. She hopes that this expansion will allow her to buy the small house of her dreams. Kelia is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo (Group of Communal Credit United for Development), one of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her second loan, and she hopes to prosper personally and economically.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase five cows

loans.name: Yanina Miluska

texts.es:
Al visitar al  banco comunal “Virgen de Copacabana” entrevistamos a la socia Yanina. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina de atención de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. 

Yanina, tiene 35 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos (Adriana de once años que estudia en el colegio y Angela de cuatro años que está en el jardín). Yanina nació  en la ciudad de Cusco y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo donde tiene un pequeño bar llamado “AYNI”. Ella tiene un bar y lo atiende una persona contratada, la atención del bar es todos los días de 4:30 de la tarde hasta de 2 a 3 de madrugada. Yanina también tiene un bazar donde vende ropa para niños, para caballeros, para damas y también vende juguetes, peluches, perfumes, aretes, collares, etc. 
Yanina es una persona carismática, alegre y responsable. Ya son varios años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien gracias a la puntualidad de sus pagos, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo ropa para abastecer su bazar. 

Actualmente, Yanina vive en la casa de su mamá pero su anhelo es comprarse una casa y un carro último modelo.
texts.en:
During our visit to the communal bank "Virgen de Copacabana" we interviewed the partner Yanina. The communal bank meetings are every thirty days in the city business office of Ollantaytambo. Yanina is 35-years-old, married, and has two children (Adriana, 11, who's in school, and Angela, 4, who's in nursery school). Yanina was born in the city of Cusco, and currently she lives in the city of Ollantaytambo, where she has a small bar called "AYNI". She has one employee. The bar's hours are everyday from 4:30 p.m. to 2 or 3 in the morning. Yanina also has a bazaar where she sells clothes for children, men, and women; she also sells toys, stuffed animals, perfumes, earrings, necklaces, etc. Yanina is a charismatic, happy, and responsible person. She's participated in the communal bank for several years, and it's going well for her because she pays her loans back punctually. She requires this loan to buy merchandise such as clothing for her bazaar. Currently Yanina lives in a house with her mother, but she hopes to buy her own home and a new car.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as clothing for her bazaar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy products to make the refreshments like: cocoa, soy, cinnamon, sugar, seeds and coca-cola.

loans.name: Ozodahon's Group

texts.en: Ozodahon S. is the leader of this group. She is 27 and divorced. She works as a seller of Oriflame cosmetics. She also owns some land and cultivates different fruits and vegetables. Selling some part of her harvest, Ozodahon makes 4,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase fertilizers which are needed for farming. Barno M., 38, is married. Her husband went to work in Russia to earn some money. She has two sons and two daughters. All the children study at school except the youngest daughter. Barno owns some land on which she cultivates cotton and rice. She has been doing this for 16 years. Selling some part of her harvest, she makes 4,000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan, she wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for growing cotton and rice. In the future she plans to build a new house for her older son. Dilfuzahon A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 37 and divorced. She has a son and a daughter and both of them are at school. Two years ago, with the initial investment of 300 soms, Dilfuzahon started to sell convenience goods at her home, saved some money and then opened a kiosk near her house. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase various goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. Mamura R. is 25. She has been working in a sewing workshop for two years. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a sewing machine. In the future she plans to open her own sewing workshop. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Soro Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Soro Yiriwa (sont toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur cinquième  prêt. Tous les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués. 
Elles vendent divers  produits  qui sont entre autres des oranges avec MARIAM C..  
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter, 3 chargements de charrette  en oranges. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants de SIKASSO et au grand marché de Médine (Sikasso ville). 
Les oranges sont vendues au marché de Ouayerma et à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
Elle envisage réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne.
Elle ambitionne  avoir son propre magasin au marché afin de mieux  satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The six women of the Soro Yiriwa group are all married and average 38 years of age with an average of four children each. The majority of them live in monogamous families in Ouayerma II, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They are working the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy their customers' needs, and they are on their fifth loan. All the previous loans have been repaid in full. They sell various products, including oranges, which Mariam C. sells. With her new loan, she is planning to buy three barrow loads of oranges. She gets her supplies in Sikasso's neighboring villages and at the large market in Médine (Sikasso town). The oranges are sold at the market in Ouayerma and at home to a customer base made up of men and women, mostly for cash. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 22,500FCFA, of which part will be used for family needs and the rest saved. Her ambition is to have her own shop in the market in order to better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits

loans.name: Meak

texts.en:
As everybody knows, fish paste is the main ingredient that Cambodian people use for cooking. Mrs. Meak S. became a fish trader in 1990. She always buys fresh fish and turns them into fish paste to either sell inside the market or around her community. She was busy at her business activities when the photo was taken, so her husband is pictured instead.

In addition to her business, Meak S. and her husband always take time to cultivate a rice crop during the farming season. They have eight children: two are already married and have started new homes, while the others are single.

Meak S. is concerned that her current income is not very much as her business has come to a low capacity due to insufficient capital. She wishes to increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits. This is why she has decided to ask for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits

loans.name: Eliana Maricela

texts.es:
Eliana S. tiene 20 anos. Es casada y vive con su esposo en el Cantón de San Pablo en la Provincia Bolívar.

Eliana es socia del grupo ¨Integracion Microempresarial¨ de San Pablo de Atenas. Son 14 socios en total, la mayoría que se dedican a diferentes actividades como comercio, negocios, y agricultores como fuente de ingreso a sus familias.

Eliana se dedica a un negocio de ventas de helados, que ya tenido por los ultimos 2 anos. También hace recargas telefónicas. Hace las compras y ventas de sus productos en las tiendas de San Pablo. 

Solicita el crédito para avanzar en su negocio de vender helado y de hacer recargas de PORTA, una impresa telefonica. El credito le ayudaria en poder avanzar y hacer mas cosas en su negocio. 

Le gusta planificar las cosas que va a hacer en su negocio y hacer ejercicios.
texts.en:
Eliana S. is 20 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband in Cantón de San Pablo in Bolívar province.

Eliana is a member of the "Integracion Microempresarial" ("Microenterprise Integration") group in San Pablo de Atenas.  There are 14 members total, most of whom work in activities like commerce, business, or agriculture in order to provide income for their families.

For two years, Eliana has had a business selling ice creams and popsicles.  She also sells cell phone cards.  She buys and sells her products in the stores of San Pablo.

She is requesting this loan to advance her business of selling frozen desserts, as well as cell phone cards for PORTA, a phone company.  This loan will help her to advance and to offer more things in her business.

She likes exercising and planning what she will do with her business.

loans.use: to advance her business, which is selling frozen desserts and PORTA (a phone company) cell phone cards

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 43 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a dos hijas en edad escolar en casa de una hermana ubicada en una zona marginal del distrito de Reque. A más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, especialmente aves de corral. Ella vende gallinas y patos en la parte posterior del domicilio donde reside. Cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y negociantes que frecuentan la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente prepara comida para ofrecerla en venta a los trabajadores campesinos de la zona. Con estos ingresos ella trata de sacar adelante a sus hijas.

Elena desea arreglar sus corrales para adquirir más animales y así ampliar su negocio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

Elena tiene como meta a largo plazo instalar un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio ya que considera que con este negocio puede sacar adelante a sus menores hijas.
texts.en:
Elena is 43 years old. She is separated and lives with her two school-aged daughters in her sister's house, which is located in the district of Reque. It is more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She works raising and selling small animales, especially birds. She sells hens and ducks out of the back of her home. When her animals have reached the proper stage of development she sells them to her neighbors and businesses that frequent the area where she lives. Additionally, she prepares  meals to sell to farm workers in the area. With the income from her sales she tries to help her improve her children's lives. 

Elena hopes to fix her animal pens and thus grow her business. Her need led her to apply for her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 new soles, which will allow her to make the repairs. 

Elena's long-tern goal is to build a small restaurant in her home because she believes that this kind of business could allow her to help her daughters more.

loans.use: Arreglar sus corrales para adquirir más animales

loans.name: Marrieta

texts.en:
Marrieta C. is a married woman who lives in Proper Maricalum, Barangay Maricalum, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  a general store, farming and a pig fattening business. Her husband, Rodrigo C., who is 52 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have nine children who are 11 to  29 years old. 

Marrieta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marrieta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 14,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $214, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 7th cycle loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy feed for the pigs and inventory for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Marrieta C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu K., age 52, established a business in 2000 selling gara lappers, bedding, and other such items. She began her business to increase her income, raise her profit, and improve her family's standard of living. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

She would like to obtain a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to add more stock and to buy raw materials for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Kadiatu K. plans to establish a savings account and educate her children to university level. She also wants to use part of her profit to support her husband, with whom she has six children, aged 10, 15, 17, 20, 23, and 25. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because she educates her.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add more stock and to buy more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 77 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposa Yolanda de 64 años; y juntos buscan para salir adelante. Desde hace 15 años, este emprendedor hombre se dedica a la atención en su puesto  de comestibles, que tiene en el  mercado de su zona. Esta muy satisfecho pues el negocio es tranquilo y lo desempeña con la ayuda de su esposa; quien atiende cuando él debe salir; además las ganancias son regulares. Manifiesta que esta labor le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos; y ahora que ellos tienen sus propias familias; su esposa y él pasan sus días trabajando y entreteniéndose en el negocio de venta de comestibles. Esta muy contento pues el tiempo que tiene en el mercado le ha permitido ganar buenos clientes que lo prefieren por la frescura y buenos precios de sus productos. Como es muy trabajador para el futuro tiene planeado aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que ofrece y de esta manera continuar adelante. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. José tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería que necesita para surtir mejor su negocio y de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en: Jose, 77, lives in a home he owns with his wife Yolanda who is 64, together they hope to get ahead. 15 years ago this entrepreneur started working in his grocery store, located in the market of the area.  He is happy because it's a steady business and his wife helps him with it when he has to be out, the income is steady.  This business has allowed him to get his children ahead, and now they have their own families, he and his wife spend the day working at the business of grocery sales.  He is very happy because the time he has been at the market has allowed him to make good clients that prefer his products for their freshness and good prices.  He is very hardworking and plans to increase the amount of merchandise offered to continue ahead.  This is the third loan with MFP and he promises to make his payments punctually because he doesn't want to disappoint the people that made possible this loan that will allow him to continue working in search of progress.  Jose plans to invest the loan in buying M. merchandise to stock the business.

loans.use: Buy several products to stock his store.

loans.name: El Gran Esfuerzo 3, 5 Group

texts.en:
Yanet P. is one of the members of the El gran esfuerzo ("the great effort") 3 & 5 Group located in the city of Hato Mayor, a primarily agricultural region. It is one of the most rural cities in the Dominican Republic where there are often drinking water and electricity shortages. The population of this area is comprised of Dominicans and Haitian immigrants. She operates a little underwear store.

Yanet is a single mom of one child and she lives with her parents. She tells us that her biggest challenge is to have her own house. Her favorite activity is tending to her business and work.

Yanet is very excited to receive her fourth loan through Esperanza Internacional, after having successfully repaid her previous loan. This was a step toward making her business grow. She has had her business for about two years. She started with a small amount of savings she had. She plans to invest this new loan into purchasing various types of underwear. She plans to use her profits to invest in her business and save to build her house and buy a car as soon as her business improves. Her dream is to have a house and to live quietly in it with her family.

loans.use: To buy more underwear to sell

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun S. is 37 years old.  Her husband, Mr. Ay Norng, is 47 years old (pictured together).  They have been married since 1991 and have four children – three sons and one daughter, two have full-time employment and other two are in school. They are living living along National Road Number 1, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. 

Savoeun has been operating a laundry business at her home for three years. Her husband has been a construction worker for two years. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to get to work

loans.name: René

texts.es:
El señor René M. K., trabaja como colector de impuesto, cobrándoles a los comerciantes del Mercado Oriental de Managua desde hace 3 años.
Es casado con 3 personas a su cargo que dependen de él lleva 4 crédito en CEPRODEL los que ha pagado en tiempo y forma, este crédito lo solicita para los gastos de medicina de una hija que tiene 26 años de edad y padece de Leucemia y otra hija que tiene Diabetes, ambas tienen que tomar medicamentos costosos y alimentos especiales permanentemente, y por otro lado tiene incurrir en gastos de colegiatura para el período 2011.
texts.en:
Mr. René M. K. has worked as a tax collector at the Eastern Market of Mangua for three years.

He is married with three dependents, and he has had four loans from CEPRODEL which he has paid on time and in full. He will use this loans to cover medical expenses for two of his daughters. One daughter, 26, has Lukemia and another suffers from diabetes. They both require expensive medicine to treat their illnesses as well as special diets. Additionally, Mr. M. K. must pay high school enrollment fees for the 2011 school year for his dependents.

loans.use: Medical expenses and school fees

loans.name: Maria Delia

texts.es: Maria Delia tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos y solamente uno está a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de repostería. La ubicación es en su casa de habitación, por lo que sus inicios fueron con muy pocos productos y poco a poco fue que comenzó a cocinar y así fue que obtuvo este medio de vida. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de huevos, harina, mantequilla, queso entre otras cosas necesarias para la elaboración. Ella sueña con mantener siempre su negocio y obteniendo más clientes.
texts.en: Maria Delia is 43 years old.  She is a single mother and has 2 children, only one of whom is still in her care.  Her business is baking and selling pastries and desserts from her home.  When she started out, she had very few products but she gradually started baking and settled in this line of business.  She will use her loan to buy eggs, flour, butter, cheese and other supplies that she needs to make her products.  She dreams of always having her business and attracting more customers.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 58-year-old married man and the father of two school-aged children. He is from Lebanon. He has worked in a local food company since 2002. He cooperates with his wife who owns an accessories shop to satisfy the family needs.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay for his children's education. In that way, he will avoid facing financial problems with the school management and permit his children to pursue their education peacefully.

loans.use: to pay for his children's education

loans.name: Conny Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Conny Isabel D. L. ella es trabajadora activa de la entidad estatal, desempeñándose como Técnico en Laboratorio  tiene Veinte y un   años  de trabajar para esta institución  es casada actualmente, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Conny Isabel D. L. is currently employed by a state agency as a lab technician. She has been working for this institution for 21 years. Conny is married and currently has two children in school.

She has received seven loans from CEPRODEL and each one was used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks and other items to expand and improve her home. The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit because they have enabled her to improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for home improvements

loans.name: Doan's Group

texts.en:
Doan T. C. is 48 years old with three children who are in high school.  Growing up in Tam Giang commune where rice growing culture is very popular, she has a lot of experience in doing farming especially in growing rice and tomatoes. Every year, she can  get 8 millions VND profit from selling these agricultural products. Her  business has  strongly developed since she  began having loans from our  credit program  in 2008. Her loan size has gotten bigger over the years. Now she wants to have  a loan  of 7,392,000 VND to buy five more pigs to raise

 Pha T. N.  is  a 34-year-old farmer. She has run VAC form  which is a mixed farming activity including growing rice, raising chickens, catching fish and has made considerable profit  for many years. She wants to borrow  7,392,000 VND to buy  feed for chickens.

 De T. N. is 28 years old. She is raising  12 pigs for meat. She needs to have  a loan of 7,392,000 VND to improve her pigpen.

 Be T. N. is 44 years old. She also is raising 10 pigs for meat. She wants to  borrow 6,496,000 VND to buy  feed for them.

 Gia T. N. is 48 year old. She is growing corn and vegetables in a paddy of 3,600 square meters. She needs to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy five more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda nació en el departamento del Cusco y tiene 28 años de edad. Actualmente,  Nilda vive en la ciudad imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una madre responsable que se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella nos cuenta que viaja a la ciudad de desaguadero para comprar ropa y después en la ciudad del cusco distribuye su ropa a la vendedoras de diferentes mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo ropa para  niños, damas y caballeros. 

Nilda es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Ana Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Nilda was born in the department of Cusco and is 28 years old. Currently, Nilda lives in the Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Peru). She is a responsible mother who works selling clothing. She says that she travels to the city of Desaguadero to buy merchandise and then to the city of Cusco to distribute her clothing to different merchants across Cusco's various markets.

At this time, Nilda needs a loan to increase her business' capital. She would like to buy more merchandise, such as clothing for men, women, and children.

Nilda is a responsible person who belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Ana Jarvis III" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as clothing for men, women, and children

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es: El sr. José, vive la zona de Molle Molle, vive en casa propia, su esposa tiene una tienda de barrio donde ofrece variedad de productos es una tienda muy surtida, tienen 4 hijos que están en el colegio, el sr. José es muy conocido en su trabajo el es transportista de una  línea de minibús de sacaba,  trabaja de lunes a sábado los domingos se dedica a su familia, es una familia muy trabajadora y muy unida, el préstamo lo destinara para el tapizado de asientos de su minibús , ya e están muy gastados y hará el cambio de todos los asientos, el deseo del Sr. José es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales,   esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
José lives in his own home in Molle Molle district.  His wife has a neighborhood store where she sells a variety of products.  It is a very well-stocked store.  They have four children who are all in school.  José is very well known in his work.  He is a driver on a Sacaba minibus line.  He works from Monday to Saturday and devotes Sundays to his family.  His is a very hard-working and united family.  

José will use his loan to upholster the seats in his minibus since they are very worn.  He will change all the seats.  José's wish is to see his children become professionals.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to upholster the seats in his minibus

loans.name: Bonifacia Teodolinda

texts.es: La señora Bonifacia  Teodolinda R. de 40 años,  casada con cuatro hijos, tres de ellos estudian.  Se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos como leche y queso todos los días reparte sus productos desde muy temprano ella se encarga de repartir en la aldea donde viven mientras que su esposo sale en su bicicleta a repartir sus productos en los pueblos cercanos como  Santiago y San Lucas  por lo cual no genera gastos adicionales de transporte. Ahora cuenta con doce vacas y dos crías trabaja en conjunto con su esposo que le ayuda a ordeñar las vacas y a darles de comer todos los días, no se preocupan por el espacio para sus animales ya que cuentan con un amplio terreno que está en la parte trasera de su  casa para poder cuidarlas  mejor , viene desempeñando esta labor  ya un poco mas de 10 años por lo cual  cuenta con amplio conocimiento de su labor, ahora necesita otro crédito para comprar otro ganado para extender la producción de la leche y queso ya que como ella cuenta gracias a Dios ya tienen una clientela a la que le surte sus productos,  ella desea seguir ayudando económica mente en su hogar y darle estudio a sus hijos porque es lo más importante asegura ella
texts.en: Señora Bonifacia  Teodolinda R. is 40 years of age.  She is married with four children, three of whom are students.  She is dedicated to the sale of milk products such as milk and cheese.  Every day she distributes her products from very early in the morning.  She takes charge of distributing in the village where they live while her husband leaves on his bicycle to distribute their products in the nearby towns such as Santiago and San Lucas.  In this way he does not generate additional expenses for transportation.  Now she relies on twelve cows and two young calves.  She works as a group with her husband who helps to milk the cows and to feed them every day.  They do not worry about the space for their animals since they have an extensive plot of land that is at the rear part of their house in order to be able to take care of their stock better.  She has been performing this work already for a little over 10 years, by which she has developed an extensive knowledge of the work.  Now she needs another loan to buy another cow to extend the production of milk and cheese, since, as she says, thanks to God they already have a clientele to which they supply their products.
